Sub-Section 5.4: Disciplinary Actions

❖ Clause 5.4.1: The KUCSA Disciplinary Committee may impose the following disciplinary actions for violations:

➢ Sub-clause 5.4.1.1: Written warning for minor infractions.

➢ Sub-clause 5.4.1.2: Temporary suspension from KUCSA activities for moderate violations.

➢ Sub-clause 5.4.1.3: Membership revocation for severe or repeated violations.

❖ Clause 5.4.2: Disciplinary actions will be proportional to the nature and severity of the violation, with a focus on maintaining KUCSA’s values and integrity.

❖ Clause 5.4.3: Members have the right to appeal any disciplinary action within 14 days of notification. Appeals must be submitted in writing to the KUCSA Appeals Committee.

Sub-Section 5.5: Appeals Process

❖ Clause 5.5.1: The KUCSA Appeals Committee shall review appeals objectively and provide a response within 30 days.

❖ Clause 5.5.2: Members are entitled to a fair appeal process, which includes the right to submit additional evidence or call upon witnesses.

❖ Clause 5.5.3: The decision of the Appeals Committee shall be final, and both the member and the Disciplinary Committee will be informed of the outcome in writing.

❖ Clause 5.5.4: In cases where new evidence surfaces after an appeal decision, the member may request a re-evaluation by the Appeals Committee.

Sub-Section 5.6: Reinstatement of Membership

❖ Clause 5.6.1: Members whose memberships have been revoked may apply for reinstatement after a minimum of one year, subject to the approval of the KUCSA Disciplinary Committee.

❖ Clause 5.6.2: Reinstatement applications must include evidence of corrective behavior and a commitment to adhere to KUCSA’s Code of Conduct.

❖ Clause 5.6.3: The Disciplinary Committee reserves the right to impose probationary conditions on reinstated members to ensure adherence to KUCSA standards.

Section 6: Membership Fees and Dues

Sub-Section 6.1: Annual Membership Dues

❖ Clause 6.1.1: All Ordinary Members shall pay an annual membership fee as determined by the KUCSA Finance Committee and approved by the General Assembly.

❖ Clause 6.1.2: Membership dues are payable at the start of each academic year and are non-refundable.

❖ Clause 6.1.3: Failure to pay dues within the specified deadline will result in suspension of membership privileges until dues are cleared.

❖ Clause 6.1.4: Membership fees are structured to reflect KUCSA’s commitment to inclusivity and affordability, ensuring that fees remain accessible to the majority of students.

❖ Clause 6.1.5: Changes to the annual membership dues must be communicated to all members at least 30 days prior to the start of the academic year.

❖ Clause 6.1.6: Special provisions may be made for members facing financial hardship, allowing them to request installment-based payments, subject to approval by the KUCSA Finance Committee.

Sub-Section 6.2: Special Fees for Events

❖ Clause 6.2.1: Members may be required to pay additional fees for specific events, such as conferences, seminars, and training workshops, as determined by the Executive Committee.

❖ Clause 6.2.2: Members experiencing financial hardship may apply for a waiver or discount on event fees, subject to approval by the KUCSA Finance Committee.

❖ Clause 6.2.3: Event fees are intended to subsidize costs and ensure the quality and accessibility of KUCSA programming for all members.

❖ Clause 6.2.4: Event fees shall be communicated to all members at least two weeks before the event to provide ample time for payment arrangements.

❖ Clause 6.2.5: KUCSA shall offer discounted or subsidized rates for certain events to student leaders, volunteers, and committee members in recognition of their contributions.

❖ Clause 6.2.6: A refund policy for event fees will be established for members who cancel attendance due to valid reasons, with the amount refunded dependent on the timing of cancellation and at the discretion of the KUCSA Finance Committee.

❖ Clause 6.3.1: Membership fees shall be allocated towards KUCSA’s operational costs, including event organization, resource procurement, and administrative expenses.

❖ Clause 6.3.2: The Finance Committee shall issue an annual report on the use of membership fees, presented to the General Assembly for transparency.

❖ Clause 6.3.3: A minimum of 10% of membership fees shall be set aside annually in a contingency fund for emergencies and unforeseen expenses.

❖ Clause 6.3.4: The Finance Committee shall ensure that at least 20% of membership fees is allocated towards activities that directly benefit the professional and academic development of members, such as workshops, mentorship programs, and conferences.

❖ Clause 6.3.5: An external audit of KUCSA’s finances, including membership fees and dues, shall be conducted annually to promote accountability and transparency.

❖ Clause 6.3.6: The contingency fund may only be accessed with prior approval from the Executive Committee and must be used exclusively for urgent matters that serve KUCSA’s mission and membership.

Sub-Section 6.4: Special Contributions and Voluntary Donations

❖ Clause 6.4.1: Members and supporters of KUCSA may make voluntary contributions or donations to support specific projects, activities, or causes organized by KUCSA.

❖ Clause 6.4.2: Voluntary donations are to be documented by the Finance Committee and designated for the specified purpose, where applicable.

❖ Clause 6.4.3: Donations made without a specific designation shall be added to the general KUCSA fund and allocated in accordance with the organization’s operational needs.

❖ Clause 6.4.4: The Finance Committee shall recognize contributors in annual reports and may provide additional acknowledgments based on donation size and purpose.

Sub-Section 6.5: Penalties and Late Fees

❖ Clause 6.5.1: Members who fail to pay their annual dues within the first 30 days of the academic year will be subject to a late fee, set by the Finance Committee.

❖ Clause 6.5.2: Members who have not cleared their dues, including any applicable late fees, by the end of the semester will be suspended from attending KUCSA events and participating in elections until dues are fully paid.

❖ Clause 6.5.3: The Finance Committee reserves the right to waive late fees for members facing verifiable financial difficulties, provided that an application is submitted within the designated timeframe.

❖ Clause 6.6.1: Membership fees shall be reviewed every two years by the Finance Committee to ensure that they remain fair, reasonable, and reflective of KUCSA’s operational needs.

❖ Clause 6.6.2: Any proposed adjustment to membership fees must be approved by a twothirds majority of the General Assembly and communicated to members at least 60 days in advance of implementation.

❖ Clause 6.6.3: Fee adjustments may consider inflation rates, increased program offerings, and feedback from KUCSA members regarding affordability.

Section 7: Membership Identification and Credentials

Sub-Section 7.1: Issuance of Membership Identification

❖ Clause 7.1.1: All members shall receive a KUCSA membership identification card, valid for the duration of their membership and updated annually.

❖ Clause 7.1.2: Membership cards shall contain the member’s name, institution, membership category, ID number, expiration date, and a unique QR code for electronic verification.

❖ Clause 7.1.3: Honorary members may receive a distinct honorary badge or certificate recognizing their status within KUCSA, along with a personalized note of appreciation from the Executive Committee.

❖ Clause 7.1.4: Membership identification cards shall include security features to prevent tampering and unauthorized duplication, such as holographic logos or watermarks.

❖ Clause 7.1.5: Digital identification may be made available through a secure KUCSA mobile application to allow members to access their credentials digitally.

❖ Clause 7.1.6: All identification cards remain the property of KUCSA and must be returned upon termination of membership.

Sub-Section 7.2: Use of Membership Credentials

❖ Clause 7.2.1: Members are required to present their membership identification when attending KUCSA-sponsored events, meetings, and activities as a verification of active membership.

❖ Clause 7.2.2: Membership credentials grant access to KUCSA resources, events, and benefits and should not be transferred, loaned, or misused in any manner.

❖ Clause 7.2.3: Members found misusing their credentials may face disciplinary action, including temporary suspension of membership privileges.

❖ Clause 7.2.4: The use of KUCSA credentials for personal or commercial gain, outside of KUCSA-approved events and activities, is strictly prohibited and may result in immediate termination of membership.

❖ Clause 7.2.5: Members are encouraged to report any observed misuse or fraudulent use of KUCSA credentials to the Disciplinary Committee.

❖ Clause 7.2.6: In cases where a member has legitimate reasons for not carrying physical identification, digital verification can be used, subject to pre-approval by the KUCSA administration.

Sub-Section 7.3: Replacement and Renewal of Membership Identification

❖ Clause 7.3.1: Lost or damaged membership cards may be replaced upon application and payment of a replacement fee, as determined by the Finance Committee. Members must report the loss or damage immediately to prevent misuse.

❖ Clause 7.3.2: Renewal of membership identification shall occur at the beginning of each academic year upon payment of membership dues, with the new ID card reflecting the updated expiration date.

❖ Clause 7.3.3: Any fraudulent activity related to membership identification, including falsification, transfer, or unauthorized duplication, will be grounds for immediate termination of membership and potential legal action.

❖ Clause 7.3.4: In cases where a member loses their card repeatedly, the Finance Committee may impose additional fees or require additional verification measures.

❖ Clause 7.3.5: Members who have renewed their membership but not received their updated ID card within 30 days should contact KUCSA support for assistance.

Sub-Section 7.4: Membership Verification and Security Measures

❖ Clause 7.4.1: KUCSA identification cards shall include a QR code linked to a secure database, allowing event staff to verify a member’s status in real time.

❖ Clause 7.4.2: KUCSA shall maintain a secure digital registry of all current members to aid in verification, accessible only to authorized staff for confidentiality.

❖ Clause 7.4.3: Members’ personal information, as it appears on their membership card, shall be used solely for identification purposes and protected under KUCSA’s data privacy policy.

❖ Clause 7.4.4: The KUCSA Security Team shall conduct periodic audits of the membership identification process to identify potential risks and strengthen security measures.

Sub-Section 7.5: Membership Privileges and Limitations Based on Identification

❖ Clause 7.5.1: Members with valid KUCSA identification are eligible to access exclusive events, scholarships, and networking opportunities available only to active members.

❖ Clause 7.5.2: Members without valid or updated identification may be denied entry to KUCSA-sponsored events or restricted from accessing member-exclusive content online.

❖ Clause 7.5.3: Certain KUCSA benefits, such as travel discounts or partner event access, require a member to present their identification to KUCSA-approved partners.

❖ Clause 7.5.4: Members who have lost their identification and are awaiting replacement may receive a temporary verification document upon approval by KUCSA’s administrative team.

Sub-Section 7.6: Identification for Special Membership Categories

❖ Clause 7.6.1: Honorary Members shall receive a distinct honorary badge, digital certificate, or other credentials recognizing their unique contributions or status within KUCSA, renewable based on the honorary membership’s validity.

❖ Clause 7.6.2: Alumni members may receive a distinct membership card or certificate indicating their ongoing support and affiliation with KUCSA.

❖ Clause 7.6.3: Members who have served in Executive positions may receive a “Distinguished Member” card in recognition of their contributions, valid indefinitely as an honorary credential.

❖ Clause 7.6.4: Special designation cards or credentials may be issued to committee members, event organizers, and volunteers for the duration of their specific roles, allowing for additional access privileges.

Section 8: Membership Suspension and Appeals Process

Sub-Section 8.1: Grounds for Membership Suspension

❖ Clause 8.1.1: Membership may be temporarily suspended if a member is found in violation of the Code of Conduct as outlined in Section 5, including but not limited to instances of harassment, discrimination, or disruptive behavior.

❖ Clause 8.1.2: Members who fail to pay required dues within the specified time frame will be suspended from all KUCSA privileges until outstanding dues are cleared, including a possible reinstatement fee as determined by the Finance Committee.

❖ Clause 8.1.3: Any member under investigation for misconduct, financial misappropriation, or other offenses shall have limited participation in KUCSA activities, pending the outcome of the investigation.

❖ Clause 8.1.4: Members engaged in any activities that harm KUCSA’s reputation,d isrupt official events, or violate KUCSA’s core principles may face immediate suspension, as determined by the Executive Committee.

❖ Clause 8.1.5: Membership may also be suspended if a member is found to have repeatedly violated organizational policies, including misuse of resources or unauthorized representation of KUCSA.

Sub-Section 8.2: Suspension Process

❖ Clause 8.2.1: Suspension recommendations shall be made by the KUCSA Disciplinary Committee following an initial review and investigation into the alleged violation.

❖ Clause 8.2.2: The Disciplinary Committee shall notify the member of the intended suspension, providing a summary of the findings, reasons for suspension, and any supporting evidence.

❖ Clause 8.2.3: A suspended member shall receive a formal notification, either in writing or via official email, detailing the reasons for suspension, the length of suspension, and the requirements for reinstatement.

❖ Clause 8.2.4: Suspended members shall have the right to a hearing with the Disciplinary Committee before final suspension, where they may present their case and respond to allegations.

❖ Clause 8.2.5: During suspension, the member shall forfeit all KUCSA privileges, including access to events, voting rights, and membership resources until the suspension period is completed or revoked.

Sub-Section 8.3: Appeals Process for Suspension and Termination

❖ Clause 8.3.1: Members wishing to appeal a suspension or termination decision must submit a written appeal to the KUCSA Appeals Committee within 14 days of receiving the suspension notice.

❖ Clause 8.3.2: The Appeals Committee shall review the appeal, considering statements from both the member and the Disciplinary Committee, and evaluate all relevant evidence.

❖ Clause 8.3.3: The Appeals Committee shall make a decision within 30 days of receiving the appeal, either upholding, modifying, or overturning the suspension or termination.

❖ Clause 8.3.4: The Appeals Committee’s decision shall be final and binding, and the member shall be informed in writing of the outcome, including any additional actions required.

❖ Clause 8.3.5: If reinstated, the member shall be granted full access to all KUCSA privileges immediately, and the suspension or termination record may be expunged from their membership record if the Appeals Committee so directs.

Sub-Section 8.4: Reinstatement and Probationary Period

❖ Clause 8.4.1: Suspended members who have completed their suspension period and met all terms of reinstatement may apply for membership reinstatement, subject to approval by the Executive Committee.

❖ Clause 8.4.2: Reinstated members may be placed on a probationary period of up to six months, during which any subsequent violation of KUCSA rules may result in permanent termination of membership.

❖ Clause 8.4.3: During the probationary period, reinstated members shall be monitored by the Disciplinary Committee and may be required to participate in community service or KUCSA activities as part of their reinstatement.

❖ Clause 8.4.4: Members who successfully complete the probationary period without further infractions shall be restored to full standing in KUCSA, with all privileges reinstated.

Sub-Section 8.5: Permanent Termination of Membership

❖ Clause 8.5.1: Membership may be permanently terminated if a member commits serious infractions such as financial fraud, harassment, or repeated violations of the Code of Conduct.

❖ Clause 8.5.2: In cases of permanent termination, the member shall be notified in writing of the reasons and provided with evidence supporting the decision, along with their right to appeal within the specified period.

❖ Clause 8.5.3: Permanently terminated members are barred from reapplying for KUCSA membership and are prohibited from attending KUCSA events or accessing any membership privileges.

❖ Clause 8.5.4: Terminated members may request a one-time hearing with the Appeals Committee to seek reconsideration under extenuating circumstances, such as new evidence or procedural errors in the original decision.

Sub-Section 8.6: Confidentiality and Transparency in Suspension and Appeals

❖ Clause 8.6.1: All suspension and appeals proceedings shall be conducted in strict confidentiality to protect the privacy of the individuals involved.

❖ Clause 8.6.2: Records of disciplinary actions, including suspensions and appeals, shall be stored securely by the Disciplinary Committee and may only be accessed by authorized personnel.

❖ Clause 8.6.3: An annual report on the number and types of disciplinary actions shall be presented to the General Assembly by the Disciplinary Committee, without disclosing members’ personal information, to maintain transparency.

❖ Clause 8.6.4: The Appeals Committee shall document all decisions made during the appeals process to ensure accountability and shall use these records for reference in future cases, maintaining consistency in the disciplinary process.

Article 3: Admission and Termination of Membership

Section 1: Admission Process

Sub-Section 1.1: Application Procedure for Membership

❖ Clause 1.1.1: Applications must be endorsed by the institution’s student council, providing a letter of recommendation.

➢ Sub-Clause 1.1.1.1: The letter of recommendation must attest to the applicant’s good standing within their institution and confirm they meet the eligibility criteria.

➢ Sub-Clause 1.1.1.2: The endorsement must be signed by an official representative of the institution’s student council, such as the chairperson or secretary-general.

❖ Clause 1.1.2: Prospective members must complete and submit the official KUCSA membership application form, available on the KUCSA website or through the student council.

➢ Sub-Clause 1.1.2.1: The application form must be completed with accurate information, including full name, student ID, course of study, contact information, and other details as specified by KUCSA.

➢ Sub-Clause 1.1.2.2: The applicant shall attach a copy of a valid student identification card or official letter of enrollment from their institution.

❖ Clause 1.1.3: Membership applications will be processed by the KUCSA Membership Committee within 14 days of submission.

➢ Sub-Clause 1.1.3.1: The Membership Committee shall review applications to ensure all eligibility requirements are met and that forms are correctly completed.

➢ Sub-Clause 1.1.3.2: The Membership Committee may conduct a brief interview with the applicant, if deemed necessary, to assess alignment with KUCSA’s values and mission.

➢ Sub-Clause 1.1.3.3: Applicants may check the status of their application on the KUCSA website or through designated KUCSA representatives at their institution.

❖ Clause 1.1.4: Successful applicants shall receive an official KUCSA membership card, valid for the duration of their enrollment at their institution.

➢ Sub-Clause 1.1.4.1: The membership card shall include the member’s name, photograph, membership ID, institution, and membership category.

➢ Sub-Clause 1.1.4.2: Membership cards must be renewed annually, with the renewal process initiated at the beginning of each academic year.

➢ Sub-Clause 1.1.4.3: Lost or damaged membership cards may be replaced upon request, subject to a nominal fee.

Sub-Section 1.2: Admission Fees

❖ Clause 1.2.1: Ordinary Members shall pay an admission fee as determined by the KUCSA Finance Committee.

➢ Sub-Clause 1.2.1.1: The fee structure shall be reviewed annually to ensure affordability while supporting KUCSA’s operational needs.

➢ Sub-Clause 1.2.1.2: The admission fee shall be payable through approved KUCSA payment channels, including bank transfer, mobile money, or online payment options.

❖ Clause 1.2.2: Honorary Members shall be exempt from paying membership fees.

➢ Sub-Clause 1.2.2.1: Honorary Members may, however, make voluntary contributions to support KUCSA activities if they so choose.

➢ Sub-Clause 1.2.2.2: The exemption of fees for Honorary Members shall be in recognition of their distinguished service and contributions to KUCSA.

❖ Clause 1.2.3: Associate Members shall pay a nominal fee, determined annually by the KUCSA Finance Committee.

➢ Sub-Clause 1.2.3.1: The nominal fee shall reflect the reduced services provided to Associate Members while maintaining engagement with KUCSA.

➢ Sub-Clause 1.2.3.2: Associate Members who face financial hardship may apply for a fee reduction or waiver, subject to KUCSA’s discretion.

❖ Clause 1.2.4: Fees may be waived or adjusted at the discretion of the Executive Committee in cases of financial hardship.

➢ Sub-Clause 1.2.4.1: Members seeking a fee waiver must submit a formal application with supporting documentation of financial hardship.

➢ Sub-Clause 1.2.4.2: The Executive Committee shall review such applications confidentially, ensuring respect for the applicant’s privacy and dignity.

➢ Sub-Clause 1.2.4.3: Members granted fee waivers shall be required to renew their waiver application annually.

Sub-Section 1.3: Membership Renewal and Re-admission

❖ Clause 1.3.1: Membership Renewal Process

➢ Sub-Clause 1.3.1.1: Members must renew their membership at the start of each academic year to remain in good standing with KUCSA.

➢ Sub-Clause 1.3.1.2: Renewal involves updating personal information, verifying enrollment status, and paying any applicable renewal fees.

➢ Sub-Clause 1.3.1.3: Members who fail to renew within the prescribed period shall receive a grace period of one month, after which their membership may be suspended.

❖ Clause 1.3.2: Re-admission Process for Former Members

➢ Sub-Clause 1.3.2.1: Former members who left KUCSA in good standing may apply for re-admission, subject to a re-admission application and a reduced fee.

➢ Sub-Clause 1.3.2.2: Former members who were previously suspended or expelled may apply for re-admission only after two academic terms, subject to a comprehensive review by the Membership Committee.

➢ Sub-Clause 1.3.2.3: Re-admission of previously suspended members shall include a commitment to comply with KUCSA’s values and Code of Conduct.

Sub-Section 1.4: Membership Records and Data Privacy

❖ Clause 1.4.1: KUCSA shall maintain a secure database of all membership records.

➢ Sub-Clause 1.4.1.1: The database shall include details such as name, institution, membership ID, membership category, contact information, and payment history.

➢ Sub-Clause 1.4.1.2: Membership records shall be updated regularly to ensure accuracy and compliance with KUCSA’s data management policy.

❖ Clause 1.4.2: Data Privacy and Confidentiality

➢ Sub-Clause 1.4.2.1: KUCSA shall implement data protection measures to safeguard member information from unauthorized access or misuse.

➢ Sub-Clause 1.4.2.2: Members’ personal information shall only be accessible to authorized KUCSA officials and shall not be shared with third parties without the member’s consent.

➢ Sub-Clause 1.4.2.3: Members have the right to access and review their personal information in KUCSA records upon request.

Section 2: Termination of Membership

Sub-Section 2.1: Grounds for Termination of Membership

❖ Clause 2.1.1: Graduation or Cessation of Student Status

➢ Sub-Clause 2.1.1.1: Membership automatically terminates upon a member’s graduation or withdrawal from their institution.

■ Sub-Clause 2.1.1.1.1: Graduates who are in their final academic term may request an extension of membership to participate in ongoing KUCSA initiatives, subject to approval.

➢ Sub-Clause 2.1.1.2: Graduates may apply for Associate Membership if they wish to remain affiliated with KUCSA.

➢ Sub-Clause 2.1.1.2.1: Associate Membership for graduates will grant limited privileges, including access to KUCSA events and newsletters, but excludes voting rights.

❖ Clause 2.1.2: Conduct Detrimental to KUCSA

➢ Sub-Clause 2.1.2.1: Any member found guilty of gross misconduct, as determined by the KUCSA Disciplinary Committee, shall have their membership terminated.

■ Sub-Clause 2.1.2.1.1: Gross misconduct shall be thoroughly defined within KUCSA’s Code of Conduct, including acts such as harassment, fraud, and defamation.

➢ Sub-Clause 2.1.2.2: Gross misconduct includes, but is not limited to, violence, discrimination, misuse of KUCSA funds, and violation of the KUCSA Code of Conduct.

■ Sub-Clause 2.1.2.2.1: Misuse of KUCSA funds includes unauthorized expenditure, misappropriation, and lack of transparency in financial reporting.

➢ Sub-Clause 2.1.2.3: Members accused of misconduct are entitled to a fair hearing and may appeal the Disciplinary Committee’s decision.

■ Sub-Clause 2.1.2.3.1: Appeals must be filed within 14 days of receiving the decision, after which an Appeals Committee will review the case.

■ Sub-Clause 2.1.2.3.2: The Appeals Committee shall render a decision within 30 days, which shall be final.

❖ Clause 2.1.3: Voluntary Resignation

➢ Sub-Clause 2.1.3.1: Members may voluntarily resign by submitting a written notice to the KUCSA Secretary.

■ Sub-Clause 2.1.3.1.1: The resignation notice must clearly state the member’s intent to leave, along with any outstanding obligations to KUCSA.

➢ Sub-Clause 2.1.3.2: Resignation becomes effective upon receipt of the notice by KUCSA, and the resigning member must return any KUCSA property or materials.

■ Sub-Clause 2.1.3.2.1: Returned items must be verified for condition, and the member shall be responsible for any damages incurred.

➢ Sub-Clause 2.1.3.3: Members who resign in good standing may reapply for membership if they return to academic enrollment.

Sub-Section 2.2: Procedures for Membership Termination

❖ Clause 2.2.1: Notice of Termination

➢ Sub-Clause 2.2.1.1: In cases of involuntary termination, the affected member shall receive written notification specifying the reason for termination and any conditions for future reapplication.

➢ Sub-Clause 2.2.1.2: The notice shall include an option for the member to appeal the decision if termination results from allegations of misconduct.

❖ Clause 2.2.2: Exit Process

➢ Sub-Clause 2.2.2.1: Members being terminated must participate in an exit interview with a KUCSA representative to ensure any feedback is documented.

➢ Sub-Clause 2.2.2.2: The member shall be provided with a summary of KUCSA projects and initiatives to maintain future engagement opportunities if desired.

Sub-Section 2.3: Reinstatement of Membership

❖ Clause 2.3.1: Eligibility for Reinstatement

➢ Sub-Clause 2.3.1.1: Members whose membership was terminated for nondisciplinary reasons may apply for reinstatement upon re-enrollment or proof of eligibility.

➢ Sub-Clause 2.3.1.2: Such members must update their contact information and submit a reapplication form to the KUCSA Membership Committee.

❖ Clause 2.3.2: Reinstatement Following Misconduct

➢ Sub-Clause 2.3.2.1: Members terminated due to misconduct may appeal for reinstatement after a minimum period of one year, subject to a review by the Disciplinary Committee.

➢ Sub-Clause 2.3.2.2: Members seeking reinstatement after misconduct must submit a letter detailing efforts taken to address the issue and any personal development undertaken.

➢ Sub-Clause 2.3.2.3: The Disciplinary Committee reserves the right to conduct a background check and interview before reinstating a member.

❖ Clause 2.3.3: Probationary Period for Reinstated Members

➢ Sub-Clause 2.3.3.1: Reinstated members must complete a probation period of six months, during which they must demonstrate compliance with KUCSA’s Code of Conduct.

➢ Sub-Clause 2.3.3.2: During probation, reinstated members shall meet periodically with a KUCSA mentor or advisor to review progress and ensure integration with KUCSA’s values.

➢ Sub-Clause 2.3.3.3: Any breach of conduct during the probation period may lead to immediate termination, subject to review.

Sub-Section 2.4: Appeals Process

❖ Clause 2.4.1: Right to Appeal

➢ Sub-Clause 2.4.1.1: Members who have been terminated for disciplinary reasons may appeal the termination decision by filing a written appeal within 14 days of notification.

➢ Sub-Clause 2.4.1.2: The appeal shall be reviewed by an independent Appeals Committee, consisting of members not involved in the original decision.

❖ Clause 2.4.2: Appeals Hearing

➢ Sub-Clause 2.4.2.1: An appeals hearing shall be scheduled within 30 days, allowing the member to present their case and respond to any evidence provided by the Disciplinary Committee.

➢ Sub-Clause 2.4.2.2: The Appeals Committee shall issue a written decision within 14 days of the hearing, which shall be final.

Sub-Section 2.5: Conditions for Reinstatement After Termination

❖ Clause 2.5.1: Good Faith and Accountability

➢ Sub-Clause 2.5.1.1: Members reinstated after termination must demonstrate commitment to KUCSA’s values and adhere to all updated codes and standards.

➢ Sub-Clause 2.5.1.2: Reinstated members may be required to contribute a set number of volunteer hours to KUCSA as part of their reintegration.

❖ Clause 2.5.2: Reaffirmation of Commitment

➢ Sub-Clause 2.5.2.1: Reinstated members must sign a code of conduct reaffirmation statement, acknowledging the reasons for prior termination and pledging adherence to KUCSA standards.

➢ Sub-Clause 2.5.2.2: Members who fail to comply with the reaffirmation requirements within the first month of reinstatement shall be subject to immediate termination.

Sub-Section 2.6: Administrative Procedures for Membership Termination

❖ Clause 2.6.1: Record-Keeping

➢ Sub-Clause 2.6.1.1: KUCSA shall maintain accurate and confidential records of all membership terminations, including reasons and dates.

➢ Sub-Clause 2.6.1.2: Termination records shall be stored for a minimum of three years, after which they may be archived or destroyed, in accordance with KUCSA’s data retention policy.

❖ Clause 2.6.2: Communication and Transparency

➢ Sub-Clause 2.6.2.1: KUCSA shall inform members of any major policy updates that could affect membership status, termination criteria, or reinstatement processes.

➢ Sub-Clause 2.6.2.2: Communication regarding termination shall be handled with discretion, with only the necessary parties informed.

CHAPTER THREE: ORGANIZATIONAL STRUCTURE

Article 4: Governing Bodies

Section 1: The National Executive Council (NEC)

Sub-Section 1.1: The NEC as the Supreme Governing Body

● Clause 1.1.1: The NEC shall be responsible for formulating and implementing policie, strategies, and initiatives to achieve KUCSA’s mission and vision

● Clause 1.1.2: The NEC shall have the authority to make decisions on behalf of KUCSA in alignment with the organization’s values and goals.

● Clause 1.1.3: The NEC shall provide oversight to all KUCSA activities, ensuring compliance with the constitution and organizational policies.

● Clause 1.1.4: The NEC shall ensure financial, legal, and ethical standards are met in all KUCSA activities and operations.

Sub-Section 1.2: Composition of the NEC

Sub-Article 1.2.1: The Chairperson

○ Clause 1.2.1.1: Shall oversee the NEC’s overall administration and ensure unity among council members.

○ Clause 1.2.1.2: Shall represent KUCSA in official capacities, serving as the chief spokesperson at national and international levels.

○ Clause 1.2.1.3: Has the authority to call for NEC meetings and set the agenda.

○ Clause 1.2.1.4: Shall ensure smooth coordination between the NEC and other KUCSA bodies.

Sub-Article 1.2.2: The Vice-Chairperson - Universities

○ Clause 1.2.2.1: Acts as a liaison between the NEC and university student representatives, voicing university student concerns.

○ Clause 1.2.2.2: Oversees university-related programs and initiatives under KUCSA

○ Clause 1.2.2.3: May be assigned specific tasks by the Chairperson to address university student issues.

Sub-Article 1.2.3: The Vice-Chairperson - Colleges

○ Clause 1.2.3.1: Represents the interests of college students within KUCSA.

○ Clause 1.2.3.2: Leads initiatives to promote college student engagement in KUCSA activities.

○ Clause 1.2.3.3: Works with college representatives to identify key issues and advocate for solutions.

Sub-Article 1.2.4: The Secretary-General

○ Clause 1.2.4.1: Shall oversee internal NEC communications and maintain records, including minutes of all meetings.

○ Clause 1.2.4.2: Manages KUCSA’s official documents, archives, and any organizational correspondence.

○ Clause 1.2.4.3: Ensures that policies and guidelines are available to all NEC members and stakeholders.

Sub-Article 1.2.5: The Deputy Secretary-General

○ Clause 1.2.5.1: Assists the Secretary-General with documentation, meeting organization, and communication tasks.

○ Clause 1.2.5.2: Acts on behalf of the Secretary-General in their absence or as delegated.

○ Clause 1.2.5.3: Takes responsibility for specific administrative tasks as assigned by the Secretary-General.

Sub-Article 1.2.6: The Treasurer

○ Clause 1.2.6.1: Shall oversee financial planning, budgeting, and management for all KUCSA funds.

○ Clause 1.2.6.2: Shall present financial reports and statements to the NEC and ensure compliance with financial policies.

○ Clause 1.2.6.3: Shall work with an external auditor for transparency and accountability in financial practices.

Sub-Article 1.2.7: The Organizing Secretary

○ Clause 1.2.7.1: Shall be responsible for planning and coordinating all KUCSA events, forums, and activities.

○ Clause 1.2.7.2: Shall collaborate with committees and representatives to ensure wellorganized and impactful events.

○ Clause 1.2.7.3: Shall create an annual calendar for KUCSA activities, approved by the NEC.

Sub-Article 1.2.8: The Deputy Organizing Secretary

○ Clause 1.2.8.1: Assists the Organizing Secretary in coordinating events and managing event logistics.

○ Clause 1.2.8.2: Acts on behalf of the Organizing Secretary in their absence.

○ Clause 1.2.8.3: Takes charge of specific tasks as assigned by the Organizing Secretary

Sub-Articles 1.2.9 to 1.2.15: Additional NEC Members

○ Sub-Article 1.2.9: Male Representative

■ Clause 1.2.9.1: Represents male students in KUCSA and advocates for gender equality within the organization.

○ Sub-Article 1.2.10: Female Representative

■ Clause 1.2.10.1: Advocates for female students, ensuring their concerns and needs are addressed by KUCSA.

○ Sub-Article 1.2.11: Special Needs Representative

■ Clause 1.2.11.1: Represents students with disabilities, ensuring accessibility in all KUCSA initiatives.

○ Sub-Article 1.2.12: Director of Publicity

■ Clause 1.2.12.1: Manages KUCSA’s social media presence, branding, and public communication.

○ Sub-Article 1.2.13: Information Technology Manager

■ Clause 1.2.13.1: Oversees KUCSA’s IT systems, website management, and data security.

○ Sub-Article 1.2.14: Project Coordinator

■ Clause 1.2.14.1: Leads and manages special projects, ensuring alignment with KUCSA’s mission.

○ Sub-Article 1.2.15: Legal Director

■ Clause 1.2.15.1: Provides legal guidance to the NEC, ensuring compliance with national laws.

Sub-Section 1.3: Terms of Office and Election Procedures

● Clause 1.3.1: All NEC members shall serve a renewable term of two years, with a maximum of two terms for each member.

● Clause 1.3.2: Elections shall be organized and overseen by an independent KUCSA Electoral Committee to ensure fairness and transparency.

● Clause 1.3.3: Candidates for NEC positions must meet minimum qualifications, including active membership and good standing with KUCSA.

● Clause 1.3.4: Election campaigns must be conducted ethically, promoting unity and avoiding divisive language.

Sub-Section 1.4: NEC Meetings and Decision-Making

● Clause 1.4.1: NEC meetings shall be held quarterly, with special sessions called as necessary by the Chairperson.

● Clause 1.4.2: A quorum of two-thirds of NEC members shall be required for all meetings to conduct official business.

● Clause 1.4.3: Decisions within the NEC shall be made by a simple majority vote, except for constitutional amendments, which require a two-thirds majority.

● Clause 1.4.4: Minutes of each meeting shall be documented and distributed to all members by the Secretary-General within one week of the meeting.

Sub-Section 1.5: Code of Conduct and Accountability

● Clause 1.5.1: NEC members shall adhere to a code of conduct that promotes transparency, accountability, and integrity.

● Clause 1.5.2: Any NEC member found guilty of misconduct may be subject to disciplinary actions, including suspension or removal, as determined by a special NEC Disciplinary Committee.

● Clause 1.5.3: NEC members are required to disclose any conflict of interest related to KUCSA activities and abstain from related decisions

● Clause 1.5.4: NEC members shall annually submit a report of their activities to the KUCSA General Assembly for review and feedback.

Sub-Section 1.6: NEC Committees and Sub-Committees

● Clause 1.6.1: The NEC shall establish standing and ad-hoc committees as needed to manage specific KUCSA functions, with clear terms of reference.

● Clause 1.6.2: Each committee shall be chaired by an NEC member and report progress to the NEC regularly.

● Clause 1.6.3: Committees may involve non-NEC members with relevant expertise, as approved by the NEC.

● Clause 1.6.4: Committees shall submit reports on their activities, expenditures, and achievements biannually.

Section 2: Committees of KUCSA

Sub-Section 2.1: Establishment and Purpose of Committees

● Clause 2.1.1: KUCSA shall establish standing committees to manage specific areas of operation vital to achieving the association's mission and vision.

● Clause 2.1.2: Committees shall be responsible for planning, implementation, and monitoring of activities related to their respective mandates.

● Clause 2.1.3: Committees may be established, dissolved, or restructured by the NEC, subject to the needs of KUCSA and approval from the General Assembly.

Sub-Section 2.2: Types of Standing Committees

KUCSA’s standing committees shall cover the following key areas of operation:

Sub-Article 2.2.1: Finance Committee

● Clause 2.2.1.1: Shall be responsible for all financial planning, budget preparation, and fund management within KUCSA.

● Clause 2.2.1.2: Shall conduct periodic financial audits and present an annual financial report to the NEC.

● Clause 2.2.1.3: Shall review financial policies and suggest amendments to ensure accountability, transparency, and compliance with relevant laws.

○ Sub-Clause 2.2.1.3.1: Financial policies include guidelines on expenditure limits, procurement processes, and approval hierarchies.

○ Sub-Clause 2.2.1.3.2: The Finance Committee may consult external financial advisors, subject to NEC approval, for major fiscal decisions.

● Clause 2.2.1.4: Shall report financial updates to the NEC on a quarterly basis, detailing all income, expenditure, and fund allocations.

● Clause 2.2.1.5: Shall collaborate with the Treasurer to ensure funds are managed effectively and support KUCSA’s strategic priorities.

Sub-Article 2.2.2: Welfare and Advocacy Committee

● Clause 2.2.2.1: Shall be responsible for identifying and addressing student welfare needs, including health, housing, and safety concerns.

● Clause 2.2.2.2: Shall advocate for the rights of students by representing their concerns to university authorities, government bodies, and other relevant stakeholders.

○ Sub-Clause 2.2.2.2.1: This includes organizing campaigns, awareness programs, and workshops related to student rights and welfare.

○ Sub-Clause 2.2.2.2.2: Shall provide legal assistance and counseling services to students, in collaboration with authorized personnel.

● Clause 2.2.2.3: Shall work closely with elected student representatives to address urgent welfare issues.

● Clause 2.2.2.4: Shall establish a grievance redressal mechanism to handle student complaints and escalate unresolved matters to the NEC.

Sub-Article 2.2.3: Academic and Research Committee

● Clause 2.2.3.1: Shall oversee KUCSA’s academic initiatives, including research programs, academic policy development, and scholarship opportunities.

● Clause 2.2.3.2: Shall actively engage in research aimed at proposing improvements in higher education policies and academic standards.

○ Sub-Clause 2.2.3.2.1: Research topics may include curriculum development, student retention, educational equity, and learning outcomes.

● Clause 2.2.3.3: Shall establish partnerships with universities, colleges, and research institutions for knowledge exchange and collaboration on academic projects.

● Clause 2.2.3.4: Shall organize academic events, such as conferences, seminars, and workshops, to promote research and academic excellence.

● Clause 2.2.3.5: Shall evaluate and recommend resources for academic support, such as online libraries, mentorship programs, and study materials.

Sub-Article 2.2.4: Public Relations and Communication Committee

● Clause 2.2.4.1: Responsible for maintaining KUCSA’s public image, handling media interactions, and managing all internal and external communications.

● Clause 2.2.4.2: Shall develop and maintain effective communication channels to ensure timely and accurate information flow among KUCSA members, stakeholders, and the public.

○ Sub-Clause 2.2.4.2.1: Shall manage KUCSA’s social media accounts, website, and other digital platforms to keep members informed of events, activities, and updates.

○ Sub-Clause 2.2.4.2.2: Shall draft press releases, newsletters, and other official publications, subject to NEC approval.

● Clause 2.2.4.3: Shall implement strategies for increasing KUCSA’s visibility and enhancing public relations within the student community.

● Clause 2.2.4.4: Shall respond to media inquiries and manage crisis communication to protect KUCSA’s reputation.

● Clause 2.2.4.5: Shall organize public forums, town halls, and feedback sessions to engage with students and gather their opinions on pertinent issues.

Sub-Article 2.2.5: Sports and Recreation Committee

● Clause 2.2.5.1: Responsible for promoting sports and recreational activities within KUCSA.

● Clause 2.2.5.2: Shall organize inter-university and inter-college sports competitions, recreational events, and wellness programs.

● Clause 2.2.5.3: Shall advocate for and work toward the improvement of sports facilities and resources for students.

Sub-Article 2.2.6: Environment and Sustainability Committee

● Clause 2.2.6.1: Focuses on promoting environmental awareness, sustainability initiatives, and climate change education within KUCSA.

● Clause 2.2.6.2: Shall organize environmental clean-ups, recycling programs, and tree-planting activities.

● Clause 2.2.6.3: Shall collaborate with environmental organizations and governmental agencies to promote sustainable practices on campuses.

Sub-Article 2.2.7: Information and Technology Committee

● Clause 2.2.7.1: Responsible for managing KUCSA’s IT infrastructure, including website maintenance, cybersecurity, and digital resources.

● Clause 2.2.7.2: Shall develop and implement technology-driven solutions for KUCSA’s operational efficiency.

● Clause 2.2.7.3: Shall provide IT support and training for KUCSA members to enhance digital literacy.

Sub-Article 2.2.8: Gender and Equality Committee

● Clause 2.2.8.1: Shall advocate for gender equality, inclusivity, and the empowerment of marginalized groups within KUCSA.

● Clause 2.2.8.2: Shall organize workshops, seminars, and campaigns to promote gender awareness and address gender-based issues.

● Clause 2.2.8.3: Shall collaborate with relevant organizations to implement policies and programs supporting gender equity.

Sub-Article 2.2.9: Alumni and Career Development Committee

● Clause 2.2.9.1: Shall establish and maintain relationships with KUCSA alumni, facilitating mentorship and networking opportunities.

● Clause 2.2.9.2: Shall organize career fairs, skill-building workshops, and internship programs to enhance students’ employability.

● Clause 2.2.9.3: Shall create an alumni database and a career portal to connect students with job opportunities.

Sub-Article 2.2.10: Cultural and Arts Committee

● Clause 2.2.10.1: Shall promote cultural diversity and artistic expression among KUCSA members.

● Clause 2.2.10.2: Shall organize cultural festivals, art exhibitions, and talent shows to celebrate various forms of art and culture.

● Clause 2.2.10.3: Shall work to foster inclusivity and respect for diverse cultural backgrounds.

Sub-Article 2.2.11: Mental Health and Counseling Committee

● Clause 2.2.11.1: Responsible for advocating mental health awareness and providing access to counseling services for students.

● Clause 2.2.11.2: Shall organize mental health workshops, peer counseling sessions, and awareness campaigns.

● Clause 2.2.11.3: Shall collaborate with licensed professionals and health organizations to address student mental health needs.

Sub-Article 2.2.12: Safety and Security Committee

● Clause 2.2.12.1: Ensures the safety and security of students within KUCSA and their respective campuses.

● Clause 2.2.12.2: Shall coordinate with campus security and law enforcement on safety protocols and incident response.

● Clause 2.2.12.3: Shall organize training on personal safety, emergency response, and risk management.

Sub-Article 2.2.13: Innovation and Entrepreneurship Committee

● Clause 2.2.13.1: Supports students in developing innovative ideas, entrepreneurial skills, and start-up ventures.

● Clause 2.2.13.2: Shall organize start-up incubators, pitch events, and entrepreneurship workshops.

● Clause 2.2.13.3: Shall partner with business and innovation hubs to provide resources for student entrepreneurs.

Sub-Article 2.2.14: Community Engagement and Outreach Committee

● Clause 2.2.14.1: Responsible for organizing community service programs and outreach initiatives to support local communities.

● Clause 2.2.14.2: Shall work on volunteer programs, mentorship schemes, and educational support for underprivileged groups.

● Clause 2.2.14.3: Shall foster partnerships with NGOs and community organizations to promote social impact.

Sub-Article 2.2.15: Legal and Policy Committee

● Clause 2.2.15.1: Provides legal guidance, reviews policies, and ensures compliance with statutory regulations for KUCSA.

● Clause 2.2.15.2: Shall assist in drafting, reviewing, and amending KUCSA’s constitution, bylaws, and policies.

● Clause 2.2.15.3: Shall offer legal support to students on issues related to student rights and responsibilities.

Sub-Section 2.3: Committee Membership and Leadership

● Clause 2.3.1: Each committee shall consist of a chairperson, a secretary, and designated members appointed by the NEC based on expertise, interest, and commitment to KUCSA’s mission.

○ Sub-Clause 2.3.1.1: Committee chairs shall be appointed from NEC members or other experienced individuals approved by the NEC.

○ Sub-Clause 2.3.1.2: The chairperson shall serve as the main point of contact between the committee and the NEC.

● Clause 2.3.2: Committee membership shall be open to all KUCSA members, subject to application, interview, and approval by the NEC.

○ Sub-Clause 2.3.2.1: Members are expected to actively participate in committee meetings, contribute to projects, and adhere to KUCSA’s code of conduct.

● Clause 2.3.3: Committee chairs are responsible for scheduling monthly meetings, documenting proceedings, and reporting progress to the NEC.

○ Sub-Clause 2.3.3.1: Each committee shall submit a monthly progress report to the NEC, highlighting achievements, challenges, and upcoming plans.

○ Sub-Clause 2.3.3.2: Annual performance reviews of committees shall be conducted by the NEC to assess their effectiveness and efficiency.

● Clause 2.3.4: In the event of a committee member’s prolonged inactivity, violation of KUCSA’s code of conduct, or failure to perform duties, the NEC reserves the right to revoke their membership.

Sub-Section 2.4: Ad Hoc Committees

● Clause 2.4.1: The NEC may form ad hoc committees as needed to address specific tasks, projects, or issues that require specialized focus or short-term commitment.

● Clause 2.4.2: The term of an ad hoc committee shall be defined based on the task at hand, with a specific start and end date.

○ Sub-Clause 2.4.2.1: Extensions for ad hoc committees may be granted by the NEC upon review and approval.

● Clause 2.4.3: Ad hoc committees shall operate under the guidance of an appointed chairperson and report their progress to the NEC.

Section 3: Regional Coordinators

The role of Regional Coordinators within the Kenya Universities and Colleges Students Association (KUCSA) is crucial to the effective representation and management of KUCSA’s objectives at the regional level across Kenya. Regional Coordinators ensure that the interests of students within each region are considered and addressed, and they act as a bridge between the National Executive Council (NEC) and the regional institutions.

Sub-Section 3.1: Appointment and Responsibilities of Regional Coordinators

Clause 3.1.1: Representation and Communication

● Sub-Clause 3.1.1.1: Regional Coordinators shall serve as the official representatives of KUCSA in their respective regions, advocating for student interests and addressing regional-specific needs.

● Sub-Clause 3.1.1.2: They shall maintain open lines of communication with institutions within their region, providing updates on KUCSA activities, programs, and policies.

● Sub-Clause 3.1.1.3: Regional Coordinators shall submit monthly reports to the NEC, summarizing key activities, challenges, and achievements within their regions.

Clause 3.1.2: Event Coordination and Support

● Sub-Clause 3.1.2.1: Regional Coordinators shall assist in planning and organizing KUCSA events, including conferences, seminars, and workshops within their regions.

● Sub-Clause 3.1.2.2: They shall mobilize students and resources for KUCSA-sponsored events, ensuring high levels of student engagement and participation.

● Sub-Clause 3.1.2.3: Regional Coordinators shall oversee logistics and provide on-the-ground support during events, working closely with local institutions and student leaders.

Clause 3.2.1: Eligibility Criteria

● Sub-Clause 3.2.1.1: To be eligible for the role of Regional Coordinator, candidates must be enrolled in an institution within the designated region.

● Sub-Clause 3.2.1.2: Candidates must demonstrate a strong commitment to student leadership, possess a sound understanding of KUCSA’s objectives, and have prior leadership or coordination experience.

● Sub-Clause 3.2.1.3: They must have no disciplinary records or history of misconduct within their institutions or KUCSA.

Clause 3.2.2: Appointment Process

● Sub-Clause 3.2.2.1: The NEC shall appoint Regional Coordinators following an application and interview process, with candidates evaluated based on their experience, regional knowledge, and leadership potential.

● Sub-Clause 3.2.2.2: The NEC may form a selection committee to review applications and make recommendations for appointments.

● Sub-Clause 3.2.2.3: Regional Coordinators shall serve a term of two years, renewable once based on performance and NEC approval.

Clause 3.2.3: Training and Induction

● Sub-Clause 3.2.3.1: Appointed Regional Coordinators shall undergo a mandatory training and induction program organized by the NEC to familiarize them with KUCSA’s structure, policies, and objectives.

● Sub-Clause 3.2.3.2: They shall receive training on leadership, event management, and conflict resolution to equip them with essential skills for effective regional representation.

Sub-Section 3.3: Duties and Responsibilities

Clause 3.3.1: Advocacy and Representation

● Sub-Clause 3.3.1.1: Regional Coordinators shall advocate for policies and programs that reflect the needs and aspirations of students in their region.

● Sub-Clause 3.3.1.2: They shall represent KUCSA’s stance on student issues to local authorities and participate in advocacy efforts to improve student welfare and academic standards within the region.

● Sub-Clause 3.3.1.3: Regional Coordinators shall facilitate the formation of regional alliances or networks among student bodies to strengthen advocacy efforts.

Clause 3.3.2: Reporting and Accountability

● Sub-Clause 3.3.2.1: Regional Coordinators are required to submit quarterly progress reports to the NEC, detailing achievements, challenges, and any recommendations for the region.

● Sub-Clause 3.3.2.2: They shall keep detailed records of all regional meetings, events, and other official activities for accountability purposes.

● Sub-Clause 3.3.2.3: Regional Coordinators shall be accountable for the prudent management of any funds allocated to regional activities, ensuring transparent and documented financial practices.

Sub-Section 3.4: Regional Leadership Structure and Support

Clause 3.4.1: Deputy Regional Coordinators

● Sub-Clause 3.4.1.1: Each region may appoint a Deputy Regional Coordinator to assist with the duties of the Regional Coordinator.

● Sub-Clause 3.4.1.2: The Deputy Regional Coordinator shall support the Regional Coordinator in daily operations and act on their behalf in their absence.

● Sub-Clause 3.4.1.3: Deputy Regional Coordinators shall be appointed by the Regional Coordinator with approval from the NEC.

Clause 3.4.2: Regional Advisory Committees

● Sub-Clause 3.4.2.1: Each region may establish an advisory committee composed of representatives from local institutions, student leaders, and faculty members to provide guidance and support.

● Sub-Clause 3.4.2.2: The advisory committee shall meet quarterly to discuss regional student issues and propose recommendations for action.

● Sub-Clause 3.4.2.3: The Regional Coordinator shall chair advisory committee meetings and report on discussions to the NEC.

Clause 3.4.3: Resources and Logistics Support

● Sub-Clause 3.4.3.1: KUCSA shall provide Regional Coordinators with the necessary resource, such as communication tools and financial support, to enable them to perform their duties effectively.

● Sub-Clause 3.4.3.2: Regional Coordinators may request additional resources for specific projects, events, or emergencies, subject to NEC approval.

Sub-Section 3.5: Performance Evaluation and Accountability

Clause 3.5.1: Annual Performance Review

● Sub-Clause 3.5.1.1: Regional Coordinators shall undergo an annual performance review by the NEC to assess their effectiveness, leadership, and alignment with KUCSA’s goals.

● Sub-Clause 3.5.1.2: The review shall include feedback from students, regional advisory committees, and NEC members.

● Sub-Clause 3.5.1.3: Based on the performance review, the NEC may offer recommendations for improvement, renew the coordinator’s term, or take disciplinary action if necessary.

Clause 3.5.2: Disciplinary Measures

● Sub-Clause 3.5.2.1: Regional Coordinators found to be in violation of KUCSA policies, failing in their duties, or engaging in misconduct may face disciplinary actions, including suspension or dismissal.

● Sub-Clause 3.5.2.2: Disciplinary actions shall follow a formal process, including a hearing before the NEC and, if necessary, involvement from the advisory committee.

● Sub-Clause 3.5.2.3: Dismissed coordinators shall have the right to appeal to the NEC, and the NEC’s final decision shall be binding.

Sub-Section 3.6: Regional Coordinator Powers and Limitations

Clause 3.6.1: Powers of Regional Coordinators

● Sub-Clause 3.6.1.1: Regional Coordinators shall have the authority to act on behalf of KUCSA in official capacities within their region.

● Sub-Clause 3.6.1.2: They may initiate regional programs, events, and advocacy campaigns that align with KUCSA’s mission and are approved by the NEC.

● Sub-Clause 3.6.1.3: Regional Coordinators shall have discretion over minor financial decisions relating to regional activities, provided that they adhere to KUCSA’s financial policies.

Clause 3.6.2: Limitations of Authority

● Sub-Clause 3.6.2.1: Regional Coordinators may not enter into contracts, make financial commitments, or represent KUCSA in national or international matters without NEC approval.

● Sub-Clause 3.6.2.2: They shall not take positions or make public statements on behalf of KUCSA without consulting the NEC.

● Sub-Clause 3.6.2.3: Regional Coordinators are prohibited from using their position for personal gain or advancing any interests that conflict with KUCSA’s mission.

Section 4: University and College Representatives

University and College Representatives play a vital role in linking the Kenya Universities and Colleges Students Association (KUCSA) with individual institutions. Their responsibilities include advocating for student needs within their institutions, ensuring effective communication of KUCSA’s objectives, and supporting the implementation of KUCSA programs at the institutional level.

Sub-Section 4.1: Role and Responsibilities of University and College Representatives

Clause 4.1.1: Communication and Reporting

● Sub-Clause 4.1.1.1: Representatives shall serve as primary communication channels between KUCSA and the students within their respective institutions.

● Sub-Clause 4.1.1.2: They shall provide regular updates to the NEC on institutional issues, including student welfare, academic concerns, and feedback on KUCSA’s initiatives.

● Sub-Clause 4.1.1.3: Representatives shall submit monthly reports summarizing key events, issues, and student concerns within their institutions to the NEC.

Clause 4.1.2: Dissemination of Information

● Sub-Clause 4.1.2.1: Representatives shall ensure that KUCSA announcements, event details, and policy changes are promptly communicated to students within their institutions.

● Sub-Clause 4.1.2.2: They shall maintain and regularly update communication channels such as notice boards, social media pages, and email groups dedicated to KUCSA-related information.

● Sub-Clause 4.1.2.3: Representatives are responsible for organizing informational sessions to educate students on KUCSA’s goals, programs, and services.

Sub-Section 4.2: Appointment, Eligibility, and Term of Representatives

Clause 4.2.1: Eligibility Criteria

● Sub-Clause 4.2.1.1: Candidates for the position of University or College Representative must be enrolled in a program at the respective institution.

● Sub-Clause 4.2.1.2: They must have prior leadership experience, good academic standing, and no history of disciplinary action within their institution or KUCSA.

● Sub-Clause 4.2.1.3: Candidates should demonstrate a commitment to KUCSA’s mission, values, and principles of student representation.

Clause 4.2.2: Appointment Process

● Sub-Clause 4.2.2.1: Representatives shall be nominated by the student body or appointed through an election process overseen by the NEC, with assistance from the institution’s student government.

● Sub-Clause 4.2.2.2: In the event of a vacancy, the NEC shall facilitate the appointment or election of a new representative within 30 days.

● Sub-Clause 4.2.2.3: Representatives shall serve a one-year term, renewable based on performance and student feedback.

Clause 4.2.3: Training and Induction

● Sub-Clause 4.2.3.1: Newly appointed Representatives shall undergo a mandatory training and induction session to familiarize them with KUCSA’s structure, policies, and roles.

● Sub-Clause 4.2.3.2: Training shall cover areas such as communication, student advocacy, conflict resolution, and KUCSA’s objectives.

● Sub-Clause 4.2.3.3: Representatives shall receive resources and guidelines on effectively representing KUCSA within their institutions.

Sub-Section 4.3: Duties and Functions of University and College Representatives

Clause 4.3.1: Advocacy and Representation

● Sub-Clause 4.3.1.1: Representatives shall advocate for the rights, needs, and interests of students at their respective institutions, ensuring that KUCSA policies reflect student voices.

● Sub-Clause 4.3.1.2: They shall bring institution-specific issues, such as academic policies, fee structures, and welfare concerns, to the attention of the NEC.

● Sub-Clause 4.3.1.3: Representatives shall participate in institutional committees or forums where student welfare, academic policies, and other relevant issues are discussed.

Clause 4.3.2: Event Coordination and Support

● Sub-Clause 4.3.2.1: Representatives shall coordinate KUCSA events at their institutions, including workshops, seminars, and awareness campaigns.

● Sub-Clause 4.3.2.2: They shall mobilize student participation in KUCSA activities, ensuring high levels of engagement

● Sub-Clause 4.3.2.3: Representatives are responsible for gathering feedback from students regarding KUCSA events and submitting this information to the NEC.

Clause 4.3.3: Conflict Resolution

● Sub-Clause 4.3.3.1: Representatives shall assist in resolving conflicts that arise between students and institution administration, mediating where necessary with the support of the NEC.

● Sub-Clause 4.3.3.2: They shall ensure that conflicts are handled fairly and transparently, adhering to KUCSA’s policies and code of conduct.

● Sub-Clause 4.3.3.3: Representatives may escalate unresolved conflicts to the NEC, providing documentation and relevant information.

Sub-Section 4.4: Performance Evaluation, Accountability, and Disciplinary Action

Clause 4.4.1: Performance Evaluation

● Sub-Clause 4.4.1.1: The NEC shall conduct a bi-annual performance review of all Representatives, assessing their contributions, engagement, and effectiveness in representing KUCSA.

● Sub-Clause 4.4.1.2: The evaluation process shall involve feedback from the student body, institutional administration, and other stakeholders.

● Sub-Clause 4.4.1.3: Representatives who receive positive evaluations may be eligible for renewal or additional responsibilities within KUCSA.

Clause 4.4.2: Disciplinary Actions

● Sub-Clause 4.4.2.1: Representatives who fail to fulfill their duties, act against KUCSA’s values, or are involved in misconduct shall be subject to disciplinary measures.

● Sub-Clause 4.4.2.2: Disciplinary actions may include suspension, removal from office, or other penalties as deemed necessary by the NEC.

● Sub-Clause 4.4.2.3: Representatives have the right to appeal disciplinary actions to the NEC, with the NEC’s decision being final and binding.

Clause 4.4.3: Transparency and Accountability

● Sub-Clause 4.4.3.1: Representatives shall maintain transparency in all official duties, including event organization, reporting, and financial transactions.

● Sub-Clause 4.4.3.2: They shall keep accurate records of meetings, events, and other official engagements for accountability purposes.

● Sub-Clause 4.4.3.3: Representatives shall submit a summary of their activities at the end of their term to assist in transition processes.

Sub-Section 4.5: Powers and Limitations of University and College Representatives

This sub-section governs the roles, responsibilities, and boundaries of University and College Representatives within the Kenya Universities and Colleges Students Association (KUCSA). These representatives serve as the vital link between the national KUCSA body and the student populations at individual universities and colleges. Their authority is designed to enable them to advocate for student interests while ensuring that their actions align with KUCSA’s mission, values, and policies.

Clause 4.5.1: Powers of Representatives

Sub-Clause 4.5.1.1: Representatives shall have the authority to speak on behalf of KUCSA within their institutions, provided they align with KUCSA’s official policies and positions.

● Sub-Clause 4.5.1.1.1: Representatives may present KUCSA’s views, statements, or proposals at institution-wide meetings, forums, or events, ensuring they communicate in line with KUCSA’s official stance on key issues.

● Sub-Clause 4.5.1.1.2: Representatives are authorized to address student groups, faculty, and administration within their institution on behalf of KUCSA, ensuring that KUCSA’s objectives are well-represented and understood at the local level.

Sub-Clause 4.5.1.2: They may initiate institution-specific programs, advocacy campaigns, or student engagement activities with the approval of the NEC.

● Sub-Clause 4.5.1.2.1: Representatives can launch campaigns or events related to academic, social, or welfare issues relevant to their institution’s student body, provided that they align with KUCSA’s overarching goals and receive prior approval from the NEC.

● Sub-Clause 4.5.1.2.2: They are authorized to partner with student organizations, faculty, and other stakeholders to co-host KUCSA-driven events, subject to NEC’s oversight and approval.

● Sub-Clause 4.5.1.2.3: Representatives may organize institution-wide feedback sessions or surveys to gather student opinions on specific issues, ensuring the alignment of KUCSA’s national initiatives with the needs of the local student population.

Sub-Clause 4.5.1.3: Representatives shall have discretionary authority over minor logistical decisions related to KUCSA activities within their institutions.

● Sub-Clause 4.5.1.3.1: Representatives may oversee the logistics of KUCSA-sponsored events within their institution, such as venue bookings, scheduling, and coordination with on-campus resources, ensuring smooth execution.

● Sub-Clause 4.5.1.3.2: They are empowered to make operational decisions for small-scale initiatives such as student outreach efforts, seminars, and information sessions, ensuring that these activities align with both KUCSA’s goals and the institution’s calendar.

● Sub-Clause 4.5.1.3.3: Representatives may coordinate with other student leaders or university administration on the allocation of resources (e.g., event spaces, materials) for KUCSA-related activities.

Sub-Clause 4.5.1.4: Representatives have the right to engage in regular communication with KUCSA’s national leadership (NEC) to ensure that their activities align with the broader goals of the organization.

● Sub-Clause 4.5.1.4.1: They are expected to provide updates on local student concerns, challenges, and successes, ensuring that KUCSA’s national efforts remain responsive to the diverse needs of students across various institutions.

● Sub-Clause 4.5.1.4.2: Representatives are encouraged to participate in national meetings, virtual forums, or conferences hosted by KUCSA to keep their institution’s student body engaged and informed on key issues.

Sub-Clause 4.5.1.5: Representatives may serve as a point of contact for students within their institution who wish to engage with KUCSA for assistance, information, or advocacy.

● Sub-Clause 4.5.1.5.1: They can offer guidance to students seeking support from KUCSA regarding academic issues, welfare concerns, or other student-related matters.

● Sub-Clause 4.5.1.5.2: Representatives are authorized to refer students to KUCSA’s national resources, such as legal aid, financial support, or mental health services, to ensure students’ needs are met.

Clause 4.5.2: Limitations of Authority

Sub-Clause 4.5.2.1: Representatives may not enter into contracts or make financial commitments on behalf of KUCSA without explicit authorization from the NEC.

● Sub-Clause 4.5.2.1.1: Representatives must obtain written approval from the NEC before committing any KUCSA funds to programs, activities, or collaborations, ensuring proper financial oversight and accountability.

● Sub-Clause 4.5.2.1.2: They are prohibited from signing any agreements, contracts, or MOUs on behalf of KUCSA that could financially or legally bind the organization, including partnerships, sponsorships, or third-party arrangements.

● Sub-Clause 4.5.2.1.3: Representatives are restricted from making budgetary decisions or reallocating funds for KUCSA programs without NEC authorization.

Sub-Clause 4.5.2.2: They shall not make public statements or positions on behalf of KUCSA that contradict official KUCSA policies.

● Sub-Clause 4.5.2.2.1: Representatives may not publicly endorse or support positions that are not officially endorsed by the NEC or that conflict with KUCSA’s mission or core values.

● Sub-Clause 4.5.2.2.2: They must ensure that all communication, whether in person, through social media, or in public forums, reflects KUCSA’s unified stance on issues and adheres to its mission.

● Sub-Clause 4.5.2.2.3: Representatives are not permitted to use their position to promote personal opinions that may negatively impact KUCSA’s reputation or cause divisions within the organization.

Sub-Clause 4.5.2.3: Representatives are prohibited from using their position for personal gain or engaging in any activities that create a conflict of interest with KUCSA’s mission.

● Sub-Clause 4.5.2.3.1: They are prohibited from leveraging their representative position to gain personal benefits, including financial, professional, or social advantages, that are not directly tied to their role.

● Sub-Clause 4.5.2.3.2: Representatives must disclose any potential conflicts of interest that could affect their judgment or impartiality, such as involvement in activities or businesses that may clash with KUCSA’s objectives.

● Sub-Clause 4.5.2.3.3: They must not engage in any actions or form alliances that would undermine the collective interests of KUCSA or create divisive situations within the organization.

Sub-Clause 4.5.2.4: Representatives are not allowed to make significant changes to KUCSA’s institutional strategies or policies without prior consultation and approval from the NEC.

● Sub-Clause 4.5.2.4.1: They must ensure that any proposed changes or initiatives within their institution are in line with KUCSA’s national strategies and have the approval of the NEC before implementation.

● Sub-Clause 4.5.2.4.2: Representatives are required to consult the NEC when considering new directions or campaigns that might influence KUCSA’s national priorities, especially when these initiatives affect multiple institutions.

Sub-Clause 4.5.2.5: Representatives shall not engage in discriminatory behavior or actions that contravene KUCSA’s core values of inclusivity, diversity, and respect for all students.

● Sub-Clause 4.5.2.5.1: They are prohibited from engaging in any activity, public or private, that promotes discrimination or exclusion based on race, gender, religion, disability, or any other characteristic that KUCSA advocates against.

● Sub-Clause 4.5.2.5.2: Representatives must actively promote inclusivity within their institution, ensuring that all students have equal opportunities to participate in KUCSA activities and programs.

Sub-Clause 4.5.2.6: Representatives shall not speak or act in ways that could bring KUCSA into disrepute or harm its relationship with external stakeholders.

● Sub-Clause 4.5.2.6.1: They are prohibited from engaging in actions, including online behavior, that could damage KUCSA’s credibility or reputation with government agencies, partner organizations, or other key stakeholders.

● Sub-Clause 4.5.2.6.2: Representatives must maintain professionalism in all interactions, ensuring that their conduct reflects positively on KUCSA’s standing within the higher education community.

Section 5: Organizational Representatives (Student Organizations)

Organizational Representatives serve as crucial connections between KUCSA and recognized student organizations, fostering collaboration, enhancing communication, and ensuring that the interests of diverse student groups are represented within KUCSA. These representatives support KUCSA’s initiatives, advocate for their organization's unique needs, and promote a cohesive relationship between KUCSA and the wider student body.

Sub-Section 5.1: Role and Responsibilities of Organizational Representatives

Clause 5.1.1: Representation and Advocacy

● Sub-Clause 5.1.1.1: Organizational Representatives shall actively present the interests, objectives, and challenges of their respective student organizations to the NEC.

● Sub-Clause 5.1.1.2: Representatives are responsible for advocating on behalf of their organizations to ensure that KUCSA policies and initiatives consider diverse student interests.

● Sub-Clause 5.1.1.3: They shall participate in NEC meetings upon invitation, particularly when agenda items pertain to matters affecting student organizations.

Clause 5.1.2: Facilitation of KUCSA Initiatives

● Sub-Clause 5.1.2.1: Representatives shall assist in promoting and implementing KUCSA programs, campaigns, and events within their organizations.

● Sub-Clause 5.1.2.2: They shall encourage member participation in KUCSA events and initiatives, fostering a culture of engagement and support for KUCSA’s goals.

● Sub-Clause 5.1.2.3: Representatives shall report back to KUCSA on the reception and effectiveness of KUCSA’s initiatives within their organizations.

Sub-Section 5.2: Appointment, Eligibility, and Term of Organizational Representatives

Clause 5.2.1: Eligibility Criteria

● Sub-Clause 5.2.1.1: Representatives must be active members of the recognized student organization they represent.

● Sub-Clause 5.2.1.2: They must be in good academic and disciplinary standing within their institutions.

● Sub-Clause 5.2.1.3: Representatives should demonstrate commitment to the objectives of both KUCSA and their student organization, as well as strong communication and leadership skills.

Clause 5.2.2: Appointment Process

● Sub-Clause 5.2.2.1: Organizational Representatives shall be appointed by their respective student organizations through an internal election or selection process.

● Sub-Clause 5.2.2.2: Each student organization shall inform KUCSA of their designated representative, who will serve as the primary point of contact.

● Sub-Clause 5.2.2.3: In case of a vacancy, the organization must appoint a new representative within 30 days to maintain consistent representation.

Clause 5.2.3: Term of Service

● Sub-Clause 5.2.3.1: Representatives shall serve a one-year term, renewable upon reappointment by their respective organizations.

● Sub-Clause 5.2.3.2: Representatives may be reappointed or replaced at the discretion of their organization’s leadership, subject to KUCSA’s approval of continuity.

Sub-Section 5.3: Roles and Functions of Organizational Representatives

Clause 5.3.1: Communication and Reporting

● Sub-Clause 5.3.1.1: Representatives shall maintain open communication channels between KUCSA and their organization, ensuring regular updates on KUCSA’s initiatives, policies, and events.

● Sub-Clause 5.3.1.2: They shall submit quarterly reports to the NEC summarizing their organization’s feedback, concerns, and suggestions related to KUCSA activities.

● Sub-Clause 5.3.1.3: Representatives shall attend mandatory briefing sessions conducted by KUCSA to stay informed about upcoming projects and expectations.

Clause 5.3.2: Event Coordination and Participation

● Sub-Clause 5.3.2.1: Organizational Representatives shall coordinate their organization’s participation in KUCSA events, fostering collaboration and joint activities when possible.

● Sub-Clause 5.3.2.2: They are encouraged to organize collaborative events or initiatives that align with KUCSA’s mission, promoting unity among various student organizations.

● Sub-Clause 5.3.2.3: Representatives shall facilitate the involvement of their members in KUCSA initiatives, including awareness campaigns, community service, and social events.

Clause 5.3.3: Conflict Resolution and Mediation

● Sub-Clause 5.3.3.1: Representatives shall help mediate conflicts that may arise between their organization and KUCSA, seeking amicable solutions in consultation with the NEC.

● Sub-Clause 5.3.3.2: They are responsible for addressing concerns within their organization regarding KUCSA’s policies, reporting unresolved issues to the NEC.

● Sub-Clause 5.3.3.3: Representatives are expected to adhere to KUCSA’s conflict resolution guidelines, ensuring that all disputes are managed professionally and fairly.

Sub-Section 5.4: Evaluation, Accountability, and Disciplinary Measures

Clause 5.4.1: Performance Evaluation

● Sub-Clause 5.4.1.1: The NEC shall conduct bi-annual performance evaluations for Organizational Representatives, focusing on engagement levels, communication, and adherence to duties.

● Sub-Clause 5.4.1.2: Evaluations will consider feedback from the respective student organization’s leadership and members to assess representative effectiveness.

● Sub-Clause 5.4.1.3: Representatives with exemplary performance may receive recognition or additional responsibilities within KUCSA.

Clause 5.4.2: Accountability and Transparency

● Sub-Clause 5.4.2.1: Representatives shall maintain transparency in all official actions, including event organization and communication with KUCSA.

● Sub-Clause 5.4.2.2: They must document and report their activities to KUCSA, ensuring a record of accomplishments, issues, and collaborative efforts.

● Sub-Clause 5.4.2.3: Representatives shall uphold KUCSA’s values, avoiding actions that could reflect poorly on KUCSA or their organization.

Clause 5.4.3: Disciplinary Actions

● Sub-Clause 5.4.3.1: Any representative failing to perform their duties or acting against KUCSA’s interests may face disciplinary action, including suspension or removal.

● Sub-Clause 5.4.3.2: The NEC shall investigate and decide on disciplinary cases, providing representatives with an opportunity to respond to any allegations.

● Sub-Clause 5.4.3.3: Representatives have the right to appeal disciplinary decisions, with the NEC’s final ruling being binding.

Sub-Section 5.5: Powers and Limitations of Organizational Representatives

This sub-section outlines the authority and responsibilities of Organizational Representatives, who serve as liaisons between KUCSA and various student organizations. Their role is instrumental in fostering collaboration, ensuring effective communication, and aligning organizational activities with KUCSA’s mission. The defined powers and limitations ensure that representatives act in the best interests of bothKUCSA and their respective organizations while avoiding conflicts of interest and upholding KUCSA’s integrity.

Clause 5.5.1: Powers of Organizational Representatives

Sub-Clause 5.5.1.1: Representatives shall have the authority to speak on behalf of their organization within KUCSA, provided their statements align with both KUCSA’s and their organization’s policies.

● Sub-Clause 5.5.1.1.1: Representatives may participate in NEC discussions and provide insights or proposals based on their organization’s perspective, ensuring they reflect the collective interests of their members.
