◆ Sub-Clause 14.1.13.2: Report on the long-term benefits of projects, focusing on sustainability and community impact.

Clause 14.1.14: Continuous Learning and Adaptation

◆ Sub-Clause 14.1.14.1: Stay updated on new project management practices, tools, and technologies.

◆ Sub-Clause 14.1.14.2: Incorporate best practices and learnings from past projects into current and future initiatives.

Clause 14.1.15: Team Motivation and Morale

◆ Sub-Clause 14.1.15.1: Foster a positive work environment that encourages team productivity and morale.

◆ Sub-Clause 14.1.15.2: Recognize and reward team members' contributions and achievements.

Clause 14.1.16: Data Collection and Analysis

◆ Sub-Clause 14.1.16.1: Design data collection processes to monitor project outcomes and measure success.

◆ Sub-Clause 14.1.16.2: Analyze collected data to guide future decision-making and project improvement.

Clause 14.1.17: Conflict Resolution

◆ Sub-Clause 14.1.17.1: Address conflicts within the project team or with stakeholders promptly and professionally.

◆ Sub-Clause 14.1.17.2: Mediate and resolve disputes to maintain project momentum and positive working relationships.

Clause 14.1.18: Project Archiving and Knowledge Management

◆ Sub-Clause 14.1.18.1: Maintain a repository of project documentation, lessons learned, and best practices.

◆ Sub-Clause 14.1.18.2: Ensure easy access to archived materials for future reference and training.

Clause 14.1.19: Adaptation to Technological Advancements

◆ Sub-Clause 14.1.19.1: Embrace emerging technologies to enhance project efficiency, such as AI tools for data analysis or AR for stakeholder engagement.

◆ Sub-Clause 14.1.19.2: Recommend suitable technologies for project management to the NEC as required.

Sub-Section 14.2: Project Budgeting and Financial Oversight

Clause 14.2.1: Budget Development

◆ Sub-Clause 14.2.1.1: Develop project budgets and seek approval from the NEC.

◆ Sub-Clause 14.2.1.2: Coordinate with the Treasurer to manage disbursements and track financial transactions.

Clause 14.2.2: Financial Documentation

◆ Sub-Clause 14.2.2.1: Ensure that all project expenditures are properly documented.

◆ Sub-Clause 14.2.2.2: Comply with KUCSA’s financial policies for all transactions related to projects.

◆ Sub-Clause 14.2.2.3: Prepare and submit a financial report upon project completion.

Sub-Section 14.3: Project Compliance and Quality Assurance

Clause 14.3.1: Quality Standards

◆ Sub-Clause 14.3.1.1: Establish quality standards for each project phase to ensure high standards.

◆ Sub-Clause 14.3.1.2: Conduct regular quality assessments to ensure project outputs meet predetermined metrics.

Clause 14.3.2: Compliance with Policies and Legal Requirements

◆ Sub-Clause 14.3.2.1: Ensure projects comply with all relevant KUCSA policies, procedures, and legal requirements.

◆ Sub-Clause 14.3.2.2: Promote ethical practices and transparency throughout all project phases.

Sub-Section 14.4: Stakeholder Engagement and Communication

Clause 14.4.1: Stakeholder Identification and Engagement

◆ Sub-Clause 14.4.1.1: Identify and engage relevant internal and external stakeholders for each project.

◆ Sub-Clause 14.4.1.2: Act as the liaison between KUCSA and project stakeholders.

Clause 14.4.2: Communication Plans

◆ Sub-Clause 14.4.2.1: Develop communication plans to keep stakeholders informed of project goals, updates, and outcomes.

◆ Sub-Clause 14.4.2.2: Organize project launch events, meetings, and closing ceremonies.

◆ Sub-Clause 14.4.2.3: Regularly update KUCSA members on project progress via newsletters, emails, or social media.

Sub-Section 14.5: Project Evaluation and Reporting

Clause 14.5.1: Performance Metrics

◆ Sub-Clause 14.5.1.1: Establish key performance indicators (KPIs) to evaluate project success.

◆ Sub-Clause 14.5.1.2: Conduct mid-project evaluations to assess progress and implement improvements.

Clause 14.5.2: Post-Project Evaluation

◆ Sub-Clause 14.5.2.1: Compile project performance data to inform decisions on future projects.

◆ Sub-Clause 14.5.2.2: Submit a comprehensive project evaluation report to the NEC and relevant committees.

Sub-Section 14.6: Capacity Building and Skill Development

Clause 14.6.1: Training and Development

◆ Sub-Clause 14.6.1.1: Organize training sessions on project management for KUCSA project team members.

◆ Sub-Clause 14.6.1.2: Encourage team members to participate in workshops related to project management.

Clause 14.6.2: Mentorship and Support

◆ Sub-Clause 14.6.2.1: Provide mentorship to student leaders involved in project implementation.

◆ Sub-Clause 14.6.2.2: Guide team members to develop relevant project-related skills.

Sub-Section 14.7: Innovation and Continuous Improvement

Clause 14.7.1: Use of Innovative Tools

◆ Sub-Clause 14.7.1.1: Encourage the use of innovative project management tools and techniques.

◆ Sub-Clause 14.7.1.2: Research and implement best practices in project management.

Clause 14.7.2: Continuous Improvement

◆ Sub-Clause 14.7.2.1: Facilitate brainstorming sessions to generate innovative project ideas.

◆ Sub-Clause 14.7.2.2: Collect feedback from completed projects to identify areas for improvement.

Section 15: Legal Director

The Legal Director provides comprehensive legal guidance, ensures compliance with all relevant laws and regulations, mitigates legal risks, and represents KUCSA in legal matters. The Legal Director acts as a legal advisor to KUCSA's leadership, ensuring that all decisions, contracts, and activities align with the law and the organization's principles.

Sub-Section 15.1: Roles and Duties of the Legal Director

Clause 15.1.1: Legal Advisory

★ Sub-Clause 15.1.1.1: Provide counsel to the NEC on legal implications of policies, decisions, and strategies.

★ Sub-Clause 15.1.1.2: Advise on changes in laws and regulations affecting KUCSA’s operations.

Clause 15.1.2: Compliance Oversight

★ Sub-Clause 15.1.2.1: Ensure KUCSA’s policies comply with Kenyan law, university guidelines, and institutional standards.

★ Sub-Clause 15.1.2.2: Coordinate compliance audits to verify adherence to regulatory requirements.

Clause 15.1.3: Contractual Review

★ Sub-Clause 15.1.3.1: Review, draft, and revise contracts, memoranda, and agreements to protect KUCSA’s interests.

★ Sub-Clause 15.1.3.2: Negotiate terms with external partners to ensure favorable conditions for KUCSA.

Clause 15.1.4: Legal Representation

★ Sub-Clause 15.1.4.1: Represent KUCSA in legal disputes, mediations, or court proceedings.

★ Sub-Clause 15.1.4.2: Liaise with external legal counsel as necessary to handle complex legal cases.

Clause 15.1.5: Policy Development and Review

★ Sub-Clause 15.1.5.1: Collaborate with the NEC to develop and implement KUCSA policies that align with legal standards.

★ Sub-Clause 15.1.5.2: Regularly review existing policies and recommend updates as laws evolve.

Clause 15.1.6: Risk Management and Mitigation

★ Sub-Clause 15.1.6.1: Identify legal risks in KUCSA’s activities and advise preventive actions.

★ Sub-Clause 15.1.6.2: Develop protocols to mitigate potential legal challenges in KUCSA’s operations.

Clause 15.1.7: Legal Documentation and Record-Keeping

★ Sub-Clause 15.1.7.1: Ensure accurate documentation and secure storage of all legal documents, agreements, and records.

★ Sub-Clause 15.1.7.2: Maintain a legal database for easy access and reference by authorized personnel.

Clause 15.1.8: Intellectual Property Protection

★ Sub-Clause 15.1.8.1: Safeguard KUCSA’s intellectual property, including logos, documents, and other proprietary information.

★ Sub-Clause 15.1.8.2: Register trademarks or copyrights as necessary to protect KUCSA's brand and identity.

Clause 15.1.9: Training and Education

★ Sub-Clause 15.1.9.1: Organize legal training sessions for NEC members to ensure they understand legal obligations.

★ Sub-Clause 15.1.9.2: Raise awareness on emerging legal issues, rights, and responsibilities among KUCSA members.

Clause 15.1.10: Dispute Resolution and Mediation

★ Sub-Clause 15.1.10.1: Act as a mediator in internal disputes within KUCSA to resolve issues amicably.

★ Sub-Clause 15.1.10.2: Facilitate negotiation sessions to address conflicts with external partners or stakeholders.

Clause 15.1.11: Ethical Compliance and Code of Conduct

★ Sub-Clause 15.1.11.1: Oversee adherence to KUCSA’s ethical standards and code of conduct.

★ Sub-Clause 15.1.11.2: Investigate reported breaches and recommend disciplinary actions as appropriate.

Clause 15.1.12: Representation in Regulatory Bodies

★ Sub-Clause 15.1.12.1: Serve as KUCSA’s legal representative in university councils, regulatory boards, or other governing bodies.

★ Sub-Clause 15.1.12.2: Advocate for KUCSA’s interests in discussions affecting students' legal rights.

Clause 15.1.13: Data Privacy and Protection

★ Sub-Clause 15.1.13.1: Ensure that KUCSA complies with data privacy laws and secures members' personal information.

★ Sub-Clause 15.1.13.2: Develop guidelines for data handling, storage, and protection within KUCSA activities.

Clause 15.1.14: Anti-Discrimination and Equality Enforcement

★ Sub-Clause 15.1.14.1: Promote KUCSA’s commitment to equal opportunities, diversity, and non-discrimination.

★ Sub-Clause 15.1.14.2: Address and resolve complaints related to discrimination within KUCSA.

Clause 15.1.15: Contractual Obligations and Enforcement

★ Sub-Clause 15.1.15.1: Monitor compliance with contractual obligations KUCSA enters into with other parties.

★ Sub-Clause 15.1.15.2: Take appropriate actions when contract terms are breached by external or internal parties.

Clause 15.1.16: Legal Innovation and Strategy

★ Sub-Clause 15.1.16.1: Explore legal innovations that may benefit KUCSA, such as tech-driven compliance tools.

★ Sub-Clause 15.1.16.2: Develop strategies to modernize KUCSA’s legal practices and enhance operational efficiency.

Clause 15.1.17: Student Rights Advocacy

★ Sub-Clause 15.1.17.1: Advocate for students' rights within KUCSA and partner institutions, including academic and residential rights.

★ Sub-Clause 15.1.17.2: Provide legal support and guidance to students facing institutional challenges.

Clause 15.1.18: Compliance Audits

★ Sub-Clause 15.1.18.1: Conduct periodic audits to assess KUCSA's legal and compliance standing.

★ Sub-Clause 15.1.18.2: Report findings to the NEC and recommend corrective measures.

Clause 15.1.19: Public Policy Engagement

★ Sub-Clause 15.1.19.1: Represent KUCSA in public policy discussions that may affect student welfare.

★ Sub-Clause 15.1.19.2: Prepare legal position statements on proposed policies impacting the student community.

Clause 15.1.20: Environmental and Social Responsibility

★ Sub-Clause 15.1.20.1: Ensure KUCSA projects align with environmental and social responsibility standards.

★ Sub-Clause 15.1.20.2: Promote sustainable practices within KUCSA’s activities, advocating compliance with environmental laws.

CHAPTER FOUR: ELECTIONS

Article 6: Election Procedures

Section 1: Eligibility for Office

Sub-Section 1.1 General Eligibility Requirements for Candidates

● Clause 1.1.1 Must be a student enrolled in a recognized institution in Kenya and in good academic standing.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.1.1 "Good academic standing" shall be defined as meeting the minimum academic requirements for progression within the institution, without any probationary or conditional status.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.1.2 Proof of enrollment and academic standing must be certified by the institution’s registrar or equivalent authority.

● Clause 1.1.2 Must not have any unresolved disciplinary cases at the time of application or election.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.2.1 Disciplinary cases shall include any formal investigations, warnings, or sanctions initiated by the institution’s disciplinary committee.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.2.2 Candidates with prior disciplinary records must present documented evidence of resolution or clearance.

● Clause 1.1.3 Must have completed at least one academic year in their institution, except for first-year representative positions.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.3.1 Candidates for general office positions must have completed at least two semesters in their current program.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.3.2 First-year representative candidates are required to submit an endorsement letter from their class or departmental representative.

● Clause 1.1.4 Must meet a minimum grade point average (GPA) of 2.5 or equivalent, as determined by the academic standards committee.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.4.1 GPA verification must be confirmed by the candidate’s institution and documented as part of the nomination process.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.4.2 For institutions that do not use a GPA system, an equivalent performance measure must be approved by the Election Committee.

● Clause 1.1.5 Must not be serving a current term in another elected office within KUCSA or any conflicting position in a similar organization.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.5.1 Candidates must declare any current or past leadership positions in any other student associations, unions, or societies.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.5.2 Individuals in appointed roles within KUCSA may run for elected office only if they resign from their appointed roles prior to nomination.

● Clause 1.1.6 Must submit a completed nomination form with at least 20 endorsements from other students, including representatives from at least three different institutions.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.6.1 Endorsement forms must include valid student identification numbers, contact information, and signatures.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.6.2 Endorsements from representatives must be documented and certified by respective institutional coordinators.

● Clause 1.1.7 Must agree to a code of conduct outlining expected behavior before, during, and after the election process.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.7.1 Candidates must sign a declaration of compliance with KUCSA's election guidelines and ethical standards.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.7.2 Any violation of the code of conduct may lead to disqualification or removal from office if elected.

Sub-Section 1.2 Specific Qualifications for Higher Executive Positions

● Clause 1.2.1 Candidates for Executive Council positions (e.g., President, Vice President, Secretary-General) must have held a previous leadership role within KUCSA or their institution.

○ Sub-Clause 1.2.1.1 Acceptable leadership roles include positions in university councils, class or departmental representative roles, or positions within recognized student organizations.

○ Sub-Clause 1.2.1.2 Experience requirements may be waived if candidates demonstrate significant contributions or involvement in KUCSA events and activities.

● Clause 1.2.2 Candidates for Treasurer positions must demonstrate financial competency and management experience, either through academic coursework or prior roles.

○ Sub-Clause 1.2.2.1 Candidates may be required to present a written recommendation from a faculty member or professional reference attesting to their financial skills.

● Clause 1.2.3 Candidates for the Public Relations position must have prior experience in communication, social media, event coordination, or outreach programs.

○ Sub-Clause 1.2.3.1 Candidates may provide a portfolio of past projects or roles related to public relations, communication, or media.

Sub-Section 1.3 Disqualifying Factors for Candidacy

● Clause 1.3.1 Candidates must not have a criminal record or be under investigation for criminal activities.

○ Sub-Clause 1.3.1.1 Any candidate with a pending criminal case or record of conviction will be deemed ineligible for office.

● Clause 1.3.2 Candidates must not have any prior impeachment or removal from office within KUCSA or any other university association.

○ Sub-Clause 1.3.2.1 If previously impeached or removed, a candidate must demonstrate they have been reinstated or cleared by the relevant authority.

● Clause 1.3.3 Candidates who have violated any KUCSA policies within the past two years are ineligible to run.

○ Sub-Clause 1.3.3.1 Violations include actions that resulted in formal sanctions, reprimands, or warnings issued by KUCSA.

Sub-Section 1.4 Additional Requirements for Nomination

● Clause 1.4.1 All candidates must attend a mandatory pre-nomination workshop conducted by the Election Committee.

○ Sub-Clause 1.4.1.1 The workshop shall include a briefing on campaign rules, ethical standards, and electoral processes.

○ Sub-Clause 1.4.1.2 Attendance shall be recorded, and absence may result in disqualification.

● Clause 1.4.2 Candidates must submit a brief manifesto detailing their vision, goals, and intended contributions to KUCSA.

○ Sub-Clause 1.4.2.1 Manifestos must be no longer than two pages and should outline specific action items and policy proposals.

○ Sub-Clause 1.4.2.2 Manifestos shall be reviewed by the Election Committee to ensure they align with KUCSA’s objectives.

● Clause 1.4.3 Candidates must provide a character reference from a faculty member or mentor who can attest to their leadership potential and integrity.

○ Sub-Clause 1.4.3.1 Character references must be submitted in a sealed envelope or digitally signed and sent directly to the Election Committee.

Sub-Section 1.5 Oath of Candidacy

● Clause 1.5.1 All eligible candidates must take an Oath of Candidacy administered by the Election Committee.

○ Sub-Clause 1.5.1.1 The oath shall require candidates to affirm their commitment to fair and transparent elections, abiding by KUCSA’s Constitution and all election regulations.

○ Sub-Clause 1.5.1.2 Violation of the oath may lead to disqualification, even after election.

Section 2: Election Process

Sub-Section 2.1 Election Timing and Notification

● Clause 2.1.1 Elections shall be conducted annually, on a date set by the Executive Council, and shall be announced at least 60 days prior to the election.

○ Sub-Clause 2.1.1.1 The election date shall be set in consultation with representatives from member institutions to avoid conflicts with examination periods or institutional events.

○ Sub-Clause 2.1.1.2 If unforeseen circumstances necessitate a change in the election date, the Executive Council must provide at least 30 days' notice of the new date.

● Clause 2.1.2 The Election Committee shall notify all members of KUCSA, through both digital and physical notice boards, regarding the timelines, procedures, and candidate eligibility requirements.

○ Sub-Clause 2.1.2.1 Digital notifications shall include emails, social media posts, and updates on the official KUCSA website.

○ Sub-Clause 2.1.2.2 Physical notifications shall be posted in common areas within each institution, such as student centers and cafeterias.

● Clause 2.1.3 Nomination papers shall be available to interested candidates from the Election Committee 45 days before the election.

○ Sub-Clause 2.1.3.1 Nomination forms shall be accessible both online and at designated KUCSA offices in each institution.

○ Sub-Clause 2.1.3.2 Candidates must submit completed nomination papers 30 days before the election date to allow for adequate vetting.

Sub-Section 2.2 Formation and Role of the Election Committee

● Clause 2.2.1 The Election Committee shall comprise seven (7) impartial members, including a chairperson, secretary, and representatives from three distinct institutions.

○ Sub-Clause 2.2.1.1 The Chairperson of the Election Committee must have prior experience in managing elections or student governance processes.

○ Sub-Clause 2.2.1.2 At least one member of the Election Committee must possess expertise in information technology to oversee any electronic voting systems used.

● Clause 2.2.2 The Election Committee is responsible for conducting candidate vetting, overseeing voting procedures, and ensuring that election standards are met.

○ Sub-Clause 2.2.2.1 The Committee shall establish a vetting sub-committee to review the eligibility of each candidate based on KUCSA criteria.

○ Sub-Clause 2.2.2.2 The Committee shall develop and document clear protocols for handling election complaints, disputes, and appeals.

● Clause 2.2.3 Members of the Election Committee shall be appointed by the Executive Council and approved by the General Assembly at least 90 days before the election.

○ Sub-Clause 2.2.3.1 The term of Election Committee members shall last until the announcement of election results, after which they shall step down.

○ Sub-Clause 2.2.3.2 Members can be reappointed for future elections, provided there are no conflicts of interest or pending complaints against them.

● Clause 2.2.4 Members of the Election Committee are prohibited from endorsing or campaigning for any candidate.

○ Sub-Clause 2.2.4.1 Any Election Committee member found in violation of this clause will face immediate removal from the Committee.

Sub-Section 2.3 Campaigning Guidelines

● Clause 2.3.1 Campaigning shall begin no sooner than 30 days before the election day and must cease 24 hours prior to the voting period.

○ Sub-Clause 2.3.1.1 Campaigning outside of the designated period may result in disqualification of the candidate involved.

○ Sub-Clause 2.3.1.2 Candidates must inform the Election Committee of any planned rallies or events, which must not disrupt academic activities.

● Clause 2.3.2 Candidates are required to submit a campaign plan to the Election Committee, which must approve all campaign materials for compliance with KUCSA policies.

○ Sub-Clause 2.3.2.1 Campaign plans should outline campaign strategies, intended platforms (e.g., social media, posters), and estimated budgets.

○ Sub-Clause 2.3.2.2 All campaign materials must carry the KUCSA approval stamp to be eligible for distribution.

● Clause 2.3.3 The use of hate speech, defamatory language, and any form of harassment in campaigns is strictly prohibited.

○ Sub-Clause 2.3.3.1 Candidates found using prohibited language or behavior may face disciplinary action and potential disqualification.

● Clause 2.3.4 Campaigning within university libraries, lecture halls, or any areas designated as study zones is not permitted.

○ Sub-Clause 2.3.4.1 Campaign activities should be restricted to designated areas such as student centers, cafeterias, and common outdoor spaces.

● Clause 2.3.5 All campaign expenses must be accounted for, and each candidate must provide a statement of expenses to the Election Committee.

○ Sub-Clause 2.3.5.1 Candidates are encouraged to adhere to a spending cap to ensure a fair and equitable election process.

○ Sub-Clause 2.3.5.2 Failure to provide a complete statement of expenses may result in disqualification.

Sub-Section 2.4 Voting Process

● Clause 2.4.1 Voting shall take place through a secure electronic platform or physical ballots, as determined by the Election Committee.

○ Sub-Clause 2.4.1.1 Electronic voting systems must be tested and verified by an independent IT team to ensure security and integrity.

○ Sub-Clause 2.4.1.2 Physical ballots shall be printed under strict confidentiality, with ballots distributed only at official polling stations.

● Clause 2.4.2 The voting period shall be no less than 8 hours and no more than 48 hours, to ensure all eligible members have an opportunity to vote.

○ Sub-Clause 2.4.2.1 Voting hours shall be announced at least 15 days prior to the election.

● Clause 2.4.3 Each voter must verify their identity with a valid student ID or approved identification number to participate.

○ Sub-Clause 2.4.3.1 Online voters will be required to log in using a unique student identification code linked to their institution.

● Clause 2.4.4 The Election Committee shall ensure that voting is conducted anonymously and securely, with provisions to prevent double-voting and other forms of fraud.

○ Sub-Clause 2.4.4.1 Any reported attempts of vote tampering or fraud will be investigated, and responsible parties may face disqualification or disciplinary actions.

● Clause 2.4.5 A quorum of 50% of the KUCSA membership must participate for the election to be considered valid.

○ Sub-Clause 2.4.5.1 In the event of low turnout, the Election Committee may extend voting hours or reschedule the election within 7 days.

Sub-Section 2.5 Results Announcement

● Clause 2.5.1 Election results shall be announced within 24 hours after the close of voting, and results shall be verified and certified by the Election Committee.

○ Sub-Clause 2.5.1.1 Results shall be posted on official KUCSA platforms, including the website, social media, and physical notice boards.

○ Sub-Clause 2.5.1.2 Detailed voting statistics, including voter turnout and breakdown by institution, shall be made publicly available.

● Clause 2.5.2 In the event of a tie, a run-off election shall be held within 72 hours, involving only the tied candidates.

○ Sub-Clause 2.5.2.1 The run-off election shall follow the same voting process as the initial election, with results announced within 24 hours after voting.

○ Sub-Clause 2.5.2.2 If the run-off election also results in a tie, the Election Committee shall consult with the Executive Council to determine a suitable resolution.

● Clause 2.5.3 Any objections to the election results must be submitted in writing to the Election Committee within 48 hours after the results announcement.

○ Sub-Clause 2.5.3.1 Objections shall be reviewed within 7 days, with the Election Committee issuing a formal response or conducting a recount if necessary.

○ Sub-Clause 2.5.3.2 In cases of proven election irregularities, the Election Committee may nullify the results and order a re-election within 14 days.

Section 3: Electoral Positions

This section outlines the various electoral positions within the Kenya Universities and Colleges Students Association (KUCSA) and details the responsibilities and roles of each office. Each position contributes to the organization’s objectives, governance, and representation of its members. Below are the positions and expanded descriptions of their roles, responsibilities, and eligibility criteria.

Sub-Section 3.1 Executive Positions

These positions form the Executive Council, responsible for strategic decision-making and highlevel leadership within KUCSA

Clause 3.1.1 The President

● Responsibilities:

○ Serve as the primary spokesperson and representative of KUCSA.

○ Preside over all meetings of the Executive Council and General Assembly.

○ Ensure the implementation of KUCSA’s policies and programs.

○ Supervise and coordinate the activities of all Executive Council members.

● Eligibility:

○ Must have previously served in a KUCSA leadership role for at least one academic year.

○ Must be in good academic standing and demonstrate a strong commitment to KUCSA’s vision.

Clause 3.1.2 Two Vice Presidents (VP1 for Universities and VP2 for Colleges)

● Responsibilities:

○ Assist the President in their duties, with each VP overseeing specific portfolios.

○ VP1 (Universities): Represent the Interests of University Students Within KUCSA

○ VP2 (Colleges): Represent the Interests of College Students Within KUCSA

● Eligibility:

○ Must be in good academic standing and possess prior experience in student leadership or administration.

Clause 3.1.3 The Secretary General

● Responsibilities:

○ Maintain records of all official KUCSA meetings and proceedings.

○ Prepare agendas and circulate minutes to Executive Council members.

○ Act as a liaison between KUCSA members and the Executive Council.

● Eligibility:

○ Must possess excellent organizational and communication skills.

Clause 3.1.4 Deputy Secretary General

● Responsibilities:

○ Assist the Secretary General with record-keeping and communication tasks.

○ Act as Secretary General in their absence.

● Eligibility:

○ Should demonstrate strong organizational skills and a commitment to transparent communication.

Clause 3.1.5 The Treasurer

● Responsibilities:

○ Manage KUCSA’s financial resources, including budget planning and expense tracking.

○ Prepare quarterly financial reports for the Executive Council and General Assembly.

○ Ensure transparent use of funds and compliance with financial regulations.

● Eligibility:

○ Must have knowledge of financial management or budgeting practices.

Sub-Section 3.2 Administrative Positions

These roles support the Executive Council in executing KUCSA’s day-to-day operations and ensuring effective communication and coordination.

Clause 3.2.1 The Organizing Secretary General

● Responsibilities:

○ Coordinate KUCSA events, meetings, and activities.

○ Develop and implement event plans in collaboration with other officials.

● Eligibility:

○ Must have experience in event organization or project management.

Clause 3.2.2 Deputy Organizing Secretary

● Responsibilities:

○ Assist the Organizing Secretary General in planning and executing events.

○ Act as Organizing Secretary General in their absence.

Clause 3.2.3 Representative of People with Disabilities (PWDs)

● Responsibilities:

○ Advocate for the rights and needs of students with disabilities within KUCSA.

○ Work with the Executive Council to ensure inclusivity in all KUCSA programs and policies.

● Eligibility:

○ Must have a disability or extensive experience in advocating for disability rights.

Sub-Section 3.3 Campus and Regional Positions

These roles represent and coordinate KUCSA’s initiatives at the campus and regional levels, ensuring localized needs are addressed.

Clause 3.3.1 The Campus Cabinet Secretaries/Campus Representatives

● Responsibilities:

○ Represent students from their specific campus within KUCSA.

○ Act as a liaison between the Executive Council and campus-level members.

● Eligibility:

○ Must be currently enrolled at the campus they represent.

Clause 3.3.2 The Regional Coordinators

● Responsibilities:

○ Coordinate KUCSA activities within their designated region.

○ Promote collaboration between campuses within the same region.

● Eligibility:

○ Must have prior experience in leadership or project coordination.

Sub-Section 3.4 Specialized Roles

These positions focus on KUCSA’s strategic communication, technological infrastructure, and advocacy for gender representation and legal issues.

Clause 3.4.1 The Director of Publicity

● Responsibilities:

○ Oversee KUCSA’s public relations and manage social media channels.

○ Coordinate with media outlets for coverage of KUCSA events.

● Eligibility:

○ Must have experience in communication, media, or public relations.

Clause 3.4.2 The Information Technology (IT) Manager

● Responsibilities:

○ Manage KUCSA’s digital infrastructure, including the website, databases, and communication systems.

○ Ensure data security and efficient technology operations.

● Eligibility:

○ Must possess technical skills in IT management and cybersecurity.

Clause 3.4.3 County Representatives

● Responsibilities:

○ Serve as a bridge between KUCSA and county-level student associations.

○ Advocate for regional concerns and work on county-based initiatives.

● Eligibility:

○ Should be residents of the counties they represent.

Clause 3.4.4 Male and Female Representatives

● Responsibilities:

○ Address gender-specific issues and ensure inclusivity within KUCSA programs.

○ Work with the Executive Council to promote gender balance in all activities.

● Eligibility:

○ Must demonstrate a commitment to gender equity and inclusivity.

Clause 3.4.5 The Legal Coordinator

● Responsibilities:

○ Provide legal guidance on KUCSA’s activities and ensure compliance with legal standards.

○ Assist in drafting and reviewing constitutional amendments.

● Eligibility:

○ Should have knowledge of legal principles or a background in law.

Sub-Section 3.5 Election and Succession Protocols

This sub-section provides guidelines on election processes, terms of office, and procedures in case of resignation, suspension, or removal from office.

Clause 3.5.1 Term of Office

● Each elected official shall serve a term of one (1) academic year, with the possibility of re-election for one additional term, subject to the approval of the General Assembly.

Clause 3.5.2 Resignation or Removal from Office

● In case of resignation, suspension, or removal, a by-election shall be held within 30 days to fill the vacant position.

● In the case of the President’s resignation or removal, one of the Vice Presidents shall act as President until a new election is held.

Clause 3.5.3 Vacancy Due to Academic Ineligibility

● Any official who becomes academically ineligible during their term shall step down, and a by-election will be organized to fill the vacancy within 30 days.

Clause 3.5.4 Code of Conduct and Accountability

● All elected officials must abide by KUCSA’s Code of Conduct, uphold integrity, and avoid any form of misconduct. Violations may result in disciplinary action or removal

Article 7: Election Disputes

Section 1: Election Dispute Resolution

This section provides the framework for resolving any disputes related to the election process within the Kenya Universities and Colleges Students Association (KUCSA). It ensures fairness, transparency, and accountability by establishing a Dispute Resolution Committee and outlining clear procedures for filing, reviewing, and addressing election-related complaints.

Sub-Section 1.1 Filing a Dispute

This sub-section outlines the procedure for filing a dispute regarding the election process.

● Clause 1.1.1 Any candidate, member, or student who believes there has been an infringement of election rules, procedural error, or unethical behavior may file a dispute with the Dispute Resolution Committee. Disputes must be filed within 48 hours of the announcement of results.

● Clause 1.1.2 All disputes must be submitted in a written format. The submission should clearly state the nature of the complaint, include specific evidence supporting the claim, and propose a desired resolution.

● Clause 1.1.3 A non-refundable filing fee, determined by the Executive Council, must accompany all dispute submissions to prevent frivolous claims.

● Clause 1.1.4 The Dispute Resolution Committee shall acknowledge receipt of all disputes within 12 hours, providing the complainant with a timeline for review and decision.

Sub-Section 1.2 Dispute Resolution Committee Composition

This sub-section describes the composition, responsibilities, and selection criteria of the Dispute Resolution Committee.

● Clause 1.2.1 The Dispute Resolution Committee shall be comprised of five (5) impartial members, including a chairperson, appointed by the Executive Council and approved by the General Assembly before the election period.

● Clause 1.2.2 Members of the Dispute Resolution Committee must be impartial, without active affiliations or candidate status in the current election, and may not be members of the Election Committee.

● Clause 1.2.3 At least two members of the Committee shall be representatives from different institutions to ensure diverse perspectives and neutrality.

● Clause 1.2.4 Members shall serve a renewable one-year term but are prohibited from serving on both the Dispute Resolution and Election Committees within the same election cycle.

● Clause 1.2.5 The Dispute Resolution Committee shall convene within 24 hours of receiving a dispute to assess the validity of the complaint and collect relevant evidence.

Sub-Section 1.3 Resolution Process

This sub-section outlines the process by which disputes will be reviewed and resolved by the Dispute Resolution Committee.

● Clause 1.3.1 The Dispute Resolution Committee shall ensure all parties involved in the dispute have the opportunity to present their cases. This includes the complainant, any respondent, and relevant witnesses.

● Clause 1.3.2 The Committee shall review all submitted evidence, which may include testimonies, digital records, and other materials relevant to the complaint.

● Clause 1.3.3 Upon completing the review, the Committee shall render a decision within 72 hours and provide all parties involved with a written explanation of the decision, detailing any sanctions, actions, or recommendations.

Clause 1.3.4 Possible resolutions by the Committee may include:

● Clause 1.3.4.1 Dismissal of the complaint if found to be without merit.

● Clause 1.3.4.2 Recount of votes if procedural errors in tallying are discovered.

● Clause 1.3.4.3 Disqualification of a candidate in cases of proven ethical violations or rule-breaking.

● Clause 1.3.4.4 Re-run of the election if substantial irregularities are found that could affect the outcome.

Clause 1.3.5 The Committee shall recommend corrective actions to prevent the recurrence of similar issues in future elections if procedural flaws or mismanagement are discovered.

Sub-Section 1.4 Finality of Decisions

This sub-section establishes the finality of the Committee's decisions and the limited circumstances under which an appeal may be made.

● Clause 1.4.1 Decisions of the Dispute Resolution Committee shall be binding and considered final. All parties are expected to comply with the outcomes to maintain the integrity of the election process.

● Clause 1.4.2 In cases where procedural misconduct or bias is alleged within the Dispute Resolution Committee’s handling of the complaint, an appeal may be filed with the KUCSA Board of Trustees within 48 hours.

● Clause 1.4.3 The Board of Trustees will review only procedural matters, not the substance of the original complaint, to determine if due process was observed.

● Clause 1.4.4 The decision of the Board of Trustees regarding procedural issues shall also be final and binding on all parties involved.

Sub-Section 1.5 Conflict of Interest and Recusal

This sub-section establishes guidelines for addressing conflicts of interest within the Dispute Resolution Committee.

● Clause 1.5.1 Any member of the Dispute Resolution Committee with a potential conflict of interest in a particular dispute shall declare the conflict and recuse themselves from the case.

● Clause 1.5.2 In cases of recusal, an alternate member previously approved by the General Assembly shall be appointed temporarily to ensure the Committee maintains a quorum.

● Clause 1.5.3 Failure to disclose a conflict of interest shall result in immediate removal from the Committee and possible disciplinary action.

Sub-Section 1.6 Transparency and Record-Keeping

● This sub-section details the Committee’s obligations regarding documentation and transparency.

● Clause 1.6.1 The Dispute Resolution Committee shall maintain comprehensive records of all disputes, including submissions, evidence, testimonies, and resolutions, for a period of five (5) years.

● Clause 1.6.2 Upon request, KUCSA members may access non-confidential information about dispute resolutions to promote transparency and trust in the election process.

● Clause 1.6.3 An annual report on all disputes filed, their outcomes, and subsequent improvements to election procedures shall be presented to the General Assembly.

CHAPTER FIVE: FINANCES

Article 8: Financial Management

Section 1: Source of Funds

Sub-Section 1.1 KUCSA's finances shall be derived from the following sources:

Sub-Article 1.1.1 Membership fees collected from all registered members of KUCSA.

● Clause 1.1.1.1 Membership fees shall be determined annually by the National Executive Council (NEC).

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.1.1.1 The NEC shall consult with regional KUCSA representatives before setting membership fees.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.1.1.2 A public notice of the revised membership fee must be issued at least 90 days prior to implementation.

● Clause 1.1.1.2 A grace period of three months shall be granted to members to remit their annual membership fees.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.1.2.1 The grace period shall begin from the official start of the fiscal year.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.1.2.2 Members may request an extension of up to 30 days under exceptional circumstances, subject to NEC approval.

● Clause 1.1.1.3 Failure to remit membership fees within the grace period shall result in suspension of membership privileges.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.1.3.1 Suspended members shall lose voting rights, access to KUCSA programs, and eligibility for financial aid.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.1.3.2 Membership can be reinstated upon full payment of outstanding fees, along with a late payment surcharge of 10%.

Sub-Article 1.1.2 Donations and grants received from individuals, organizations, and institutions that support KUCSA's mission.

● Clause 1.1.2.1 All donations exceeding KSh 100,000 must be declared and approved by the NEC.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.2.1.1 Declarations must include the source, amount, and intended use of the donation.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.2.1.2 Anonymous donations exceeding KSh 50,000 shall be flagged for review by the Finance Committee.

● Clause 1.1.2.2 Grants shall only be accepted if they align with KUCSA’s values and objectives.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.2.2.1 The NEC shall establish an advisory committee to assess the suitability of grants.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.2.2.2 Grants requiring matching funds must be approved by a two-thirds majority of the NEC.

● Clause 1.1.2.3 Donors and grantors shall receive regular reports on the utilization of their contributions.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.2.3.1 Reports shall be issued semi-annually and include financial summaries and impact assessments.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.2.3.2 KUCSA shall invite donors to an annual donor appreciation event to foster transparency and goodwill.

Sub-Article 1.1.3 Proceeds from KUCSA events, projects, and initiatives.

● Clause 1.1.3.1 Event budgets must be approved by the NEC.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.3.1.1 Event budgets shall include a detailed breakdown of projected costs and expected revenue.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.3.1.2 Events with budgets exceeding KSh 500,000 must be reviewed by the Finance Committee before NEC approval.

● Clause 1.1.3.2 All proceeds shall be deposited into KUCSA’s official account within 48 hours.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.3.2.1 The Treasurer shall provide a receipt for all deposits.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.3.2.2 Late deposits shall incur a penalty of 5% of the total proceeds.

● Clause 1.1.3.3 Surplus funds from events shall be allocated to the KUCSA Development Fund.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.3.3.1 The Development Fund shall finance infrastructure projects, scholarships, and long-term investments.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.3.3.2 Allocation of surplus funds must be approved by the NEC and disclosed in the annual financial report.

Sub-Article 1.1.4 Government allocations or funding where applicable.

● Clause 1.1.4.1 Allocations must be used solely for the purposes specified in the funding agreement.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.4.1.1 Misuse of government funds shall result in disciplinary actions and potential legal proceedings.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.4.1.2 A separate audit shall be conducted for government-funded projects.

● Clause 1.1.4.2 Applications for government funding shall be coordinated by the NEC.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.4.2.1 Applications must include a clear description of the project, objectives, and budget.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.4.2.2 Copies of all application documents shall be archived for future reference.

● Clause 1.1.4.3 Progress reports on government-funded projects shall be submitted quarterly.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.4.3.1 Reports shall include financial statements and updates on milestones achieved.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.4.3.2 Failure to submit reports on time may result in suspension of subsequent funding.

Sub-Article 1.1.5 Partnerships and Collaborations with External Entities

● Clause 1.1.5.1 KUCSA may enter into partnerships with corporate entities, NGOs, educational institutions, and other organizations to generate funds.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.5.1.1 Partnerships must align with KUCSA’s objectives and principles.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.5.1.2 A formal agreement outlining the terms of the partnership shall be signed and archived.

● Clause 1.1.5.2 Revenue-sharing arrangements from collaborative projects or initiatives shall be pre-approved by the NEC.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.5.2.1 A minimum of 60% of revenue from partnerships shall be allocated to KUCSA’s operational fund.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.5.2.2 A report on the revenue-sharing arrangement shall be presented to the General Assembly annually.

● Clause 1.1.5.3 KUCSA shall ensure that no partnership compromises its autonomy or reputation.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.5.3.1 An ethics review committee shall evaluate all proposed partnerships.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.5.3.2 Partnerships found to be unethical or controversial shall be terminated immediately.

Sub-Article 1.1.6 Merchandising and Branding Initiatives

● Clause 1.1.6.1 KUCSA shall generate income through the sale of branded merchandise such as clothing, stationery, and accessories.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.6.1.1 Merchandise designs shall be approved by the NEC to ensure consistency with KUCSA’s brand identity.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.6.1.2 A pricing strategy that balances affordability and profitability shall be developed annually.

● Clause 1.1.6.2 Income from merchandising shall be channeled into the KUCSA Special Projects Fund.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.6.2.1 The Special Projects Fund shall finance innovative programs and scholarships for members.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.6.2.2 An annual report on the Special Projects Fund shall be made available to members.

● Clause 1.1.6.3 KUCSA shall explore digital merchandising opportunities through e-commerce platforms.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.6.3.1 A dedicated e-commerce website or portal shall be developed and managed by the IT department.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.6.3.2 Online merchandise sales shall be monitored to ensure secure transactions and prevent fraud.

Sub-Article 1.1.7 Investment Income

● Clause 1.1.7.1 KUCSA may invest in financial instruments, property, or other viable ventures to generate income.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.7.1.1 Investment decisions shall be guided by a professional investment advisor appointed by the NEC.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.7.1.2 All investments must be approved by the General Assembly and reviewed annually.

● Clause 1.1.7.2 Income from investments shall be allocated to the KUCSA Reserve Fund.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.7.2.1 The Reserve Fund shall be utilized during financial emergencies or for major developmental projects.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.7.2.2 Withdrawals from the Reserve Fund exceeding KSh 1,000,000 shall require approval from two-thirds of the NEC.

● Clause 1.1.7.3 Risk management measures shall be implemented for all investments.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.7.3.1 An annual risk assessment report shall be prepared and presented to the NEC.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.7.3.2 Investments found to be underperforming shall be re-evaluated, and necessary adjustments shall be made.

Sub-Article 1.1.8 Endowment Funds

● Clause 1.1.8.1 KUCSA shall establish and maintain endowment funds to ensure long-term financial sustainability.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.8.1.1 Endowment contributions may be received from individuals, alumni, organizations, or institutions.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.8.1.2 Endowment funds shall be invested in low-risk ventures to preserve capital and generate steady income.

● Clause 1.1.8.2 The principal amount in the endowment fund shall not be utilized unless approved by a three-fourths majority of the General Assembly.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.8.2.1 Income generated from the fund shall be used for scholarships, infrastructure development, and special projects.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.8.2.2 A transparent report on the performance of the endowment fund shall be presented annually.

● Clause 1.1.8.3 A dedicated Endowment Fund Committee shall oversee the management and disbursement of the fund.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.8.3.1 The committee shall consist of financial experts and representatives from the NEC.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.8.3.2 The committee shall submit quarterly reports to the NEC for review.

Sub-Article 1.1.9 Income from Training and Capacity-Building Programs

● Clause 1.1.9.1 KUCSA shall offer paid training and workshops to its members and external participants to generate revenue.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.9.1.1 Training programs may include leadership development, financial literacy, career guidance, and other skill-building initiatives.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.9.1.2 A fee structure for training programs shall be determined annually by the NEC.

● Clause 1.1.9.2 Revenue from training programs shall be reinvested in organizing future capacity-building events.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.9.2.1 A portion of the proceeds, not exceeding 20%, may be allocated to KUCSA’s operational expenses.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.9.2.2 Financial records for each training program shall be submitted to the Treasurer for auditing.

● Clause 1.1.9.3 KUCSA shall collaborate with industry experts and institutions to enhance the quality of training programs.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.9.3.1 Memoranda of Understanding (MoUs) shall be signed with partners outlining roles and responsibilities.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.9.3.2 Collaborative programs must ensure affordability and accessibility for KUCSA members.

Sub-Article 1.1.10 Crowdfunding Campaigns

● Clause 1.1.10.1 KUCSA shall organize crowdfunding campaigns for specific projects or initiatives requiring additional financial support.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.10.1.1 Crowdfunding campaigns shall be approved by the NEC and aligned with KUCSA’s objectives.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.10.1.2 Campaign goals, timelines, and utilization plans must be clearly communicated to potential donors.

● Clause 1.1.10.2 Funds raised through crowdfunding shall be used exclusively for the designated purpose.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.10.2.1 Any surplus funds shall be reallocated to similar or related projects, subject to NEC approval.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.10.2.2 A comprehensive report on the campaign’s success and fund utilization shall be shared with contributors.

● Clause 1.1.10.3 Digital platforms shall be utilized to maximize the reach of crowdfunding campaigns.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.10.3.1 Social media channels and KUCSA’s official website shall be used to promote campaigns.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.10.3.2 The IT department shall ensure the security of online crowdfunding transactions.

Sub-Article 1.1.11 Alumni Contributions and Giving Programs

● Clause 1.1.11.1 KUCSA shall establish a structured program to encourage financial contributions from alumni.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.11.1.1 An Alumni Giving Program shall be created to facilitate regular donations from former members.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.11.1.2 Alumni contributors shall be acknowledged through honorary mentions, certificates, or awards during KUCSA events.

● Clause 1.1.11.2 Contributions from alumni shall primarily support scholarships, mentorship programs, and infrastructure development.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.11.2.1 A minimum of 70% of alumni contributions shall be allocated to scholarships and student support programs.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.11.2.2 The remaining funds shall be used for alumni engagement activities and improving KUCSA’s capacity-building programs.

● Clause 1.1.11.3 KUCSA shall establish a dedicated Alumni Relations Office to foster engagement and secure contributions.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.11.3.1 The Alumni Relations Office shall maintain an up-to-date database of alumni.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.11.3.2 Periodic alumni newsletters and events shall be organized to strengthen ties with former members.

Sub-Article 1.1.12 Subscription Services and Digital Content

● Clause 1.1.12.1 KUCSA shall generate income through paid subscriptions for exclusive digital content and services.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.12.1.1 Subscription services may include access to webinars, e-libraries, career resources, and mentorship programs.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.12.1.2 Subscription fees shall be affordable and determined by the NEC annually.

● Clause 1.1.12.2 Revenue from subscriptions shall fund the development and maintenance of KUCSA’s digital platforms.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.12.2.1 A minimum of 30% of subscription income shall be reinvested in platform upgrades and content creation.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.12.2.2 The remaining income shall support other KUCSA activities and initiatives.

● Clause 1.1.12.3 Quality assurance and regular updates shall be ensured for digital content and services.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.12.3.1 A Digital Content Committee shall oversee the creation and curation of exclusive resources.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.12.3.2 Feedback from subscribers shall be collected and reviewed to improve the quality of services.

Sub-Article 1.1.13 Corporate Sponsorships

● Clause 1.1.13.1 KUCSA shall seek sponsorships from corporations and businesses to support its activities and programs.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.13.1.1 Sponsorship agreements shall be formalized through written contracts that clearly outline the terms and conditions.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.13.1.2 Sponsorship opportunities shall be promoted through KUCSA’s events, publications, and digital platforms.

● Clause 1.1.13.2 Sponsored funds shall be utilized for specific projects agreed upon with the sponsor.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.13.2.1 A detailed report on the use of sponsorship funds shall be shared with the sponsoring entity.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.13.2.2 Sponsors may receive branding opportunities, such as logos on event banners or acknowledgments in official communications.

● Clause 1.1.13.3 KUCSA shall prioritize partnerships with sponsors whose values align with its mission and vision.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.13.3.1 Sponsorship proposals shall be vetted by the NEC to ensure compliance with KUCSA’s ethical standards.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.13.3.2 Partnerships with sponsors promoting harmful or unethical practices shall be prohibited.

Sub-Article 1.1.14 Merchandising and Product Sales

● Clause 1.1.14.1 KUCSA shall design and sell branded merchandise to generate additional income.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.14.1.1 Merchandise shall include items such as T-shirts, caps, stationery, and other branded products.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.14.1.2 Pricing shall ensure affordability for members while maintaining profitability.

● Clause 1.1.14.2 Proceeds from merchandise sales shall be directed toward operational costs and member benefits.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.14.2.1 A portion of the income shall be reinvested in producing more merchandise.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.14.2.2 Surplus funds shall support KUCSA’s events, scholarships, and community projects.

● Clause 1.1.14.3 A Merchandise Committee shall oversee product design, pricing, and distribution.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.14.3.1 The committee shall seek feedback from members to ensure product appeal and relevance

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.14.3.2 Regular inventory checks shall be conducted to maintain stock levels and avoid wastage.

Sub-Article 1.1.15 Collaborative Partnerships with Institutions

● Clause 1.1.15.1 KUCSA shall collaborate with educational institutions, NGOs, and other organizations for mutual benefit and revenue generation.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.15.1.1 Partnerships may involve co-hosting events, research initiatives, or joint programs.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.15.1.2 Agreements shall clearly define financial contributions and responsibilities of each partner.

● Clause 1.1.15.2 Revenue-sharing models may be adopted for collaborative projects that generate income.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.15.2.1 A standard revenue-sharing policy shall be approved by the NEC and documented in partnership agreements.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.15.2.2 Financial transparency shall be ensured in all collaborative ventures.

● Clause 1.1.15.3 KUCSA shall prioritize collaborations that enhance member opportunities and uphold its mission.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.15.3.1 Proposals for partnerships shall be reviewed and approved by the NEC.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.15.3.2 A Collaboration Committee shall monitor and evaluate ongoing partnerships to ensure alignment with KUCSA’s goals.

Section 2: Financial Accountability

Sub-Section 2.1: Responsibilities of the Treasurer

● Clause 2.1.1 The Treasurer shall maintain accurate and up-to-date financial records.

○ Sub-Clause 2.1.1.1 All financial records shall be stored in both physical and digital formats.

○ Sub-Clause 2.1.1.2 Records must include detailed income and expenditure accounts, receipts, and bank statements.

○ Sub-Clause 2.1.1.3 Records shall be updated monthly and shared with the NEC.

● Clause 2.1.2 The Treasurer shall present financial reports to the NEC and General Assembly.

○ Sub-Clause 2.1.2.1 Quarterly reports shall include income, expenses, and projections for the next quarter.

○ Sub-Clause 2.1.2.2 The annual financial report shall include a summary of the fiscal year’s activities, performance against the budget, and recommendations for the next fiscal year.

○ Sub-Clause 2.1.2.3 Reports shall be accompanied by visual representations such as charts, graphs, and tables for clarity.

● Clause 2.1.3 The Treasurer shall ensure that all financial transactions are supported by appropriate documentation.

○ Sub-Clause 2.1.3.1 Supporting documents include invoices, receipts, contracts, and bank deposit slips.

○ Sub-Clause 2.1.3.2 Documentation shall be organized and archived for a minimum of seven years.

○ Sub-Clause 2.1.3.3 The Treasurer shall ensure that all financial records are accessible for audits or member review upon request.

Sub-Section 2.2: Auditing of Financial Records

● Clause 2.2.1 Auditors shall be appointed by the NEC and approved by the General Assembly.

○ Sub-Clause 2.2.1.1 Auditors must be certified professionals with no prior affiliations to KUCSA to ensure objectivity.

○ Sub-Clause 2.2.1.2 The NEC shall rotate auditors every three years to maintain impartiality.

● Clause 2.2.2 Audited financial reports shall be made available to all members upon request.

○ Sub-Clause 2.2.2.1 Reports shall be published on KUCSA’s official website for transparency.

○ Sub-Clause 2.2.2.2 A summary of the audited financial report shall be presented during the annual General Assembly.

● Clause 2.2.3 Any discrepancies identified in the audit must be addressed within 60 days.

○ Sub-Clause 2.2.3.1 The Treasurer and the NEC shall convene a special meeting to address audit discrepancies.

○ Sub-Clause 2.2.3.2 Corrective actions, including adjustments to records or repayment of funds, must be documented and shared with members.

○ Sub-Clause 2.2.3.3 Failure to resolve discrepancies within the stipulated timeframe shall lead to further investigations and potential disciplinary actions.

Section 3: Financial Discipline

Sub-Section 3.1: Mismanagement or Embezzlement of Funds

● Clause 3.1.1 Disciplinary actions may include suspension, removal from office, or legal proceedings.

○ Sub-Clause 3.1.1.1 Suspension shall be immediate and last until investigations are concluded.

○ Sub-Clause 3.1.1.2 Removal from office shall occur upon a majority vote by the NEC or General Assembly following conclusive evidence of misconduct.

○ Sub-Clause 3.1.1.3 Legal proceedings shall be initiated in cases involving severe financial misconduct or fraud.

● Clause 3.1.2 A special committee shall investigate allegations of financial misconduct.

○ Sub-Clause 3.1.2.1 The committee shall comprise five members, including at least two independent experts.

○ Sub-Clause 3.1.2.2 The committee shall submit its findings to the NEC within 30 days.

○ Sub-Clause 3.1.2.3 Investigations must follow due process, ensuring all accused parties are given a fair hearing.

Sub-Section 3.2: Preventive Measures

● Clause 3.2.1 All financial transactions exceeding KSh 20,000 must have dual authorization from the Treasurer and one other NEC member.

○ Sub-Clause 3.2.1.1 Dual authorization shall involve written approvals and documentation.

○ Sub-Clause 3.2.1.2 Emergency expenditures must still follow this process, with retrospective approval by the NEC within seven days.

● Clause 3.2.2 A Financial Oversight Subcommittee shall be established to monitor and evaluate KUCSA’s financial practices.

○ Sub-Clause 3.2.2.1 The subcommittee shall consist of three NEC members and two independent members with financial expertise.

○ Sub-Clause 3.2.2.2 Monthly evaluations shall be conducted to identify potential risks or irregularities.

● Clause 3.2.3 Regular training on financial management and ethics shall be mandatory for all NEC members.

○ Sub-Clause 3.2.3.1 Training sessions shall be conducted annually by certified financial professionals.

○ Sub-Clause 3.2.3.2 Completion of training shall be a prerequisite for holding financial management positions in KUCSA.

Article 9: Budgeting and Expenditure

Section 1: Budget Approval

Sub-Section 1.1: Preparation and Approval of the Annual Budget

● Clause 1.1.1 The Finance Committee shall consist of the Treasurer, Secretary-General, and three other members appointed by the NEC.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.1.1 The Treasurer shall chair the Finance Committee.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.1.2 The Secretary-General shall serve as the committee’s secretary, responsible for recording minutes and ensuring that the budgeting process is in compliance with KUCSA’s constitution.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.1.3 The three appointed members shall have relevant experience in financial management, accounting, or economics.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.1.4 Appointed members shall serve a one-year term, with the possibility of reappointment based on performance.

● Clause 1.1.2 Budget preparation shall involve consultation with all KUCSA departments and committees.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.2.1 Each department and committee shall submit a budget request detailing its projected needs for the upcoming fiscal year.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.2.2 The Finance Committee shall hold consultation meetings with each department to understand the scope of their requests and align them with KUCSA’s overall strategic goals.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.2.3 The Finance Committee shall prioritize funding allocations based on the mission and objectives of KUCSA, ensuring that critical programs receive adequate resources.

● Clause 1.1.3 The draft budget must be presented to the NEC at least two months before the start of the fiscal year.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.3.1 The draft budget shall be circulated to all NEC members at least one week before the scheduled meeting for review.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.3.2 The NEC shall review the draft budget, suggest amendments, and provide feedback to the Finance Committee.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.3.3 The Finance Committee shall consider NEC feedback and make necessary revisions before submitting the final budget for approval.

○ Sub-Clause 1.1.3.4 The finalized budget shall be presented to the General Assembly for approval within 30 days of NEC approval.

Sub-Section 1.2: Content of the Budget

● Clause 1.2.1 Income shall be categorized based on sources (e.g., membership fees, grants, event proceeds).

○ Sub-Clause 1.2.1.1 Membership fees shall be forecasted based on current membership numbers and anticipated new memberships.

○ Sub-Clause 1.2.1.2 Grants and donations shall be projected based on confirmed funding agreements and anticipated partnerships.

○ Sub-Clause 1.2.1.3 Event proceeds shall be projected based on historical data from similar events and expected revenue from ticket sales, sponsorships, and merchandise.

○ Sub-Clause 1.2.1.4 Any other income sources, such as investment returns or sale of assets, shall also be included in the income projections.

● Clause 1.2.2 Expenditures shall be itemized and prioritized based on organizational objectives.

○ Sub-Clause 1.2.2.1 The budget shall include a detailed breakdown of fixed costs (e.g., salaries, rent, utilities) and variable costs (e.g., event expenses, program funding).

○ Sub-Clause 1.2.2.2 Expenditures shall be aligned with KUCSA’s key initiatives for the fiscal year, ensuring that funding is allocated to high-priority programs and projects.

○ Sub-Clause 1.2.2.3 The Finance Committee shall ensure that funds are allocated proportionally to departments that contribute to KUCSA’s strategic goals, with a focus on student welfare and development.

● Clause 1.2.3 A contingency fund of at least 10% of the annual budget shall be included to address unforeseen expenses.

○ Sub-Clause 1.2.3.1 The contingency fund shall be separate from the regular budget allocation and shall only be accessed with approval from the NEC for unexpected, essential expenses.

○ Sub-Clause 1.2.3.2 The Treasurer shall present a quarterly report on the use of the contingency fund to ensure accountability and transparency.

○ Sub-Clause 1.2.3.3 The Finance Committee may recommend adjustments to the contingency fund percentage during the budget revision process, especially if there is a significant change in the financial environment.

Sub-Section 1.3: Budget Approval Process

● Clause 1.3.1 Once the draft budget has been reviewed by the NEC, it shall be presented to the General Assembly for final approval.

○ Sub-Clause 1.3.1.1 The General Assembly shall be given at least two weeks' notice of the meeting where the budget will be discussed.

○ Sub-Clause 1.3.1.2 The General Assembly may approve the budget with or without amendments. If amendments are suggested, the budget shall be returned to the Finance Committee for revisions.

○ Sub-Clause 1.3.1.3 The budget shall be considered approved once it receives a two-thirds majority vote in favor from the General Asse

● Clause 1.3.2 In the event that the General Assembly does not approve the budget, a revised budget shall be prepared and resubmitted within 30 days.

○ Sub-Clause 1.3.2.1 The Finance Committee shall meet with the General Assembly’s representatives to understand the reasons for non-approval and make the necessary adjustments.

○ Sub-Clause 1.3.2.2 The resubmitted budget shall address concerns raised by the General Assembly, including reallocating funds or modifying budget categories.

● Clause 1.3.3 The budget shall be considered operational once it has been approved by the General Assembly and signed by the President, Treasurer, and Secretary-General.

○ Sub-Clause 1.3.3.1 The final approved budget shall be communicated to all members through email and posted on KUCSA’s website for transparency.

○ Sub-Clause 1.3.3.2 The President shall have the authority to make minor adjustments to the approved budget in case of urgent or unforeseen circumstances, provided that such changes do not exceed 5% of the total budget.

Section 2: Expenditure Control

Sub-Section 2.1: Approval of Expenditures Exceeding KSh 50,000

● Clause 2.1.1 Requests for expenditures above the KSh 50,000 limit must be submitted in writing with detailed justifications.

○ Sub-Clause 2.1.1.1 The justification must include a description of the purpose of the expenditure, a breakdown of costs, and the expected benefits to KUCSA's mission and objectives.

○ Sub-Clause 2.1.1.2 All requests must be submitted at least one week prior to the NEC meeting to allow for proper review and discussion.

○ Sub-Clause 2.1.1.3 In cases where the expenditure is for a specific department or project, the head of that department or project leader must endorse the request with a signed approval.

○ Sub-Clause 2.1.1.4 The NEC shall review the request, ensuring that it aligns with KUCSA’s priorities and budget constraints.

○ Sub-Clause 2.1.1.5 The Treasurer shall prepare a summary of all expenditure requests for the NEC to consider, including recommendations for approval or disapproval.

● Clause 2.1.2 Emergency expenditures may be approved by the Treasurer and Chairperson, subject to later ratification by the NEC.

○ Sub-Clause 2.1.2.1 Emergency expenditures are defined as those that are urgent and necessary to ensure the continued operation or safety of KUCSA, and that cannot be delayed until the next scheduled NEC meeting.

○ Sub-Clause 2.1.2.2 The Treasurer and Chairperson must jointly review and approve any emergency expenditures over KSh 50,000.

○ Sub-Clause 2.1.2.3 All emergency expenditures must be documented with clear reasons for the urgency and the method of approval, and a report must be submitted to the NEC at the next meeting for formal ratification.

○ Sub-Clause 2.1.2.4 The NEC shall have the authority to question and review any emergency expenditures, and if deemed inappropriate, the funds may be recovered or the responsible individuals held accountable.

Sub-Section 2.2: Payment Methods and Processes

● Clause 2.2.1 Petty cash transactions shall not exceed KSh 5,000.

○ Sub-Clause 2.2.1.1 Petty cash may be used for small, day-to-day operational expenses such as office supplies, transportation, and minor refreshments during meetings.

○ Sub-Clause 2.2.1.2 All petty cash transactions must be recorded in a petty cash log, with receipts and supporting documentation attached for accountability.

○ Sub-Clause 2.2.1.3 The Treasurer or an appointed financial officer shall oversee the management and disbursement of petty cash, ensuring that expenditures remain within the approved limit.

○ Sub-Clause 2.2.1.4 Petty cash records shall be reviewed monthly by the Finance Committee to ensure that all expenditures are legitimate and appropriately documented.

● Clause 2.2.2 Payments above KSh 20,000 must be made via electronic transfer or bank check.

○ Sub-Clause 2.2.2.1 Payments for services, suppliers, or vendors that exceed KSh 20,000 shall be processed using KUCSA’s official banking channels to ensure transparency and proper audit trails.

○ Sub-Clause 2.2.2.2 The Treasurer shall prepare and sign off on payment requests, ensuring that all supporting documents (e.g., invoices, contracts, or agreements) are attached before the payment is made.

○ Sub-Clause 2.2.2.3 Payments over KSh 50,000 require the signature of both the Treasurer and the President, in addition to the necessary documentation, to further ensure accountability.

○ Sub-Clause 2.2.2.4 The Treasurer shall review all high-value payments to ensure that the transactions are within the approved budget and that the service or goods have been received or are otherwise justified.

Sub-Section 2.3: Procurement and Contractual Expenditures

● Clause 2.3.1 All procurement of goods and services shall follow the approved procurement guidelines.

○ Sub-Clause 2.3.1.1 The procurement process must involve obtaining at least three competitive bids or quotations for any expenditure exceeding KSh 30,000.

○ Sub-Clause 2.3.1.2 A formal contract shall be executed for all procurement over KSh 50,000, and the terms shall be reviewed by the NEC.

○ Sub-Clause 2.3.1.3 Any procurement or contract exceeding KSh 100,000 shall require prior approval from the General Assembly.

○ Sub-Clause 2.3.1.4 The Finance Committee shall review procurement contracts to ensure that they reflect the best value for money and meet KUCSA’s operational needs.

● Clause 2.3.2 A Procurement Officer, appointed by the NEC, shall oversee all procurement activities.

○ Sub-Clause 2.3.2.1 The Procurement Officer shall ensure that all procurements are done in accordance with KUCSA’s procurement policy and that all contracts and purchases are properly documented.

○ Sub-Clause 2.3.2.2 The Procurement Officer shall work closely with the Finance Committee to ensure that sufficient budget allocations are available for proposed procurements.

○ Sub-Clause 2.3.2.3 The Procurement Officer shall also be responsible for verifying the receipt of goods or services before any payment is made.

Sub-Section 2.4: Monitoring and Reporting

● Clause 2.4.1 Regular reports on expenditures shall be submitted to the NEC for monitoring purposes.

○ Sub-Clause 2.4.1.1 The Treasurer shall provide a detailed expenditure report to the NEC at least once every month, including explanations for any variations from the approved budget.

○ Sub-Clause 2.4.1.2 The Finance Committee shall review the expenditure report and recommend corrective actions if necessary, ensuring alignment with the budget.

● Clause 2.4.2 The NEC shall monitor the financial health of KUCSA by reviewing quarterly reports and taking corrective actions as needed.

○ Sub-Clause 2.4.2.1 The quarterly report shall include an analysis of income, expenditures, and any deviations from the planned budget.

○ Sub-Clause 2.4.2.2 If any department or project is found to be overspending or mismanaging funds, the NEC shall take appropriate action, which may include reallocating funds, initiating investigations, or holding accountable the responsible parties.

Sub-Section 2.5: Financial Safeguards and Security

● Clause 2.5.1 All financial accounts shall be protected through stringent security protocols.

○ Sub-Clause 2.5.1.1 Access to KUCSA’s bank accounts shall be restricted to authorized individuals, including the Treasurer, Secretary-General, and President.

○ Sub-Clause 2.5.1.2 The Treasurer shall ensure that all electronic financial transactions are conducted securely, using encrypted systems and two-factor authentication when necessary.

○ Sub-Clause 2.5.1.3 All financial documents, including bank statements and contracts, shall be stored securely, both in digital and physical forms, to protect against unauthorized access or tampering.

● Clause 2.5.2 Regular internal audits shall be conducted to ensure compliance with expenditure controls.

○ Sub-Clause 2.5.2.1 The internal audit team shall be responsible for periodically reviewing financial records, ensuring that expenditure controls are adhered to and that all payments are properly documented.

○ Sub-Clause 2.5.2.2 The audit report shall be presented to the NEC with any recommendations for improvements in the expenditure control process.

Section 3: Monitoring and Evaluation

Sub-Section 3.1: Quarterly Reviews of Budget Implementation by the Finance Committee

● Clause 3.1.1 The Finance Committee shall conduct quarterly reviews of budget implementation, evaluating income, expenditures, and progress toward financial goals.

○ Sub-Clause 3.1.1.1 The review shall compare actual income and expenditures against the projections in the approved budget, identifying any significant variances.

○ Sub-Clause 3.1.1.2 The Finance Committee will assess whether the allocated funds are being spent in accordance with the stated organizational priorities and objectives.

○ Sub-Clause 3.1.1.3 A key focus of the review shall be on the progress of any projects or initiatives funded through the budget, evaluating whether the financial resources are achieving the intended outcomes.

○ Sub-Clause 3.1.1.4 The Finance Committee will also evaluate the effectiveness of revenue generation strategies, assessing whether KUCSA is meeting its income goals from sources such as membership fees, events, grants, and other initiatives.

○ Sub-Clause 3.1.1.5 The committee shall consult with relevant departments and project leaders during the review to ensure that the financial outlook accurately reflects the operational realities of KUCSA.

● Clause 3.1.2 Findings from the quarterly reviews shall be reported to the NEC and the General Assembly.

○ Sub-Clause 3.1.2.1 The Finance Committee shall prepare a written report summarizing the findings of each review, highlighting key areas of concern, positive performance, and any required actions.

○ Sub-Clause 3.1.2.2 The report shall include recommendations for corrective measures where necessary, such as reallocating funds, adjusting revenue goals, or modifying budget categories.

○ Sub-Clause 3.1.2.3 The Treasurer shall present the report to the NEC in a formal meeting, and a summary shall be shared with the General Assembly through the official communication channels.

○ Sub-Clause 3.1.2.4 The NEC and the General Assembly shall provide feedback on the findings, approving any recommended adjustments or directing further actions to address issues identified during the review.

○ Sub-Clause 3.1.2.5 A public summary of the review findings, excluding confidential or sensitive information, shall be made available to all KUCSA members to promote transparency.

Sub-Section 3.2: Justification and Approval for Budgetary Deviations

● Clause 3.2.1 Any deviations from the approved budget must be justified and approved by the NEC.

○ Sub-Clause 3.2.1.1 A deviation is defined as any variance from the budgeted amount, whether it involves income or expenditures.

○ Sub-Clause 3.2.1.2 The responsible officer or department requesting the deviation must provide a written justification that includes a detailed explanation of the reasons for the deviation, the expected impact on the budget, and any potential benefits or risks.

○ Sub-Clause 3.2.1.3 The justification must also include an assessment of whether the deviation aligns with the overall objectives of KUCSA and whether any alternative actions were considered before requesting additional funds or reallocation.

○ Sub-Clause 3.2.1.4 The NEC will review the justification and determine whether the deviation is warranted, ensuring that it is in line with KUCSA’s financial policies and long-term strategic goals.

○ Sub-Clause 3.2.1.5 If the deviation is approved, the Finance Committee shall ensure that the appropriate amendments are made to the budget documentation and that any necessary adjustments are reflected in the financial reports.

● Clause 3.2.2 Deviations exceeding 10% of a budgeted item require a formal explanation.

○ Sub-Clause 3.2.2.1 A deviation exceeding 10% shall prompt an in-depth review of the underlying causes, which may include poor planning, unforeseen changes in project scope, or shifts in external factors like inflation or market conditions.

○ Sub-Clause 3.2.2.2 The Finance Committee shall convene a special session to discuss significant deviations, requesting additional information from the responsible departments and project teams to ensure that the justification is credible and comprehensive.

○ Sub-Clause 3.2.2.3 In cases of excessive or frequent deviations, the Finance Committee may require the implementation of corrective actions, such as revising the budgetary framework or tightening approval processes.

○ Sub-Clause 3.2.2.4 The Finance Committee shall also assess the impact of the deviation on KUCSA’s overall financial health, ensuring that the organization can continue to meet its obligations and strategic goals.

● Clause 3.2.3 A deviation from the approved budget should not affect KUCSA’s ability to meet its financial obligations or disrupt its planned activities.

○ Sub-Clause 3.2.3.1 Any deviation that might impact KUCSA’s capacity to pay for essential services (such as salaries, utilities, or project commitments) must be addressed immediately, with clear mitigation strategies outlined.

○ Sub-Clause 3.2.3.2 The Finance Committee shall assess the severity of any deviations and advise the NEC on whether a reallocation of funds, a reduction in spending, or a deferral of non-essential activities is required.

○ Sub-Clause 3.2.3.3 In cases where a significant deviation is anticipated, the Treasurer shall communicate with stakeholders, including the NEC and General Assembly, to ensure that all parties are informed of potential risks to KUCSA’s financial stability.

Sub-Section 3.3: Persistent Budgetary Deviations and Financial Management Review

● Clause 3.3.1 Persistent budgetary deviations shall prompt a financial management review.

○ Sub-Clause 3.3.1.1 If deviations exceed 10% for consecutive quarters, the Finance Committee shall initiate a thorough financial management review, involving a detailed analysis of budget planning processes, expenditure tracking, and revenue generation.

○ Sub-Clause 3.3.1.2 The review will also examine the effectiveness of existing financial controls, approval procedures, and departmental management practices to identify any systemic issues that may contribute to ongoing budgetary deviations.

○ Sub-Clause 3.3.1.3 The review team may include external financial consultants, auditors, or other experts to provide an impartial and comprehensive assessment.

○ Sub-Clause 3.3.1.4 The Finance Committee shall issue a report with recommendations for improving financial management, which will be presented to the NEC and General Assembly for discussion and approval.

● Clause 3.3.2 The financial management review may result in changes to budgeting procedures, expenditure policies, or internal controls.
