○ Sub-Clause 3.3.2.1 The Finance Committee will assess whether KUCSA’s financial management processes need to be updated or strengthened in light of the review’s findings.

○ Sub-Clause 3.3.2.2 Changes may include introducing more stringent approval processes, tighter expenditure controls, more frequent financial monitoring, or implementing software tools for better budget tracking and forecasting.

○ Sub-Clause 3.3.2.3 The review may also recommend capacity-building initiatives for departments and project teams to improve their ability to plan and manage budgets effectively.

Sub-Section 3.4: Monitoring of Income and Fundraising Efforts

● Clause 3.4.1 The Finance Committee shall track KUCSA’s income from all sources, including membership fees, events, grants, and donations.

○ Sub-Clause 3.4.1.1 A monthly report shall be prepared to monitor income trends, identifying any shortfalls or unexpected surpluses in comparison to the projected revenue.

○ Sub-Clause 3.4.1.2 The Finance Committee shall provide recommendations to increase income generation, such as expanding membership drives, exploring new fundraising strategies, or leveraging grants and sponsorships.

● Clause 3.4.2 Fundraising activities shall be evaluated to ensure that they are efficient and align with KUCSA’s goals.

○ Sub-Clause 3.4.2.1 All fundraising efforts shall be reviewed for their cost-effectiveness, including an assessment of how much revenue is raised relative to the resources invested.

○ Sub-Clause 3.4.2.2 Fundraising activities that do not generate sufficient returns or do not align with KUCSA’s values shall be reassessed or discontinued.

CHAPTER SIX: MEETINGS

Article 10: Types of Meetings

Section 1: Annual General Meeting (AGM)

Sub-Section 1.1 Purpose and Objectives of the AGM

The AGM is the highest decision-making gathering of KUCSA and is held annually to assess the association’s overall performance, review its financial status, and set strategic goals for the upcoming year.

Sub-Section 1.2 Review of the Year’s Activities and Financial Statements

The AGM shall include a comprehensive review of KUCSA’s activities and financial status for the past year. This includes:

● Presenting annual financial statements, including income, expenses, and budget variances.

● Highlighting key achievements, challenges, and progress of the association in the previous year.

● Identifying areas for improvement and potential growth opportunities.

Sub-Section 1.3 Presentations by the National Executive Council (NEC) and Committee Reports

● The NEC shall present a summary of its activities, decisions, and future plans.

● Each committee within KUCSA shall submit a report detailing its specific objectives, completed projects, ongoing initiatives, and challenges encountered.

● Any proposed plans or objectives for the coming year shall be outlined for approval or feedback from the general membership.

Sub-Section 1.4 Member Participation and Feedback

The AGM shall serve as a platform for members to:

● Raise concerns or grievances about KUCSA’s operations, policies, or other matters.

● Suggest improvements to the constitution, regulations, or strategic goals.

● Propose new projects, programs, or areas of focus for KUCSA.

Sub-Section 1.5 Voting on Constitutional Amendments and Key Decisions

● Any proposed amendments to the KUCSA constitution or major policy decisions shall be voted upon at the AGM.

● Voting shall be conducted through a secret ballot, with a majority required to pass amendments or make significant decisions, unless otherwise stated in the constitution.

Sub-Section 1.6 Notice and Communication for the AGM

● Notice for the AGM shall be provided at least 30 days in advance.

● Communication channels for notification shall include email, social media platforms, official KUCSA website announcements, and, where applicable, SMS messages to registered members.

● The notice shall include the agenda, location or virtual link, date, and time of the AGM.

Sub-Section 1.7 Agenda Setting and Circulation of Meeting Documents

● The NEC shall prepare the AGM agenda and circulate it to all members at least 15 days prior to the meeting.

● Documents such as the previous year’s financial statements, committee reports, and any proposals for amendments or new initiatives shall be shared in advance to allow members adequate time for review.

Sub-Section 1.8 Eligibility to Attend and Participate in the AGM

● Only registered members of KUCSA are eligible to attend and participate in the AGM.

● Members may be required to present proof of membership upon entry or login for online meetings.

● Proxy attendance is allowed only under specific conditions and must be approved in advance by the NEC.

Sub-Section 1.9 Minutes and Record-Keeping

● Accurate minutes shall be recorded during the AGM, capturing key decisions, votes, and discussions.

● Minutes shall be made available to all members within 30 days following the AGM.

● The NEC shall ensure that these records are securely stored and easily accessible to members.

Sub-Section 1.10 Follow-Up on AGM Resolutions

● The NEC shall develop an action plan to implement resolutions passed during the AGM.

● Progress on resolutions shall be documented and reviewed in subsequent executive meetings and included in the following year’s AGM report.

Section 2: Special General Meetings (SGM)

Sub-Section 2.1 Purpose and Scope of Special General Meetings

The purpose of an SGM is to address urgent matters, critical issues, or unforeseen events that require immediate attention and cannot wait until the Annual General Meeting (AGM). SGMs may include but are not limited to:

● Addressing constitutional amendments or by-laws changes deemed urgent.

● Handling disciplinary matters involving high-profile cases within KUCSA.

● Reviewing and approving emergency funding or financial matters.

● Responding to significant external or internal developments affecting KUCSA or its members.

Sub-Section 2.2 Initiation of a Special General Meeting

An SGM can be called under the following conditions:

● National Executive Council (NEC) Request: The NEC may initiate an SGM to discuss urgent matters requiring collective membership input and decision.

● Member Request: An SGM may also be requested by at least 30% of KUCSA’s registered members. This request must be submitted in writing to the NEC, specifying the purpose and issues to be discussed.

Sub-Section 2.3 Notice and Agenda for Special General Meetings

● Notice for an SGM shall be provided at least 14 days in advance, allowing members sufficient time to prepare for attendance and participation.

● The notice shall specify the agenda, date, time, and location (or virtual link if the meeting is conducted online) of the SGM.

● In urgent cases, the NEC may call an SGM with shorter notice if at least two-thirds of members agree to the abridged timeline.

Sub-Section 2.4 Meeting Agenda Limitations

● The SGM shall focus solely on the specific issues for which it was convened, and unrelated matters shall not be introduced for discussion or voting.

● This focused agenda is intended to ensure efficiency and respect for the urgency of the matter at hand.

Sub-Section 2.5 Quorum for Special General Meetings

● The quorum for an SGM shall be at least one-third of registered KUCSA members.

● If the quorum is not met within one hour of the scheduled meeting time, the SGM may be rescheduled, or the NEC may determine an alternative course of action in line with KUCSA’s constitution.

Sub-Section 2.6 Voting Procedures for Special General Meetings

● Voting at an SGM shall be conducted by secret ballot or via a secure online voting platform if the meeting is held virtually.

● Each member shall have one vote, and decisions will be based on a simple majority unless otherwise specified.

● In the case of a tie, the chairperson of the NEC shall cast the deciding vote.

Sub-Section 2.7 Minutes and Documentation of Special General Meetings

● Minutes shall be taken during the SGM to document key discussions, decisions, and voting outcomes.

● These minutes shall be distributed to all KUCSA members within 14 days following the SGM to ensure transparency and accountability.

● Minutes of SGMs will be archived and made accessible for future reference by KUCSA members.

Sub-Section 2.8 Follow-Up on Resolutions Passed at the SGM

● The NEC shall develop an action plan to implement decisions made during the SGM.

● Progress on resolutions shall be reviewed at subsequent NEC meetings and reported back to members.

● The NEC shall also provide updates on these actions at the next AGM to ensure members are informed of the status of resolutions from SGMs.

Sub-Section 2.9 Communication Channels for Notice and Updates

● Notice and updates regarding SGMs shall be shared through KUCSA’s official communication channels, including email, social media, KUCSA’s website, and, if necessary, SMS.

● Special notices may also be posted in university and college forums to ensure maximum visibility among KUCSA members.

Sub-Section 2.10 Attendance and Participation Requirements

● All KUCSA members are encouraged to attend SGMs, and participation may be required for certain members based on their roles (e.g., NEC members, committee representatives).

● If an SGM is held online, members must verify their attendance by signing into the designated online platform to ensure accurate records of participation.

Section 3: Executive Meetings

Sub-Section 3.1 Purpose of Executive Meetings

Executive meetings are held to facilitate discussions, decision-making, and planning related to KUCSA's operational, financial, and strategic matters. These meetings allow the National Executive Council (NEC) to:

● Make policy decisions and address issues that impact KUCSA's daily operations.

● Plan and oversee the implementation of strategic initiatives.

● Monitor the association’s progress in meeting its goals and objectives.

● Address urgent matters that require immediate NEC intervention.

Sub-Section 3.2 Frequency and Format of Executive Meetings

● Executive meetings shall take place bi-monthly to maintain continuity in governance and oversight.

● Additional meetings may be scheduled as required, especially in cases of urgent matters or unforeseen events.

● Meetings may be held in person or virtually through secure online platforms such as Google Meet or Zoom to accommodate all NEC members.

Sub-Section 3.3 Notice and Agenda for Executive Meetings

● A minimum notice of 5 days shall be given for all executive meetings to ensure sufficient preparation time for members.

● The meeting agenda, along with any necessary documents or reports, shall be shared with NEC members in advance.

● In urgent cases, the NEC Chairperson may call an emergency executive meeting with a shorter notice period, provided all members consent to the abridged timeline.

Sub-Section 3.4 Quorum for Executive Meetings

● A quorum for executive meetings shall be achieved when at least two-thirds of NEC members are present, either physically or virtually.

● If quorum is not met within 30 minutes of the scheduled meeting time, the meeting shall be rescheduled, unless an urgent decision is required and can be addressed by the attending members, subject to constitutional limits.

Sub-Section 3.5 Roles and Responsibilities during Executive Meetings

● The President of KUCSA shall chair the meetings, guiding discussions and ensuring that all topics on the agenda are addressed.

● The Secretary-General shall document the proceedings and decisions, and distribute the minutes to all NEC members within 7 days post-meeting.

● Committee heads and other NEC members are expected to report on their respective areas, provide updates, and contribute to decision-making.

Sub-Section 3.6 Voting Procedures for Executive Meetings

● Decisions requiring a vote shall be made through a show of hands or secure online voting in the case of virtual meetings.

● Each NEC member shall have one vote, and a simple majority will carry decisions, unless otherwise specified in the constitution.

● In cases where a vote results in a tie, the President shall cast the deciding vote.

Sub-Section 3.7 Minutes and Record-Keeping

● Minutes of each executive meeting shall be recorded, detailing key points, decisions, and action items.

● The minutes shall be distributed to all NEC members within one week after the meeting for review and approval.

● The finalized minutes shall be archived and made accessible to NEC members for reference in future meetings.

Sub-Section 3.8 Follow-Up on Action Items

● NEC members shall be assigned specific action items based on the outcomes of executive meetings, with deadlines set for completion.

● The Secretary-General shall maintain a record of all action items and track their progress, providing updates in subsequent meetings.

Sub-Section 3.9 Online Executive Meetings and Security Protocols

● For online meetings, a secure platform (e.g., Google Meet or Zoom) with password protection and waiting room features shall be used to maintain privacy.

● Members are required to log in using their official KUCSA email accounts, and attendance will be recorded digitally.

● All online meeting discussions shall be treated with the same confidentiality as in-person meetings.

Sub-Section 3.10 Confidentiality and Conduct of NEC Members

● NEC members are expected to maintain confidentiality regarding all discussions and decisions made during executive meetings.

● Members shall conduct themselves with professionalism and respect for differing viewpoints, with the goal of reaching consensus in the best interest of KUCSA.

● Any breach of confidentiality or misconduct during executive meetings shall be addressed in accordance with KUCSA’s code of conduct.

Sub-Section 3.11 Reporting to the General Membership

● Key decisions and updates from executive meetings that impact the general membership shall be communicated via official KUCSA channels.

● A summary report may be published periodically, excluding confidential information, to keep members informed of the NEC’s activities and decisions.

Section 4: Online Meetings

Sub-Section 4.1 Purpose and Accessibility of Online Meetings

KUCSA recognizes the importance of accessibility, flexibility, and inclusivity; therefore, meetings can also be conducted through online platforms such as Google Meet, Microsoft Teams, or X Space to accommodate members who may not be able to attend in person. Online meetings ensure that members across different regions can participate in KUCSA’s decision-making processes effectively and consistently.

Sub-Section 4.2 Notice and Scheduling for Online Meetings

● A minimum notice of 5 days shall be provided for all online meetings, unless the meeting is urgent, in which case an emergency meeting may be called with shorter notice as per Sub-Section 4.5.

● A memo shall be released containing the date, time, and access link to the meeting platform, along with any relevant materials or agendas.

● For non-urgent online meetings, a reminder will be sent to all participants 24 hours before the meeting to ensure attendance.

Sub-Section 4.3 Online Meeting Etiquette and Participation

● Members are expected to join the meeting using their official KUCSA email accounts or verified accounts to maintain meeting security and track attendance.

● Participants should ensure a stable internet connection and a quiet environment to avoid disruptions. Members are encouraged to mute their microphones when not speaking.

● To facilitate smooth discussions, members should use the “raise hand” feature to indicate when they wish to speak and wait to be recognized by the chairperson or moderator.

Sub-Section 4.4 Voting and Decision-Making in Online Meetings

● Voting procedures in online meetings shall be conducted through secure digital methods, such as polling features within the platform or through verified online voting tools, to ensure the integrity of the voting process.

● Each member is entitled to one vote, and decisions shall be determined by a simple majority unless otherwise specified in the constitution.

● Decisions made in online meetings are binding and shall be treated with the same authority as decisions made in in-person meetings.

Sub-Section 4.5 Emergency Online Meetings

● In cases of urgent matters requiring immediate attention, the NEC may call an emergency online meeting with a shorter notice period of at least 24 hours.

● Emergency online meetings shall focus strictly on the issue at hand, and decisions made shall be formally recorded.

● A quorum of at least two-thirds of the relevant committee or council is required to validate decisions in an emergency meeting.

Sub-Section 4.6 Recording and Documentation of Online Meetings

● All online meetings shall be recorded, subject to participants' consent, to ensure an accurate account of discussions and decisions.

● The Secretary-General or designated minute-taker shall document minutes, capturing key points, decisions, and action items.

● Minutes and any approved decisions shall be distributed to members within 5 days of the meeting and archived for future reference.

Sub-Section 4.7 Technical Support and Troubleshooting

● KUCSA shall ensure that technical support is available for members experiencing difficulties joining or participating in online meetings.

● In the event of a widespread technical disruption, the meeting may be paused or rescheduled to ensure that all members have equal opportunity to participate.

● A designated IT support person or a technical contact shall be included in the meeting memo for assistance if needed.

Sub-Section 4.8 Confidentiality and Security Protocols

● Online meetings will be conducted through secure, password-protected links, with entry restricted to authorized KUCSA members only.

● Members are expected to uphold confidentiality and refrain from recording or sharing meeting content without prior approval.

● All participants will be required to accept KUCSA’s online meeting guidelines regarding data protection and confidentiality before joining each meeting.

Sub-Section 4.9 Follow-Up Actions from Online Meetings

● Action items and responsibilities identified in online meetings shall be tracked and monitored by the Secretary-General, with regular progress updates shared with relevant committees or councils.

● Any follow-up tasks assigned to members during the online meeting shall have clear deadlines, with progress reported in subsequent meetings to ensure accountability.

Sub-Section 4.10 Inclusion of Diverse Group Meetings Online

● KUCSA will facilitate online meetings for various member groups, such as male empowerment groups, female empowerment groups, special needs groups, and other subcommittees, to ensure inclusivity and representation.

● Each group will have its own agenda and may conduct meetings on a regular or ad-hoc basis to discuss issues specific to their interests and report back to the NEC or other relevant committees.

● These meetings shall follow the same guidelines and protocols for notice, confidentiality, and documentation as other KUCSA online meetings.

Sub-Section 4.11 Reporting Outcomes to the General Membership

● Summaries of key decisions and outcomes from online meetings, especially those impacting the general membership, shall be shared via official KUCSA communication channels such as the website, email newsletters, and social media.

● Sensitive information shall be withheld from general reports, ensuring confidentiality while maintaining transparency about KUCSA’s activities and decisions.

Section 5: Group Meetings

Sub-Section 5.1 Purpose and Scope of Group Meetings

● KUCSA shall facilitate meetings specifically organized for various member groups to address the unique needs, concerns, and interests of specific demographics within the student body. This includes groups such as male empowerment, female empowerment, special needs, mental health, international students, environmental sustainability advocates, and others as deemed necessary.

● Group meetings provide a safe space for members to discuss relevant issues, create action plans, and propose initiatives that align with KUCSA’s broader goals of inclusivity, representation, and empowerment.

Sub-Section 5.2 Frequency and Format of Group Meetings

● These group meetings shall be held monthly to maintain regular engagement, with additional meetings scheduled as needed based on the group's activities, objectives, or emerging issues.

● Meetings may be conducted in-person, online, or in a hybrid format to maximize accessibility for all members.

Sub-Section 5.3 Notice and Agenda Preparation for Group Meetings

● Notices for group meetings will be issued at least 7 days in advance through official KUCSA channels, including email, social media, and the KUCSA website.

● The agenda shall be tailored to each group’s objectives and interests, prepared by the group’s designated leader or facilitator, and shared with members at least 3 days before the meeting.

● Members are encouraged to propose agenda items in advance to ensure that discussions are relevant and impactful.

Sub-Section 5.4 Group Leadership and Facilitation

● Each group shall have a designated leader or facilitator, either elected by the group members or appointed by the National Executive Council (NEC), responsible for guiding discussions, preparing agendas, and ensuring productive meetings.

● Group leaders will report back to the NEC on outcomes, progress, and any action points that require broader KUCSA support or resources.

Sub-Section 5.5 Decision-Making and Voting Procedures

● Each group shall have the authority to make decisions related to its activities, initiatives, and recommendations, provided these align with KUCSA's overall objectives and policies.

● Voting within group meetings may be conducted through a show of hands, secret ballots, or digital voting platforms for online meetings. A simple majority shall determine outcomes unless otherwise specified by the group’s guidelines.

● Any decisions that require NEC approval or funding shall be formally documented and submitted for review.

Sub-Section 5.6 Documentation and Reporting of Group Meetings

● A designated secretary or note-taker from each group shall document minutes, including attendance, key discussion points, decisions made, and action items.

● Minutes and meeting summaries shall be submitted to the NEC within 5 days of each meeting and shared with group members for transparency and accountability.

● Periodic updates on each group's progress and outcomes will be included in KUCSA’s general meetings or as part of the annual report.

Sub-Section 5.7 Budget and Resource Allocation for Group Initiatives

● Each group may submit proposals for funding or resource allocation to support initiatives, projects, or events aligned with their objectives.

● The NEC will review budget requests and approve allocations based on feasibility, relevance, and availability of funds.

● Groups shall provide detailed reports on the use of funds for accountability and transparency.

Sub-Section 5.8 Communication and Feedback Channels

● Group meetings shall include an open forum for members to provide feedback on KUCSA activities, suggest improvements, and share insights relevant to the group’s focus.

● Feedback gathered from group meetings will be compiled and submitted to the NEC for consideration in KUCSA’s policy and operational decisions.

Sub-Section 5.9 Collaboration and Cross-Group Initiatives

● Groups with shared objectives or interests may collaborate on joint projects, campaigns, or events to maximize impact and resources.

● Cross-group initiatives should be coordinated with the NEC to ensure consistency with KUCSA's strategic goals and proper allocation of resources.

● Collaborative projects are encouraged to promote inclusivity, unity, and support across the student body.

Sub-Section 5.10 Evaluation and Continuous Improvement

● Each group shall conduct an annual evaluation to assess the effectiveness of its activities, member engagement, and impact.

● Evaluation results, including recommendations for improvement, shall be presented at the AGM or submitted to the NEC for review.

● Groups are encouraged to adapt their objectives and strategies based on feedback, emerging needs, and KUCSA’s evolving priorities.

Sub-Section 5.11 Inclusivity and Accessibility

● KUCSA is committed to inclusivity and shall ensure that all groups, particularly those representing marginalized or underrepresented members, have equal access to meetings, resources, and decision-making processes.

● Meeting venues (physical or online) and materials shall be accessible to all members, with accommodations for special needs, such as sign language interpretation, accessible documents, or other support as required.

Sub-Section 5.12 Confidentiality and Data Protection

● Group meetings may involve sensitive discussions; members are expected to maintain confidentiality to protect the privacy and safety of participants.

● Any personal data collected for group activities or communication purposes shall be handled in compliance with data protection regulations and KUCSA’s confidentiality policies.

Sub-Section 5.13 Recognition and Awards for Group Achievements

● KUCSA shall recognize and celebrate the achievements of various groups within the association, highlighting their contributions at annual events, in newsletters, and on official platforms.

● Outstanding group initiatives or projects that make a significant impact on the student community or society at large may be nominated for awards or other forms of recognition.

Section 6: Attendance and Punctuality of Leaders in Meetings

Sub-Section 6.1 Mandatory Attendance of Leaders

● Clause 6.1.1 All elected and appointed leaders within KUCSA, including members of the National Executive Council (NEC), committee heads, and regional representatives, are required to attend all scheduled meetings relevant to their role, including Annual General Meetings (AGMs), Special General Meetings (SGMs), executive meetings, and group-specific meetings.

● Clause 6.1.2 Leaders are expected to participate actively and fully, engaging in discussions, deliberations, and decision-making processes, as well as contributing to the achievement of meeting objectives.

● Clause 6.1.3 Leaders who are unable to attend consecutive meetings due to unavoidable reasons must inform the NEC in advance and seek approval for extended absence; failure to do so may result in disciplinary action.

Sub-Section 6.2 Notice of Absence

● Clause 6.2.1 Any leader unable to attend a meeting must provide a written notice at least 48 hours in advance, detailing the reason for their absence and expected return date, if applicable.

● Clause 6.2.2 The notice should be submitted to the NEC Secretary or designated officer through official communication channels, ensuring proper documentation.

● Clause 6.2.3 The absence notice must include the leader's name, position, reason for absence, and any relevant supporting documentation if required (e.g., medical notes).

● Clause 6.2.4 Leaders who fail to provide notice within the stipulated time frame without valid reason shall be subject to review by the Disciplinary Committee, with potential repercussions.

Sub-Section 6.3 Format of Absence Notification

● Clause 6.3.1 The notice of absence must be submitted in a formal format as outlined by KUCSA, which shall include the following elements:

○ Sub-Clause 6.3.1.1 Subject line indicating purpose (e.g., "Notice of Absence for Upcoming NEC Meeting"),

○ Sub-Clause 6.3.1.2 Salutation addressing the NEC Secretary or designated official,

○ Sub-Clause 6.3.1.3 Body of the notice with specific details on the nature of the absence, and

○ Sub-Clause 6.3.1.4 Signature of the leader and date of submission.

● Clause 6.3.2 Notices that do not adhere to this format may be considered invalid, and the leader may be subject to disciplinary measures.

Sub-Section 6.4 Disciplinary Actions for Unnotified Absences

● Clause 6.4.1 Leaders who miss a meeting without submitting an official notice or providing sufficient justification shall be summoned by the Disciplinary Committee to explain their absence.

● Clause 6.4.2 Disciplinary actions for unnotified absences may include:

○ Sub-Clause 6.4.2.1 Issuance of a formal warning,

○ Sub-Clause 6.4.2.2 Temporary suspension from specific duties or meetings,

○ Sub-Clause 6.4.2.3 Reduction in eligibility for leadership privileges or roles, and

○ Sub-Clause 6.4.2.4 In cases of repeated violations, removal from office if deemed necessary by the NEC.

● Clause 6.4.3 Leaders with multiple unnotified absences may face stricter repercussions as determined by KUCSA’s by-laws.

Sub-Section 6.5 Punctuality Requirement for NEC Meetings

● Clause 6.5.1 Punctuality is strictly mandatory for all NEC meetings. Leaders are expected to be present at the scheduled meeting time, fully prepared to contribute to discussions and decision making.

● Clause 6.5.2 Leaders who anticipate being late must notify the NEC Secretary in advance, providing a valid reason.

● Clause 6.5.3 A pattern of tardiness, without justifiable reasons, may disrupt the proceedings of the meeting and may lead to disciplinary action.

Sub-Section 6.6 Consequences of Tardiness

● Clause 6.6.1 Leaders who consistently arrive late to meetings without valid reason shall be referred to the Disciplinary Committee. The following disciplinary actions may be applied based on the severity and frequency of tardiness:

○ Sub-Clause 6.6.1.1 Verbal or written warnings,

○ Sub-Clause 6.6.1.2 Temporary suspension from specific duties,

○ Sub-Clause 6.6.1.3 Mandatory submission of a written commitment to improve punctuality, and

○ Sub-Clause 6.6.1.4 Escalation to stricter disciplinary measures for chronic lateness.

Sub-Section 6.7 Documentation of Attendance and Punctuality

● Clause 6.7.1 Attendance and punctuality records shall be maintained for each meeting by the NEC Secretary or a designated official. These records shall be reviewed quarterly and referenced during evaluations or disciplinary proceedings.

● Clause 6.7.2 The NEC shall use attendance records to identify any leaders who may require additional support to meet attendance and punctuality expectations.

Sub-Section 6.8 Excusable Absences and Emergencies

● Clause 6.8.1 Leaders may request an excusable absence without prior notice in cases of emergencies, such as medical or family crises. Such requests should be communicated at the earliest opportunity.

● Clause 6.8.2 Excusable absences shall be reviewed on a case-by-case basis by the NEC, taking into account the emergency's nature and any supporting documentation.

● Clause 6.8.3 Leaders may still be required to provide documentation after the fact, as determined by the NEC.

Sub-Section 6.9 Role of Disciplinary Committee in Enforcing Attendance Standards

● Clause 6.9.1 The Disciplinary Committee shall uphold the attendance and punctuality standards outlined in this section, ensuring that all cases are assessed fairly, consistently, and transparently.

● Clause 6.9.2 The committee shall consider extenuating circumstances and the leader’s overall record when determining any disciplinary measures.

● Clause 6.9.3 The Disciplinary Committee shall report all outcomes related to attendance-related reviews to the NEC, which may publicly disclose findings to ensure accountability.

Sub-Section 6.10 Commitment to a Culture of Responsibility

● Clause 6.10.1 KUCSA encourages leaders to cultivate a culture of responsibility, accountability, and mutual respect, where attendance and active participation are prioritized.

● Clause 6.10.2 Regular workshops and training on leadership, accountability, and professionalism shall be organized to reinforce the importance of commitment to roles and responsibilities.

● Clause 6.10.3 The NEC shall foster an environment where leaders are encouraged to communicate any attendance issues proactively, allowing for supportive solutions to be sought collaboratively.

Sub-Section 6.11 Substitute Representation

● Clause 6.11.1 In cases where a leader is unable to attend a meeting due to unavoidable circumstances, they may appoint an alternate representative from their team or committee to attend in their place, if approved by the NEC.

● Clause 6.11.2 The alternate representative must be briefed by the absent leader on all agenda items and discussions to ensure continuity in decision-making.

● Clause 6.11.3 Leaders are responsible for notifying the NEC Secretary in advance regarding the substitute representative’s attendance and their designated authority level for that meeting.

Sub-Section 6.12 Reporting and Accountability for Meeting Contributions

● Clause 6.12.1 Following each meeting, leaders are required to review and confirm their assigned tasks, as documented in the minutes, to ensure clear communication and accountability.

● Clause 6.12.2 Leaders who missed the meeting must review the official minutes and provide confirmation of their understanding of decisions made and tasks assigned within 48 hours of the minutes’ distribution.

● Clause 6.12.3 NEC shall follow up on any pending actions from absent leaders and assess their understanding of the meeting outcomes to ensure proper alignment and follow-through.

Sub-Section 6.13 Attendance and Performance Evaluation

● Clause 6.13.1 Attendance and punctuality shall be incorporated into the performance evaluation criteria for all KUCSA leaders.

● Clause 6.13.2 Consistent attendance and timely participation shall be recognized as indicators of a leader’s commitment, influencing their eligibility for future positions within KUCSA.

● Clause 6.13.3 Leaders with exemplary attendance records shall be eligible for acknowledgment and potential rewards, such as certificates or special commendations during general meetings or events.

Sub-Section 6.14 Professional Conduct and Meeting Decorum

● Clause 6.14.1 Leaders are expected to maintain a professional demeanor during all meetings, refraining from disruptive behaviors such as arriving unprepared, excessive use of mobile devices, or any actions deemed disrespectful to the proceedings.

● Clause 6.14.2 The chairperson reserves the right to address any conduct that hinders meeting productivity, including issuing verbal warnings or requesting immediate corrective actions.

● Clause 6.14.3 Repeated breaches of meeting decorum may lead to disciplinary measures, such as temporary suspension from certain meetings or additional responsibilities.

Sub-Section 6.15 Feedback and Improvement Initiatives

● Clause 6.15.1 KUCSA shall periodically solicit feedback from leaders on meeting structures, agendas, and procedures to promote continuous improvement in meeting effectiveness.

● Clause 6.15.2 The NEC Secretary shall organize quarterly feedback sessions to address any concerns or suggestions raised by leaders regarding attendance and meeting protocols.

● Clause 6.15.3 Leaders are encouraged to propose improvements or adjustments to meeting formats, aiming for more productive, inclusive, and timely gatherings that facilitate effective decision-making.

Article 11: Quorum and Voting

Section 1: Quorum

Sub-Section 1.1 Quorum for General Meetings

● The quorum for general meetings, including the Annual General Meeting (AGM) and Special General Meeting (SGM), shall be at least one-third of registered KUCSA members in good standing. This ensures that significant decisions affecting the entire association have the participation and consent of a substantial portion of the membership.

● If the required quorum is not met within an hour of the scheduled start time, the meeting shall be adjourned and rescheduled for a later date, with a second attempt requiring at least one-fourth of the membership to proceed.

Sub-Section 1.2 Quorum for Executive and Committee Meetings

● For executive meetings, such as those held by the National Executive Council (NEC), and for committee or group meetings, the quorum shall consist of at least 50% of the members or representatives specific to that meeting. This ensures that discussions and decisions reflect the views of a majority of the leadership or group members.

● In cases where the quorum is not met, a follow-up meeting may be scheduled with the quorum reduced to one-third of the executive or group members, provided this adjustment is in accordance with KUCSA’s by-laws or policies.

Sub-Section 1.3 Quorum for Online Meetings

● Online meetings shall also require a quorum, which shall be verified by members indicating their presence through the designated attendance system or platform features (such as a virtual attendance button, chat confirmation, or roll call).

● If technical issues affect attendance for online meetings, the quorum count may be adjusted temporarily to account for known connection problems, but no fewer than 40% of expected members must be present.

Sub-Section 1.4 Quorum for Emergency Meetings

● Emergency meetings called under urgent or unforeseen circumstances may have a reduced quorum requirement of one-fourth of the designated members, given the necessity for timely decision-making.

● Any decisions made in emergency meetings shall be reviewed in the subsequent general or executive meeting to ensure alignment with KUCSA policies and member interests.

Sub-Section 1.5 Attendance Tracking and Verification

● For all meetings, attendance shall be recorded in an official log (whether digital or physical), which will be maintained as part of KUCSA’s records for accountability and transparency.

● For online meetings, attendance will be verified by the designated online platform’s attendance system, with screenshots or attendance reports used for documentation.

● Members who attend via proxy must submit written authorization in advance to the meeting organizer, and the proxy will count toward quorum requirements.

Sub-Section 1.6 Quorum Notification and Member Responsibilities

● A reminder of quorum requirements shall be included in all meeting notices and agendas to ensure that members are aware of their responsibility to attend or send a representative if necessary.

● Members are encouraged to confirm their attendance in advance, particularly for meetings that require voting or critical decision-making.

Sub-Section 1.7 Failure to Meet Quorum

● If quorum is not met for a scheduled meeting, the chairperson shall announce an official adjournment, and the meeting will be rescheduled. The subsequent meeting shall require only two-thirds of the original quorum requirement.

● For urgent matters that cannot be postponed, the NEC may conduct an emergency meeting with a reduced quorum as specified in Sub-Section 1.4, but any decisions will require ratification at the next full meeting with quorum.

Sub-Section 1.8 Proxy Attendance

● Members unable to attend may send a proxy, provided written authorization is submitted at least 24 hours in advance. The proxy attendee shall have the same voting rights as the member they represent.

● Proxy attendance is limited to general meetings and select committee meetings, with a maximum of two proxy votes per meeting.

Sub-Section 1.9 Quorum Verification for Voting and Decision-Making

● The quorum count must be verified by the meeting secretary before any voting or official decisions are made.

● For online meetings, this includes verifying that quorum members remain present throughout the decision-making process, using attendance tracking features provided by the platform.

Sub-Section 1.10 Quorum Reporting

● The chairperson or secretary shall report the quorum status at the beginning of each meeting, ensuring that all members are aware that the necessary quorum has been achieved.

● An official record of quorum, including names of attendees and proxies, shall be attached to the meeting minutes for transparency and verification.

Section 2: Voting Procedures

Sub-Section 2.1 Secret Ballot Voting

● Voting in in-person meetings shall be conducted by secret ballot to protect the confidentiality of each member's choice and ensure unbiased outcomes.

● Ballots shall be collected and counted by a designated election committee or impartial volunteers who are appointed by the NEC prior to the meeting.

● Measures shall be taken to prevent duplication of votes, with each voter required to present a valid KUCSA identification for verification purposes before receiving a ballot.

Sub-Section 2.2 Digital Voting for Online Meetings

● For online meetings, KUCSA shall use secure digital voting systems that ensure confidentiality and accuracy, such as encrypted online voting tools or platforms with secure access features.

● Members will be required to authenticate their identity via unique login credentials provided by KUCSA to participate in online voting.

● The digital voting system shall be tested in advance to prevent technical disruptions, and any issues shall be immediately reported to the NEC for resolution.

Sub-Section 2.3 Voting Rights

● Each member is entitled to one vote on each matter presented for a decision. This ensures equal representation and fairness in the decision-making process.

● Voting rights are non-transferable, and members cannot delegate their voting privilege to a proxy except in circumstances expressly permitted by KUCSA’s by-laws.

Sub-Section 2.4 Simple Majority Vote

● Decisions shall be made by a simple majority vote unless otherwise specified in the constitution or by-laws, with more than 50% of votes cast in favor required for approval.

● For decisions requiring more than a simple majority (e.g., constitutional amendments or dissolution of the association), the specific voting threshold will be outlined in the relevant articles of the constitution.

Sub-Section 2.5 Tie-Breaking Procedure

● In cases where votes result in a tie, the chairperson shall cast the deciding vote to resolve the matter.

● The chairperson’s vote in a tie-breaking situation shall be documented in the minutes, along with the rationale for their decision if applicable.

● If the chairperson is unavailable or unable to vote, the NEC shall appoint a temporary chairperson from within the council to cast the tie-breaking vote.

Sub-Section 2.6 Proxy Voting

● Proxy voting shall be permitted in certain general meetings or group meetings, provided that members submit a formal authorization for their proxy in writing to the NEC at least 24 hours before the meeting.

● A proxy holder shall have the same voting rights as the member they represent and must follow all voting procedures, including confidentiality requirements.

● Proxy voting shall not be permitted in executive or special emergency meetings.

Sub-Section 2.7 Recording and Transparency of Votes

● For transparency, the total number of votes cast, including approvals, rejections, abstentions, and any invalid votes, shall be recorded and documented in the meeting minutes.

● Voting results shall be announced by the NEC or designated election officer immediately following the count, and members may request access to an anonymized summary of the voting outcomes if necessary.

● For digital votes, a secure report of voting data shall be generated by the online voting system and stored as part of KUCSA’s official records.

Sub-Section 2.8 Confidentiality and Anonymity of Votes

● The confidentiality of each member’s vote shall be prioritized, with measures in place to ensure that individual votes remain anonymous unless a member voluntarily discloses their own vote.

● Members of the election committee or any individuals handling ballots or digital voting data are bound by KUCSA’s confidentiality policies and may face disciplinary action for breaches.

Sub-Section 2.9 Absentee Voting

● Absentee voting may be allowed for members unable to attend certain key meetings (such as the AGM or elections), provided they submit a valid reason and complete an absentee voting form in advance.

● Absentee votes shall be counted alongside in-person and digital votes, with appropriate measures to prevent duplication or tampering.

● Absentee voting procedures and deadlines shall be communicated to all members through official channels prior to the meeting.

Sub-Section 2.10 Review and Validation of Voting Processes

● All voting processes shall be reviewed annually by the NEC to ensure that they are transparent, fair, and up-to-date with current technology standards.

● Any member may raise concerns regarding voting irregularities, which shall be reviewed by the NEC and, if necessary, a neutral third-party auditor.

● Any votes deemed irregular or invalid by the NEC or election committee shall be excluded from the final tally, and corrective measures will be communicated to the members.

Sub-Section 2.11 Announcement and Documentation of Voting Outcomes

● Voting outcomes shall be formally documented in the meeting minutes and made available to members within seven days of the meeting’s conclusion.

● For major decisions impacting the association’s policies, financial matters, or constitution, a summary of the voting outcomes, including key arguments and implications, shall be provided to members to promote transparency and informed engagement.

CHAPTER SEVEN: CODE OF CONDUCT

Article 12: Member Conduct

Section 1: Code of Ethics

Sub-Section 1.1 Integrity and Professionalism

● Clause 1.1.1 Members shall demonstrate honesty, fairness, and transparency in all KUCSA activities, refraining from any form of dishonest behavior, including fraud, misrepresentation, and deception.

● Clause 1.1.2 Members shall maintain confidentiality regarding sensitive information about KUCSA or its members unless disclosure is required by law or the NEC.

● Clause 1.1.3 Members shall be punctual and reliable in fulfilling their responsibilities within KUCSA, demonstrating accountability in all engagements.

● Clause 1.1.4 Members shall seek continuous improvement in their roles within KUCSA by pursuing knowledge, skills, and experiences that align with the association’s mission.

Sub-Section 1.2 Representation and Responsibility

● Clause 1.2.1 Members shall act in a manner that reflects positively on KUCSA, upholding its values, mission, and reputation.

● Clause 1.2.2 Members shall avoid behavior that may bring disrepute to KUCSA, including public misconduct or unethical actions.

● Clause 1.2.3 Members in leadership roles are expected to lead by example, displaying high standards of conduct that inspire trust and respect within the KUCSA community.

Sub-Section 1.3 Respect for Diversity and Inclusion

● Clause 1.3.1 Members shall treat others with dignity, recognizing and valuing the diversity of perspectives, cultures, and identities within KUCSA.

● Clause 1.3.2 Members shall refrain from expressing or promoting discriminatory, derogatory, or offensive language or behavior based on race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, religion, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

● Clause 1.3.3 Members shall actively work to create an inclusive environment, encouraging dialogue and collaboration that respect and celebrate diversity.

Sub-Section 1.4 Prohibition of Harassment and Discrimination

● Clause 1.4.1 Members shall not engage in any form of harassment, whether physical, verbal, written, or electronic, against other members or the public.

○ Sub-Clause 1.4.1.1 Physical harassment includes any form of unwelcome physical contact, intimidation, or coercion.

○ Sub-Clause 1.4.1.2 Verbal harassment includes the use of derogatory language, threats, or offensive jokes directed at any individual or group.

● Clause 1.4.2 Discriminatory behavior, including the unequal treatment of individuals based on personal attributes such as race, gender, or disability, is strictly prohibited within KUCSA.

● Clause 1.4.3 KUCSA will enforce a zero-tolerance policy towards bullying, whether in-person or online, with appropriate disciplinary actions taken against offenders.

Sub-Section 1.5 Compliance with Policies and Laws

● Clause 1.5.1 Members are expected to comply with all KUCSA policies, procedures, and bylaws in all actions undertaken within the scope of the association’s activities.

● Clause 1.5.2 Members shall abide by all local, national, and international laws and regulations, particularly those relevant to the association’s operations and their role within KUCSA.

● Clause 1.5.3 Members involved in illegal activities, whether within or outside KUCSA, that may impact the association’s reputation or operations shall be subject to disciplinary actio

● Clause 1.5.4 Members shall promptly report any known violations of KUCSA’s Code of Ethics, policies, or legal obligations to the appropriate authority within the association.

Sub-Section 1.6 Conflict of Interest

● Clause 1.6.1 Members shall disclose any actual, perceived, or potential conflicts of interest, refraining from participating in discussions or decisions that may be influenced by personal or financial gain.

○ Sub-Clause 1.6.1.1 Conflicts of interest may include financial, familial, or personal interests that could affect impartiality in carrying out KUCSA duties.

● Clause 1.6.2 Members shall not misuse KUCSA resources or information for personal benefit or that of associates.

● Clause 1.6.3 Any conflict of interest disclosure shall be submitted in writing to the NEC, which shall assess and provide guidance on the necessary course of action.

Sub-Section 1.7 Confidentiality and Data Protection

● Clause 1.7.1 Members shall safeguard all confidential and proprietary information related to KUCSA, refraining from unauthorized disclosure.

● Clause 1.7.2 Members shall comply with data protection regulations and KUCSA policies regarding the collection, storage, and sharing of members’ personal data.

● Clause 1.7.3 Access to sensitive information shall be limited to members with specific authorization, and any breaches shall be reported immediately to the NEC.

Sub-Section 1.8 Environmental Responsibility

● Clause 1.8.1 Members shall practice environmental responsibility, minimizing waste and promoting sustainable practices within KUCSA activities.

● Clause 1.8.2 Members shall avoid actions that contribute to environmental harm and are encouraged to promote initiatives that support environmental sustainability within the KUCSA community.

● Clause 1.8.3 KUCSA will support members who propose or engage in projects that aim to raise environmental awareness or reduce the environmental impact of KUCSA operations.

Sub-Section 1.9 Social Responsibility and Community Engagement

● Clause 1.9.1 Members shall contribute to the community and society positively, promoting KUCSA’s role as a socially responsible organization.

● Clause 1.9.2 Members are encouraged to volunteer in community outreach programs and initiatives that align with KUCSA’s values and mission.

● Clause 1.9.3 KUCSA shall prioritize partnerships and collaborations with organizations that demonstrate a commitment to social responsibility and ethical practices.

Section 2: Conflict of Interest

Sub-Section 2.1 Disclosure of Interests

● Clause 2.1.1 Members are required to disclose any personal, financial, familial, or other interests that could potentially conflict with KUCSA’s objectives, activities, or decisions.

○ Sub-Clause 2.1.1.1 Such disclosures must include any ownership, employment, or directorship interests in organizations that may have dealings or partnerships with KUCSA.

● Clause 2.1.2 Disclosures must be made in writing to the National Executive Council (NEC) at the earliest opportunity or prior to any deliberation on related matters.

● Clause 2.1.3 Members must submit an annual declaration form identifying any standing conflicts of interest, which will be reviewed and recorded by the NEC for transparency and accountability purposes.

● Clause 2.1.4 Any updates or changes in potential conflicts should be promptly communicated to the NEC to ensure continuous compliance.

Sub-Section 2.2 Prohibition of Personal Gain

● Clause 2.2.1 Members shall not exploit their position within KUCSA for personal or financial gain or for the benefit of friends, family, or associates.

○ Sub-Clause 2.2.1.1 Examples of prohibited actions include influencing contracts, grants, or partnerships for personal benefit or using KUCSA resources for private business purposes.

● Clause 2.2.2 Members shall not accept gifts, favors, or hospitality that could reasonably be seen as intended to influence their decisions or actions within KUCSA.

○ Sub-Clause 2.2.2.1 Members may accept minor gifts or hospitality, provided they are of nominal value and do not create a perceived obligation, subject to NEC guidelines.

● Clause 2.2.3 Members in leadership roles must avoid situations where their position or influence could be perceived as coercive or inappropriate.

Sub-Section 2.3 Restrictions on Participating in Decision-Making

● Clause 2.3.1 Any member with a disclosed conflict of interest shall recuse themselves from participating in any discussions, voting, or decision-making processes directly or indirectly related to the matter.

● Clause 2.3.2 The NEC reserves the right to determine whether a conflict of interest necessitates recusal or other actions to maintain the integrity of the decision-making process.

● Clause 2.3.3 In cases where multiple members are conflicted, the NEC shall designate a neutral party to oversee or advise on the decision-making process to ensure transparency and impartiality.

Sub-Section 2.4 Preventive Measures and Training

● Clause 2.4.1 KUCSA shall provide training on conflict of interest policies and best practices to ensure all members understand their responsibilities under this section.

● Clause 2.4.2 KUCSA may implement preventive measures such as independent oversight or conflict review panels to manage and review conflicts of interest in sensitive decisions or projects.

● Clause 2.4.3 KUCSA shall periodically review its conflict of interest policy and procedures to ensure they are effective and aligned with ethical standards and best practices.

Sub-Section 2.5 Disciplinary Action for Violations

● Clause 2.5.1 Any member found to be in violation of the conflict of interest policies shall be referred to the Disciplinary Committee for investigation and appropriate action.

○ Sub-Clause 2.5.1.1 Actions may include warnings, suspension from specific duties, or removal from office, depending on the severity of the violation.

● Clause 2.5.2 The Disciplinary Committee shall provide a fair and unbiased review, giving the member an opportunity to explain their actions and intentions related to the alleged conflict.

● Clause 2.5.3 Any member found in repeated violation of conflict of interest rules may face permanent removal from KUCSA membership and be barred from holding any future position within the association.

● Clause 2.5.4 The findings and actions of the Disciplinary Committee related to conflict of interest cases shall be recorded and maintained as part of KUCSA’s official records.

Sub-Section 2.6 Transparency and Public Reporting

● Clause 2.6.1 The NEC shall publish an annual report on conflicts of interest, including the number of disclosures, reviews conducted, and actions taken, to uphold transparency within KUCSA.

● Clause 2.6.2 The NEC may redact sensitive information in its public reports to protect the privacy of members, provided that transparency and accountability are maintained.

● Clause 2.6.3 Summaries of significant conflict of interest cases, including the outcome, may be shared with members to serve as educational examples and reinforce the importance of integrity.

Section 3: Disciplinary Action

Sub-Section 3.1 Authority of the National Executive Council (NEC)

● Clause 3.1.1 The NEC holds the authority to impose disciplinary measures on any member found to be in violation of KUCSA’s code of ethics or any other policies governing member conduct.

● Clause 3.1.2 Disciplinary measures may include a range of actions such as verbal warnings, written warnings, probation, temporary suspension, or expulsion from KUCSA.

● Clause 3.1.3 In cases where urgent disciplinary action is necessary to protect KUCSA’s reputation or members’ safety, the NEC may enact immediate provisional measures pending further investigation.

Sub-Section 3.2 Types of Infractions and Corresponding Actions

● Clause 3.2.1 Minor Infractions

○ Sub-Clause 3.2.1.1 Minor infractions include first-time or inadvertent breaches of KUCSA’s code of ethics that do not cause harm or significant disruption to KUCSA’s activities.

○ Sub-Clause 3.2.1.2 Members found to have committed minor infractions shall typically receive a verbal warning or a formal written warning, with guidance on corrective action.

● Clause 3.2.2 Major Infractions

○ Sub-Clause 3.2.2.1 Major infractions involve repeated, intentional, or severe violations that compromise the integrity, safety, or function of KUCSA, or that bring significant disrepute to the association.

○ Sub-Clause 3.2.2.2 Disciplinary measures for major infractions may include temporary suspension, probation, or in severe cases, expulsion from KUCSA.

● Clause 3.2.3 Egregious Infractions

○ Sub-Clause 3.2.3.1 Egregious infractions involve violations of an extreme nature, such as engaging in criminal activities, fraud, or actions that endanger the physical or psychological well-being of others.

○ Sub-Clause 3.2.3.2 Members found responsible for egregious infractions shall face expulsion from KUCSA and may be referred to legal authorities if appropriate.

Sub-Section 3.3 Disciplinary Procedure

● Clause 3.3.1 Notice of Alleged Misconduct

○ Sub-Clause 3.3.1.1 The NEC shall issue a written notice to any member accused of misconduct, specifying the nature of the allegations and providing a summary of the evidence supporting the claim.

○ Sub-Clause 3.3.1.2 The accused member shall be given an opportunity to respond to the allegations in writing or in a hearing, within seven (7) days of receiving the notice.

● Clause 3.3.2 Investigation and Hearing

○ Sub-Clause 3.3.2.1 The NEC or an appointed Disciplinary Committee shall conduct a fair and thorough investigation, ensuring the accused member’s right to a fair hearing.

○ Sub-Clause 3.3.2.2 During the hearing, both the NEC or Disciplinary Committee and the accused member shall have the opportunity to present evidence, call witnesses, and provide statements.

○ Sub-Clause 3.3.2.3 All investigations and hearings shall be conducted in a manner that respects the confidentiality and dignity of all parties involved.

Sub-Section 3.4 Disciplinary Actions and Penalties

● Clause 3.4.1 Warning

○ Sub-Clause 3.4.1.1 A warning may be issued for minor infractions, which may be verbal or written, and should include advice on corrective action.

● Clause 3.4.2 Probation

○ Sub-Clause 3.4.2.1 Members placed on probation will have limited access to certain privileges and responsibilities within KUCSA and will be required to comply with specific conditions set by the NEC.

○ Sub-Clause 3.4.2.2 Probationary terms shall not exceed six (6) months, after which the member’s conduct shall be reviewed.

● Clause 3.4.3 Suspension

○ Sub-Clause 3.4.3.1 A suspended member shall lose all rights and privileges of membership for a specified period, not exceeding one (1) year, after which eligibility for reinstatement will be assessed.

● Clause 3.4.4 Expulsion

○ Sub-Clause 3.4.4.1 Expulsion is the most severe disciplinary action and results in the permanent removal of membership and all associated rights.

○ Sub-Clause 3.4.4.2 Members who are expelled may not reapply for membership in KUCSA unless expressly authorized by the NEC under exceptional circumstances.

Sub-Section 3.5 Appeals Process

● Clause 3.5.1 Right to Appeal

○ Sub-Clause 3.5.1.1 Any member subject to disciplinary action has the right to appeal the decision to the Disciplinary Committee within fourteen (14) days of receiving notice of the action

○ Sub-Clause 3.5.1.2 Appeals must be submitted in writing and include detailed reasons for contesting the decision, along with any supporting evidence.

● Clause 3.5.2 Review by the Disciplinary Committee

○ Sub-Clause 3.5.2.1 The Disciplinary Committee shall review the appeal within thirty (30) days and may affirm, modify, or overturn the original decision based on the merits of the case.

○ Sub-Clause 3.5.2.2 The Disciplinary Committee’s decision on the appeal shall be final and binding, with no further right to appeal within KUCSA.

Sub-Section 3.6 Confidentiality and Transparency

● Clause 3.6.1 All disciplinary matters, including investigations, hearings, and outcomes, shall be treated with strict confidentiality to protect the privacy and integrity of all individuals involved.

● Clause 3.6.2 The NEC shall provide an annual report summarizing disciplinary actions taken within KUCSA, ensuring transparency while protecting the identities of those involved.

● Clause 3.6.3 KUCSA members have a right to access information about disciplinary policies and procedures, fostering an informed and accountable membership.

Article 13: Disciplinary Committee

Section 1: Composition

Sub-Section 1.1 Membership and Appointment

● Clause 1.1.1 The Disciplinary Committee shall consist of five appointed members, selected by the National Executive Council (NEC) to ensure diversity in skills, perspectives, and backgrounds.

● Clause 1.1.2 The committee shall include a Chairperson, Vice-Chairperson, and three other members, with a requirement for balanced gender representation and equitable regional representation.

● Clause 1.1.3 Members shall be chosen based on experience, integrity, and commitment to upholding KUCSA’s values, with priority given to individuals with relevant disciplinary or ethical oversight experience.

Sub-Section 1.2 Role Specifications and Qualifications

● Clause 1.2.1 Chairperson

○ Sub-Clause 1.2.1.1 The Chairperson is responsible for presiding over disciplinary proceedings, setting the agenda for meetings, and ensuring due process is followed in all cases.

○ Sub-Clause 1.2.1.2 The Chairperson must have prior experience in leadership, dispute resolution, or a related field.

● Clause 1.2.2 Vice-Chairperson

○ Sub-Clause 1.2.2.1 The Vice-Chairperson shall support the Chairperson in disciplinary matters and assume their responsibilities in the event of absence or recusal.

○ Sub-Clause 1.2.2.2 The Vice-Chairperson should possess strong communication and organizational skills.

● Clause 1.2.3 Other Members

○ Sub-Clause 1.2.3.1 Three additional members shall be appointed, ensuring that at least one legal advisor with expertise in student rights and disciplinary procedures is included in the committee.

○ Sub-Clause 1.2.3.2 One of these members shall represent the general student body, bringing a student perspective to the committee’s considerations.

Sub-Section 1.3 Term of Service and Renewal

● Clause 1.3.1 Members of the Disciplinary Committee shall serve a one-year term, starting from the date of their appointment by the NEC.

● Clause 1.3.2 Renewal

○ Sub-Clause 1.3.2.1 Members may be reappointed for additional terms, subject to a performance review and approval by the NEC.

○ Sub-Clause 1.3.2.2 No member shall serve more than three consecutive terms to allow for fresh perspectives and prevent entrenched biases within the committee.

Sub-Section 1.4 Committee Integrity and Impartiality

● Clause 1.4.1 Conflict of Interest

○ Sub-Clause 1.4.1.1 All members of the Disciplinary Committee must disclose any personal or professional conflicts of interest prior to involvement in a case.

○ Sub-Clause 1.4.1.2 Members with a conflict of interest in a particular case shall recuse themselves to ensure impartiality, and a temporary replacement may be appointed by the NEC.

● Clause 1.4.2 Code of Conduct

○ Sub-Clause 1.4.2.1 Committee members are held to a high standard of integrity and professionalism and must act in a manner that upholds KUCSA’s values and promotes fairness in disciplinary proceedings.

○ Sub-Clause 1.4.2.2 Breaches of conduct by committee members shall result in removal from the committee and potential further disciplinary actions by the NEC.

Sub-Section 1.5 Quorum and Decision-Making

● Clause 1.5.1 Quorum

○ Sub-Clause 1.5.1.1 A minimum of four members, including the Chairperson or Vice-Chairperson, must be present to establish a quorum for disciplinary hearings or decision-making.

○ Sub-Clause 1.5.1.2 If a quorum is not met, the hearing shall be rescheduled to a later date within seven (7) days.

● Clause 1.5.2 Voting

○ Sub-Clause 1.5.2.1 Decisions on disciplinary matters shall be made by majority vote, with each member holding one vote.

○ Sub-Clause 1.5.2.2 In the event of a tie, the Chairperson shall cast the deciding vote, or, if absent, the Vice-Chairperson.

Sub-Section 1.6 Removal and Replacement of Members

● Clause 1.6.1 Grounds for Removal

○ Sub-Clause 1.6.1.1 Members of the Disciplinary Committee may be removed by the NEC for reasons including, but not limited to, misconduct, incapacity, negligence, or failure to adhere to KUCSA’s code of ethics.

● Clause 1.6.2 Replacement Process

○ Sub-Clause 1.6.2.1 In the event of a vacancy, the NEC shall appoint a replacement within thirty (30) days to ensure the committee maintains its operational capacity.

○ Sub-Clause 1.6.2.2 Replacement members shall serve the remainder of the term of the member they replace, unless reappointed for a new term by the NEC.

Section 2: Roles and Responsibilities

Sub-Section 2.1 Investigative Functions

● Clause 2.1.1 Complaint Assessment

○ Sub-Clause 2.1.1.1 The Disciplinary Committee shall assess all complaints and allegations of misconduct submitted by KUCSA members, stakeholders, or the public to determine if they fall within the committee’s jurisdiction.

○ Sub-Clause 2.1.1.2 Complaints must be documented in writing, specifying details of the alleged misconduct, and supported by evidence where applicable.

● Clause 2.1.2 Investigation Process

○ Sub-Clause 2.1.2.1 The committee shall gather all necessary evidence, interview relevant witnesses, and collect statements from the accused and complainant(s) to ensure a thorough investigation.

○ Sub-Clause 2.1.2.2 Investigations shall be conducted within a reasonable time frame, not exceeding 30 days from the receipt of the complaint, unless additional time is justified by the complexity of the case.

● Clause 2.1.3 Temporary Measures

○ Sub-Clause 2.1.3.1 During an investigation, the committee may recommend temporary measures, such as temporary suspension, to the NEC if deemed necessary to protect KUCSA’s interests or prevent potential harm.

Sub-Section 2.2 Principles of Fairness, Impartiality, and Confidentiality

● Clause 2.2.1 Fairness

○ Sub-Clause 2.2.1.1 The committee shall ensure that all members involved in disciplinary proceedings receive equitable treatment, with a right to respond to any allegations made against them.

○ Sub-Clause 2.2.1.2 Members shall be informed in writing of the nature of the complaint, the process, and their rights throughout the proceedings.

● Clause 2.2.2 Impartiality

○ Sub-Clause 2.2.2.1 Committee members must approach each case without bias, ensuring no conflict of interest influences the investigation or decision-making process.

○ Sub-Clause 2.2.2.2 Members with a personal or professional connection to the parties involved shall recuse themselves from the proceedings to maintain objectivity.

● Clause 2.2.3 Confidentiality

○ Sub-Clause 2.2.3.1 All disciplinary cases shall be handled with strict confidentiality, and members of the committee are prohibited from disclosing details to unauthorized individuals.

○ Sub-Clause 2.2.3.2 Records and proceedings shall be stored securely and accessible only to authorized committee members and the NEC, unless disclosure is required by law.

Sub-Section 2.3 Documentation and Record-Keeping

● Clause 2.3.1 Case Documentation

○ Sub-Clause 2.3.1.1 The committee shall document all proceedings, including the details of the complaint, evidence presented, statements from involved parties, and final decisions.

○ Sub-Clause 2.3.1.2 Each case file shall include a summary of the case, the disciplinary measures taken, and the rationale behind the committee’s decision.

● Clause 2.3.2 Resolution Records

○ Sub-Clause 2.3.2.1 A record of all resolved cases, including disciplinary actions implemented, shall be maintained for future reference, performance evaluation, and policy improvement purposes.

○ Sub-Clause 2.3.2.2 Case resolution summaries shall be made available to the NEC, with de-identified information, to ensure transparency and accountability within KUCSA.

Sub-Section 2.4 Disciplinary Decision-Making

● Clause 2.4.1 Range of Disciplinary Measures

○ Sub-Clause 2.4.1.1 The committee may impose various disciplinary actions based on the severity and nature of the misconduct, ranging from warnings to expulsion, as outlined in Chapter Seven.

○ Sub-Clause 2.4.1.2 Disciplinary measures may include verbal or written warnings, suspension, community service requirements, expulsion from KUCSA, or other corrective actions as deemed appropriate.

● Clause 2.4.2 Decision Criteria

○ Sub-Clause 2.4.2.1 Decisions shall be based on factual evidence, the nature and impact of the alleged misconduct, and any mitigating or aggravating factors presented.

○ Sub-Clause 2.4.2.2 The committee shall apply consistent standards across cases to maintain fairness and uphold KUCSA’s code of ethics.

Sub-Section 2.5 Reporting and Accountability

● Clause 2.5.1 Periodic Reporting

○ Sub-Clause 2.5.1.1 The Disciplinary Committee shall submit a quarterly report to the NEC summarizing the number and type of cases handled, actions taken, and any recommendations for policy amendments or additional resources needed.

○ Sub-Clause 2.5.1.2 Reports shall exclude identifiable information about individual cases to protect member privacy while providing insights into trends and areas for improvement.

● Clause 2.5.2 Policy Improvement Recommendations

○ Sub-Clause 2.5.2.1 Based on case trends and observations, the committee may recommend changes to KUCSA’s policies, procedures, or code of ethics to prevent recurring issues.

○ Sub-Clause 2.5.2.2 Recommendations shall be reviewed by the NEC and incorporated as necessary to improve KUCSA’s governance and disciplinary standards.

Sub-Section 2.6 Appeals and Review

● Clause 2.6.1 Right to Appea

○ Sub-Clause 2.6.1.1 Members subjected to disciplinary measures have the right to appeal to the NEC, which may conduct a secondary review to ensure fairness.

○ Sub-Clause 2.6.1.2 Appeals must be submitted within 14 days of the committee’s decision, providing grounds for the appeal, including new evidence, procedural errors, or claims of unfair treatment.

● Clause 2.6.2 Appeal Decision-Making

○ Sub-Clause 2.6.2.1 The NEC shall appoint an ad hoc appeals panel to review cases independently of the Disciplinary Committee.

○ Sub-Clause 2.6.2.2 The appeals panel may confirm, modify, or overturn the original disciplinary decision, based on the appeal’s merits and any additional evidence provided.

Section 3: Disciplinary Procedure

Sub-Section 3.1 Right to Fair Hearing

● Clause 3.1.1 Notification of Allegations

○ Sub-Clause 3.1.1.1 Any member accused of misconduct shall be notified in writing of the allegations against them within seven days of the complaint being filed with the Disciplinary Committee.

○ Sub-Clause 3.1.1.2 The notification shall include a summary of the alleged misconduct, potential consequences, and the scheduled date of the disciplinary hearing.

● Clause 3.1.2 Hearing Process

○ Sub-Clause 3.1.2.1 The accused member shall have the right to be present at the hearing, to present evidence, call witnesses, and make a statement in their defense.

○ Sub-Clause 3.1.2.2 The committee shall provide all parties involved with an opportunity to cross-examine witnesses, ensuring a balanced and fair hearing.

● Clause 3.1.3 Access to Representation

○ Sub-Clause 3.1.3.1 The accused member may choose to be accompanied by an advisor or representative, who may assist in presenting their defense but may not directly address the committee.

○ Sub-Clause 3.1.3.2 The advisor may include a student advocate, legal counsel, or a fellow KUCSA member with no direct interest in the case.

Sub-Section 3.2 Investigation and Decision Timeline

● Clause 3.2.1 Thorough Investigation

○ Sub-Clause 3.2.1.1 The committee shall conduct a comprehensive investigation, gathering all relevant facts, reviewing evidence, and interviewing witnesses as needed to establish a clear understanding of the case.

○ Sub-Clause 3.2.1.2 The investigation should be conducted in a non-prejudicial manner, allowing both the complainant and the accused an equal opportunity to present their sides.

● Clause 3.2.2 Timely Judgment

○ Sub-Clause 3.2.2.1 The committee shall provide an impartial and well-documented judgment within 30 days of receiving the complaint unless the complexity of the case requires an extension.

○ Sub-Clause 3.2.2.2 If additional time is required, the committee must communicate the reason for the delay to all parties involved and establish a revised timeline, not exceeding 15 additional days.

Sub-Section 3.3 Range of Disciplinary Measures

● Clause 3.3.1 Warnings

○ Sub-Clause 3.3.1.1 Verbal Warnings: Minor infractions may result in a verbal warning, with a record of the warning kept on file but not publicly disclosed.

○ Sub-Clause 3.3.1.2 Written Warnings: For repeated or moderate infractions, a formal written warning shall be issued, detailing the nature of the offense, consequences of further violations, and required corrective actions.

● Clause 3.3.2 Suspension

○ Sub-Clause 3.3.2.1 Temporary Suspension: For serious infractions, members may be temporarily suspended from KUCSA activities and benefits for a period of 1 to 6 months, based on the severity of the misconduct.

○ Sub-Clause 3.3.2.2 Conditions for Reinstatement: Suspended members must fulfill any conditions set by the committee before reinstatement, such as completing educational workshops or making restitution for any harm caused.

● Clause 3.3.3 Revocation of Privileges

○ Sub-Clause 3.3.3.1 KUCSA Leadership Positions: Members holding positions within KUCSA may have their leadership roles temporarily or permanently revoked if found guilty of misconduct.

○ Sub-Clause 3.3.3.2 Access to Resources: Members may be restricted from using certain KUCSA facilities, resources, or services for a defined period as part of disciplinary measures.

● Clause 3.3.4 Expulsion

○ Sub-Clause 3.3.4.1 Permanent Expulsion: Members found guilty of severe violations that bring significant disrepute to KUCSA or endanger other members may face permanent expulsion from the association.

○ Sub-Clause 3.3.4.2 Appeal Option: Expelled members shall have the right to appeal the decision within 14 days and request a review from the NEC, provided new evidence or procedural irregularities are presented.

Sub-Section 3.4 Documentation and Communication of Decisions

● Clause 3.4.1 Written Records

○ Sub-Clause 3.4.1.1 All disciplinary hearings, evidence, and decisions shall be documented in a written report, maintained in KUCSA’s confidential records, and accessible only to authorized personnel.

○ Sub-Clause 3.4.1.2 The report shall include the nature of the misconduct, summary of the proceedings, final decision, and rationale for the disciplinary measures imposed.

● Clause 3.4.2 Notification of Outcomes

○ Sub-Clause 3.4.2.1 The accused member and the complainant shall receive a written summary of the decision within five days of the committee’s judgment, outlining the findings, penalties, and any corrective actions required.

○ Sub-Clause 3.4.2.2 In cases of expulsion or suspension, the NEC may notify relevant KUCSA bodies or affiliated institutions to enforce the disciplinary measures as needed.

Sub-Section 3.5 Appeals Process

● Clause 3.5.1 Right to Appeal

○ Sub-Clause 3.5.1.1 Any member subject to disciplinary action may appeal the decision to the NEC within 14 days, stating the grounds for the appeal and any new evidence or mitigating factors.

○ Sub-Clause 3.5.1.2 The appeals process shall be conducted within 21 days of receiving the appeal request, during which an ad hoc appeals panel shall review the original case file and any new information.

● Clause 3.5.2 Decision on Appeal

○ Sub-Clause 3.5.2.1 The appeals panel may uphold, modify, or overturn the original decision based on the evidence presented in the appeal.

○ Sub-Clause 3.5.2.2 The final decision on appeal shall be communicated to all involved parties in writing, with any adjusted disciplinary measures taking immediate effect where applicable.

Sub-Section 3.6 Rehabilitation and Reintegration

● Clause 3.6.1 Support for Reinstatement

○ Sub-Clause 3.6.1.1 KUCSA shall provide resources, such as counseling or mentorship, to assist members who have completed disciplinary measures and wish to reintegrate.

○ Sub-Clause 3.6.1.2 Reinstated members may be required to participate in a KUCSA program designed to enhance understanding of KUCSA’s code of conduct and organizational values.

Section 4: Appeals

Sub-Section 4.1 Right to Appeal

● Clause 4.1.1 Submission of Formal Appeal

○ Sub-Clause 4.1.1.1 A member who wishes to appeal any disciplinary action imposed by the NEC or the Disciplinary Committee must submit a formal written appeal within 14 days of receiving the disciplinary decision.

○ Sub-Clause 4.1.1.2 The appeal shall be submitted to the NEC, and it must clearly outline the grounds for the appeal, including any new evidence or factors that were not considered during the original hearing.

● Clause 4.1.2 Grounds for Appeal

○ Sub-Clause 4.1.2.1 Appeals may be based on the following grounds:

■ (i) Procedural errors or violations of the KUCSA Constitution or Disciplinary Committee guidelines during the original hearing.

■ (ii) Presentation of new, relevant evidence that could not have been reasonably discovered before the original hearing.

■ (iii) The severity of the disciplinary action being disproportionate to the misconduct.

■ (iv) Misinterpretation or misapplication of KUCSA policies or the law.

○ Sub-Clause 4.1.2.2 The Appeals Panel shall not reconsider the facts of the case unless new evidence is presented that was not available during the original hearing.

Sub-Section 4.2 Appeals Panel

● Clause 4.2.1 Constitution of the Appeals Panel

○ Sub-Clause 4.2.1.1 The Appeals Panel shall be a separate body from the original Disciplinary Committee and shall consist of three to five members, appointed by the NEC.

○ Sub-Clause 4.2.1.2 The panel shall include at least one legal expert, one member from the student body, and one member with experience in disciplinary matters, ensuring neutrality and fairness in the appeals process.

○ Sub-Clause 4.2.1.3 No member of the original Disciplinary Committee shall be part of the Appeals Panel for the same case to prevent conflicts of interest.

● Clause 4.2.2 Review of the Appeal

○ Sub-Clause 4.2.2.1 The Appeals Panel shall thoroughly review the submitted appeal, including all supporting documents, the original hearing report, and any new evidence provided by the appellant.

○ Sub-Clause 4.2.2.2 The panel shall have the discretion to conduct hearings, during which the appellant may present oral arguments or clarify points raised in their written appeal.
